loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila C. has been selling fish since 1999. She is 48 years old and has nine children. Her husband, Capistrano C., is a fisherman but the fish her husband catches is mainly intended for family consumption. Leonila buys fish from other fishermen and sells them to the village with a 40% mark-up value to earn a living. She has a big family and she and her husband really work very hard to meet all their needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials, like baits and nets. She will also buy more fish to sell in the village.

CEVI provides people with not just loans. They also offer training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials, like baits and nets, and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo R. D. Leon es casado del cual D. este matrimonio se concibió dos hijas. 
El adquirió una casa D. interés social pero estas son muy pequeñas solo consta con dos recamaras, sala y comedor muy angostos que muy apenas caben sus muebles. 
Ahora la joven pareja desea construir un cuarto al frente D. esta vivienda para que este mas amplia y cómoda al momento D. que sus hijas crezcan cada una D. ella tega su propia habitación y su privacidad.
La esposa solo se dedica al hogar como al cuidado D. sus hijas para brindarles mejor protección y atención, Ricardo es el sostén D. la casa y trabaja como empleado D. una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Ricardo R. D. Leon is married and from this marriage he has two daughters. He acquired a Social Interest house, but they are very small, consisting of only 2 bedrooms, a living room, and a dining room. The space is very tight, so that his furniture barely fits. Now the young couple wants to build a room in the front of the house, so that it is bigger and more comfortable when their daughters grow, and each can have her own room and privacy. His wife is a homemaker who cares for their daughters in order to offer them better protection and attention; Ricardo is the breadwinner of the house and works as an employee of an assembly plant.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy abnegada y trabajadora, está separada de su pareja y vive con 3 de sus 7 hijos. Por más de 15 años viene elaborando y vendiendo tamales (plato típico), cuando sus hijos están libres el más pequeño es el encargado de moler el maíz, ella amasa y sus otros hijos, en competencia, envuelven el tamal con hoja de plátano. Para darse abasto, anteriormente Maribel se levantaba a las 2 de la madrugada, ya que prepara entre 400 y 500 tamales para que a las 8 de la mañana los distribuya a sus compradores al por mayor. A base de este trabajo pudo educar y alimentar a todos sus hijos, es por eso que se siente satisfecha con el mismo, pero debido al esfuerzo empezó a sentir dolores musculares, por lo que ahora sólo prepara por las tardes 300 tamales. Una de las dificultades de Maribel es que su hija mayor se fue con su pareja y dejó de pagar un préstamo, que ella ha asumido. Entonces, una vez que termine de pagar esa deuda, su deseo es de renovar su máquina de moler granos, ya que la que tiene actualmente ya no agiliza su trabajo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados demostró responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos y para este nuevo crédito reitera su compromiso. A su banco comunal le tiene mucha estima, ya que la apoyó con créditos que le han permitido seguir trabajando. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de maíz y otros ingredientes para seguir preparando sus tamales.
texts.en:
Maribel is 53 years old. She is a very selfless and hard-working woman. She is separated from her partner and lives with 3 of her 7 children. For more than 15 years she has been making and selling tamales (a traditional dish). When her children are available, the youngest is in charge of grinding the corn, she kneads the dough, and her other children wrap the tamales in banana leaves. To handle all of this work, Maribel used to get up at 2:00am in order to prepare 400 to 500 tamales and distribute them to her wholesale buyers at 8:00am. With this work she was able to feed and educate all of her children, so she was very happy with it, but due to all of the effort, she began to experience muscle pains, and now she only prepares 300 tamales in the afternoons. One of Maribel's difficulties is that her oldest daughter left with her partner and failed to repay a debt, which Maribel has assumed. Once this debt has been repaid, she wants to update her corn grinder, as the one she currently uses does not help her to speed up her work. This is Maribel's fifth loan with MFP. During past cycle she has demonstrated responsibilty in making each of her payments, and for this new loan, she reiterates her commitment. Maribel has great appreciation for her communal bank, which has supported her with loans that have permitted her to continue working. The money she is currently requesting will be used to purchase corn and other ingredients to prepare her tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 60-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohammad has owned an accessory shop for 39 years. He sells toys, souvenirs, makeup, perfume and other accessories. He requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Mohammad has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his products and improved his financial situation. Mohammad's business is special because of his large variety of products and his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Mohammad didn’t face difficulties starting this business. He decided on this venture because, when he was young he used to sell perfumes and makeup, but he lost his job because of the war. That's when he decided to open his own shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells planks retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is a 40-year-old married woman with four children aged 18 - 23 years. All of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with eight people. Saidat takes care of two additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She lives and works in semi-urban area where she is a tailor in one of Kampala's streets. She incurs extra transportation costs from home to work. Saidat owns a sewing machine and is a tailor on Luwum Street. She attends to 4 customers a day on average and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent both at home and at work. She has been in this business for the last five years.

Saidat has been with MCDT for five years and is borrowing her eighth loan with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes to resell. Saidat hopes to see her business grow and to own rental rooms and a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda K. is single and has one child. She has received a junior high school education.  Linda makes traditional soap for sale at Abrodzirum near shama-kedzi, which she has been doing since 2008.  Linda uses her income to pay school fees and settlement of utility bills.  Linda will use the loan to purchase ingredients for soap making. With the new profits from her expanded business, Linda plans to save profit and invest in her child’s education.

loans.use: Linda will use the loan to purchase ingredients for soap making.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith J. is from the village of Panaon. She is 47 years old. Faith is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Faith owns & operates a fruits & vegetable business in the food sector  selling fruits & vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of vegetable products in the local community. Faith has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Faith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Faith is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Faith from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun R. is currently in the business of selling fruit like apples, bananas, etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase fish and cooking oil to sell. Harun is 32 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga F. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Eva. She is single and does not have any children. Tafaoga owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Tafaoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Tafaoga is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. Tafaoga was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 29th September 2009. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es:
Stefany trabaja como secretaria en una clínica es independiente y la única que solventa sus gastos 
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión compra edredones y ropa para dar a crédito.
Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Stefany works as a secretary at a clinic, is independent and responsible for her own expenses. She lives in the Miraflores zone of Cuidad de La Paz, in a rented house. Her loan will go towards investment capital in the purchase of bedspreads and clothing to sell on credit. This is the second time she’s requested a loan from Impro. Her willingness to improve herself has earned the opportunity to obtain this loan

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads and clothing to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 34 años, está casada y es madre D. 7 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia. 
En los años anteriores, junto a su esposo sembraron café y plátanos en sus propias chacras, y ahora sólo se dedican a quitar la maleza, abonar y fumigar. Cada 15 días cosecha los plátanos y los venD. desD. su misma chacra, pero en el caso del café tiene que esperar 12 meses para la cosecha. Mientras ese tiempo trabaja en otras chacras, donD. inicia sus labores a las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 5 D. la tarD., por ese trabajo le pagan 12 soles diarios y a su esposo 13 soles. 
Con estas ganancias vienen supliendo las necesidades del hogar, y auque suele sentirse muy cansada, continúa porque no quiere que sus hijos pasen necesidad D. comida, ni mucho menos D. sus útiles escolares.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que vuelve a comprometerse a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas para que su banco comunal siga confiando en ella. El dinero que ahora requiere lo invertirá en la compra D. fertilizantes químicos, con los piensa abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34, married, and has seven children. She lives with them in her own house. In previous years, she and her husband planted coffee and bananas on their own fields. Now, they only weed, fertilize, and fumigate. Every 15 days they harvest the bananas and sell them from their own farm. But, in the case of the coffee, they need to wait 12 months for the harvest. During this time she works on other farms, where she works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. They pay her 12 PEN daily; they pay her husband 13 PEN. They use these earnings to supply the household necessities. Although it is very tiring, she continues because she does not want their children to lack food or their school supplies. This is her third loan with MFP. She renews her promise to make all of her payments on time so that her communal bank will continue to trust her. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers, which she will use to fertilize her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 51, is married and has given birth to three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim, a town in the Western Region of Ghana. Axim is one of the coastal towns in the region, so many of its residents, including women, go fishing. Others have fishing-related businesses, such as cold storage, fish mongering, etc. 

Grace has been selling fish for six years. She wants a loan to buy fish in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Lucia Ivania

texts.es:
La Señora Lucia Ivania Gómez, Labora como ayudante de cocina en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional  (CECNA), ella tiene una hijos, este se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre Soltera, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido  3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, ella es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales requerido para el cambio del sistema eléctrico de la vivienda, para Brindarle mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Lucia Ivania Gómez works in the kitchen at the Professional Development Center (CECNA). She is a single mother to one school-age daughter. She has been receiving loans from CEPRODEL for three years, during which time she has invested three CEPRODEL loans in improving her home. She is an excellent client. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase the necessary materials for replacing the wiring in her home, in order to make her daughter's life safer and more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 43 years of age, is a widow mother of four children. One of her children is married and lives away from home while the other three are single. Sen M. and her single children currently depend on the revenue from their work as sewing employees in the garment factory. They always walk or take a taxi to work because they don’t have a vehicle. Sen M. would like to own a vehicle but she has no money to buy one. Therefore, she would like to borrow a loan of $1200 to buy a motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: 20-year old Aileen has a two-year old child with her husband Robert. She invested in farming two years ago and is still actively doing this for a living. She said that because of her farm, she was able to start saving some money. She wants to maintain her farm and is now preparing it for planting. She has applied for a loan of 7, 000 Philippine pesos from Kiva field partner CEVI, which she will use to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es: Santos tiene 66 años, por lo que su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Ella tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a su negocio, ya que inicio dando apertura a su negocio, pero ella es muy inteligente pues le gustaba mucho y disfrutaba realizar cada tarea de esta actividad además tiene a sus 3 hijos a su cargo que alimentar diariamente poco a poco fue progresando hasta establecer su negocio en su vivienda. Ella enfrento desafíos como lo fue el incremento de ciertos productos pero este pequeño detalle no la detuvo a seguir con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para su actividad. Su deseo es seguir adelante y obtener la fama de ofrecer un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Santos, 66, butchers pigs. She has been in this line of work for over 5 years. She began her work and, being quite intelligent, she enjoyed every aspect of her job very much. Besides, she has three children under her care whom she must feed every day. Gradually, she made progresss until she was able to set up her business in her home. She faced many challenges, like the rise in prices of certain products, but this small detail did not stop her from continuing with her business. The financing she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her activity. Her wish is to continue advancing and to become reknown for the excellent service she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Lisímaco

texts.es:
Lisímaco B. A., tiene la edad de 65 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 25,18 y 12 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Lisímaco tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Lisímaco B. A. is 65 years old. He is married and has 3 children who are his top priority. They are 25, 18 and 12 years old. He wants the loan to buy some calves and to feed them. He wants to care for the cattle adequately to make the most income possible when they’re sold. He also wants to increase the number of animals and care for them in the best conditions. He has an ideal area to care for and breed cattle. It’s the first time he has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and he’s very happy with how easy they made it for him. Mr. Lisímaco has worked with cattle for various years. He hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future. And he hopes to continue to grow as a person and as a laborer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Jonathan Kipruto

texts.en:
Jonathan is thirty six years old, married and a father of four beautiful children who are all in primary school. 

He plants maize and after the harvest he sells the maize and gets income, he does not only do maize farming but has also diversified to horticulture which he has been doing for the last seven (7) years. His farm is at rock farm in Sergoit Location in Eldoret.

This will be his second loan in KADET and was introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a client. Jonathan will use the entire loan for farming like buying planting seeds, fertilizer and manure. His goals are to become a better farmer, provide basic needs to his family as well as educate all his four children.

loans.use: To buy maize for planting and fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Lorenzo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su padre junto a su hermana menor, su madre es fallecida. Su vivienda está situada en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, zona bastante conocida dentro de la región Lambayeque por sus comidas típicas, la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican al comercio y a la siembra de arroz.

Desde hace más de tres años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo y de otras aves en el mercado central de Ferreñafe. Este mercado es un centro de abastos con bastante afluencia de publico, allí se expenden a la población ferreñafana toda variedad de artículos desde verduras, carnes, prendas de vestir, abarrotes, ferretería y otros. Lleva funcionando 40 años aproximandamente.

Juan es una persona bastante conocida en el mercado debido a que ofrece productos de calidad y un buen trato al cliente, el da todo de si para sacar su negocio adelante ya que es la unica fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta. 

Juan se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en hacer mejoras en su vivienda, pues debido a las lluvias, se ha filtrado agua generando deterioro en su estructura. Juan siempre busca el bienestar de su familia, por ello piensa realizar las mejoras necesarias.

Juan es un joven bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old. He is single and lives in his father's house with his younger sister. His mother passed away. His housing is located in the city of Ferreñafe, an area very well known within the Lambayeque region because of its traditional food. Most of its residents work in trade and growing rice. For three years he has been selling chicken and other poultry in the central market of Ferreñafe. This market is a supply center with a large number of people. There the Ferreñafen people sell all types of items from vegetables, meats, clothing, groceries, hardware and more. It has been operating for 40 years. Juan is a well known person in the market because he offers quality products and good customer service. He gives everything to get his business ahed since it is the only source of income he has. Juan is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he is planning on investing in improving his housing. Due to the rains, water has been leaking, deteriorating the structure. Juan is always looking out for his family's wellbeing and this is why he is planning on undertaking the necesary improvements. Juan is a very hard working young man and dedicated to his family. He has worked before with our institution and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses to repair housing damaged by rain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Sirari Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sirari” esta representado por la señora Masemia y conformado por 15 miembros de las cuales 12 son mujeres y 3 varones los cuales residen en la misma zona, la mayoría de las socias tienen su negocio y otras van a empezar uno nuevo y sobre todo cuentan con lo necesario para salir adelante. La señora Masemia  se dedica a la venta de empanadas y refrescos y también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte, ella desea poder dedicarse con un mayor capital a la venta de empanadas y es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo, ella tiene un niño pequeño y vive en la casa de sus suegros, ella desea poder tener ahorrar para en un futuro no muy lejano poder tener su casa propia. El resto de las socias se dedica a la venta de comida, carne, hamburguesas, cosméticos y al servicio domestico, entre los varones algunos se dedican  al transporte de pasajeros y los otros son empleados de la fabrica de Guabira todos los socios tienen muchos años de experiencia en cada rubro al que se dedican. La competencia en el  mercado en el que se desempeñan las socias no es alta pero las ventas no son muy satisfactorias por lo que se ven en la necesidad de cambiar de mercado para poder obtener mejores ingresos, muchas de las socias que son empleadas domesticas desean poder abrir un negocio que les permita estar mas cerca de su familia, es por esta razón que requieren del crédito que les servirá para capital de trabajo  y en otros casos para incrementar su mercadería, comprar repuestos para sus vehículos y motorizados que son su fuente de trabajo. La mayoría de las socias solo habían escuchado de estos créditos en grupo, pero se encuentran entusiasmados por este apoyo económico que les servirá para poder trabajar y para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Masemia represents the Sirari group, which is comprised of 15 members. There are 12 women and 3 men in the group, and they live in the same area. Most of the members have a business, and others are going to start a new one. Most importantly, they have what it takes to get ahead. Masemia sells empanadas and soft drinks. She also sells cosmetics by catalog. She is married, and her husband works in transportation. She wants to be able to put more capital into her empanada sales. That is the reason she needs the loan. She has a small child, and she lives in her husband’s parents’ house. She wishes to be able to have savings. In the near future she wants to be able to have her own house. The rest of the women sell food, meat, hamburgers, cosmetics, or provide domestic services. Some of the men work in passenger transportation, and the others are employed by the Guabira factory. All of the members have many years of experience in their fields. The competition in the market that the members work in is not high, but the sales are not very satisfactory. Therefore, they see the need to change markets to be able to get better earnings. Many of the members who are domestic employees want to be able to open a business that would allow them to be closer to their families. That is the reason that they need a loan, which would serve as working capital. In other cases the loan is to increase their merchandise or buy replacement parts for their vehicles, which they use for work. Most of the members had only heard about these group loans. But, they are enthusiastic about this economic support, which they will use to be able to work and to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Faty Arelle

texts.fr: Faty Arelle S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus et avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer sa commande de tissus et augmenter sa clientèle. Son objectif est de prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la couverture vestimentaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Faty Arelle S., 43, is a single mother of two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since October 22, 2007, and has received 5 consecutive loans. She has a little business selling cloth and with her new loan, she is planning to bolster her fabric orders and grow her clientele. Her goal is to pay for food, health expenses, and clothing for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and grow her cloth sales business

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Dolgormaa M. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her children, aged 19 and 22, are students. Her husband, Jargalsaihan, works as a driver for a hotel.

Dolgormaa operates a milk-trading business in her district. She owns three cows which produce the milk and she sells it to a store with which she has a supply contract. She has only been operating her business for one year but hopes to purchase another cow in the near future to increase her output.

Dolgormaa is a hardworking person and focused on the future. She sees great potential in her business and says, “I must grow my business to save money so that I can support my children's school tuition fees.” Dolgormaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase another cow and calf for her business

loans.use: To purchase a cow and calf

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra  trabajando, y esta conformada por señoras muy  luchadoras y  humildes, y se esfuerzan y realizan sus actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Fatima quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo.
Ella realiza las ventas de sus prendas de vestir desde su casa  donde expone sus mercaderias.
Ella ademas de la venta de ropas hace comestibles para generar otros ingresos y asi se siente muy satisfecha con las actividades que realiza para ayudar  a su familia.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para invierno como camperas, sueter, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This group is currently in operation and is made up of hard-working, humble women who put in a lot of effort to carry out their activities according to the resources they have available. One of the group members is Fatima who has sold clothing for quite some time. She sells her wares from home which is where she displays them. In addition, she sells food to generate extra income and she feels very satisfied with the activities she’s engaged in to help her family. She is asking for funds to buy winter clothes like: jackets, sweaters, pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall-winter season clothing.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Maria de Jesus B. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Juan Bosco de la ciudad de Choluteca, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, nos comento que por los momentos le va bien con su negocio ya que en los fardos de ropa americana la variedad es muy buena y sobre todo la calidad y la marca de la ropa. esto hace que las prendas se vendan rapido y a un buen precio.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar un fardo de ropa ya que no tiene mucho inventario.
las ganancias las utilizara para cubrir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus B., 29, lives in the San Juan Bosco neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. Maria sells used clothing. She has been doing this work for only a short time. She tells us that at the moment her business is going well, since in the bales of American clothing the variety is very good and so are the quality and the brands of the clothing. Because of this her garments sell quickly and at a good price. She will use this loan to buy a bale of clothing, since she does not have much inventory. She will use the profits to cover the expenses of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en: Mademoiselle Kossiwa M. is 25 years old and sells cosmetics in Lome, Togo. She has been working at the Grand Market in Lome selling cosmetic products since 2008. As a young entrepreneur, Kossiwa sees lots of potential for growth in her business and, to this end, has requested a loan of 120,000 CFA to reinforce her capital and to purchase more products to sell. With her increased earnings she hopes to invest in growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old. Elsa is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 38 years old, married with 3 children.  Jean Baptiste is a hard-working businessman selling shoes.  He has been in this business for a long time and the business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will purchase different styles of shoes for sale.  With these additional shoes to sell, he will hopefully increase his sales as well as profits.  With these profits, he will keep reinvesting in his business for a better financial stability and in addition to that, the living conditions of his family will improve.

loans.use: Different styles of shoes for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Francia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 3 & 4. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in a safe environment. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy dancing.

Francia buys and sells new and used clothing. She has been in business for three years, starting with some money she received from previous employment. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use the profits to increase her sales and to make her business grow. She also wants to save so she can study law, have a store and guide her children into professional lives.

This associate began working with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy new and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Ganesh Maya

texts.en:
Ganesh Maya R. is 46 and married with one child, aged 21. In 2005, she established her general store business. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supoorts her family. With this loan from Patan BPW she wants to add kitchenware to her inventory. In the future, Ganesh Maya plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: buying kitchen ware for general store

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena G. is from the village of Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Filomena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a transportation services business. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Filomena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filomena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help its Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora magdalena es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta en el mismo ya que ha hecho nuevas amistades y también porque en la institución ha encontrado una mano amiga que le ayuda con los créditos. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, la menor esta en colegio y vive con ella aun. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, vende en su casa y también lleva a entregar los productos que sus clientes le piden, vende al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo en dos pagos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 15h00, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil una vez al mes ya que allá hay más variedad y sale más barato.

Este crédito es para comprar mas mercadería. Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y construir un cuarto adecuado para su local.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the population has various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

Magdalena is the founding member of the community bank and she is very happy with the group because she has made new friends. The organization has also helped her find a new friend who assists her with her loans. She is 43 years old and she lives with her partner and their four children. Three of her children are grown and the youngest is in school and still lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant. 

She sells jewelry and shoes from her home and she also delivers to clients who have placed orders. She completes her sales in cash and credit, but she only permits two payments as terms of her credit sales.   She works from 9am to 3pm and she purchases her merchandise from the city of Guayaquil once per month. She finds greater variety and better prices in the city. 

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. Her dream is to improve her home and to build a fourth room to accommodate her business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Uurtsaih

texts.en:
Uurtsaih J. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Harhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her two sons attend a local secondary school. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Uurtsaih currently operates a meat and dairy product trading business. She purchases meat, animal products and dairy products in bulk from herders in the countryside and transports it to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city in Mongolia and its capital, where she sells the produce. She started her meat trading business in 2008, selling out of a rented stall at the market in her town. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock and dairy products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and dairy products

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 39 años D. edad,  D. estado civil casada, tiene tres hijos.  Solo pudo estudiar hasta tercero D. secundaria. 
Juliana está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace seis años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio, actividad basada en la venta D. cereales, lo cual es realizado en Arequipa. 
La señora  solicitará un nuevo crédito D.  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cereales al por mayor.
Su sueño es progresar y seguir adelante en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es conversar con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the “Brisas D. Rio Blanca” (White River Breezes) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She was only able to go to school up to the third year of high school.

Juliana has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  The first loan she requested was for 300 soles.  She used the loan to increase the capital in her business, which is selling grains in Arequipa.

Her dream is to progress and get ahead in her business.

What she likes about her communal bank is talking with the other members.

loans.use: To buy grains wholesale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with two children who are too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He operates a mobile phone accessories shop. Passersby and neighbors are his potential customers. David faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and operate as a wholesale business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase mobile phone accessories and electrical chargers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories and electrical chargers.

loans.name: Malaki

texts.en:
Malaki B. is 47 years old and is from from Sondu. He is married to Rose and they have four children between 20 and 10 years old.

Malaki is in the welding business.   He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Through the years, he has managed to create a huge clientele. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the money to buy stocks of metals to make doors and windows. 

His dream is to see his business grow.

loans.use: To buy stocks of metals to make doors and windows

loans.name: Mukarramhon's Group

texts.en:
Mukarramhon U. is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 years old and married. She has two sons and a daughter. Her first son works in construction, and the other children are in school. Mukarramhon and her husband breed cattle. The family earns 3000 KGS per month by reselling cattle after fattening. That profit made it possible for them to save money and make some house repairs. With money received from the loan the family wants to purchase a bull calf for breeding. In the future, Mukarramhon wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen belongs to Mian channu, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Amrat Nagar. She is 49 years old and married to J. M.. They have two children: a son and a daughter. Her son has a business of selling construction supplies while her daughter, 10, is studying in class 4.
  
Her husband has a business of selling timbers. He operates this business in the market where he fulfills the orders of his customers. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. 

Perveen is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy timber in bulk to serve more customers and fulfill larger orders on time. She is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and will earn him better profits in the future.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In the previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and has never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy timber for selling

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado NUEVA ESTRELLA, el cual esta ubicado en el estado D. Puebla, Mexico. Está conformado por 8 integrantes. En la fotografía se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la Señora Auria R. J. una integrante del grupo, una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes con la que ya tiene 4 años, esté comercio lo tiene dentro D. su casa. Ella es conocida por mucha gente que le compra, sus clinetes estan contentos porque dicen que es muy servicial, da buenos precio y les gusta la variedad D. productos que tiene, entre sus productos venD. frutas y verduras. Ella comenta que este crédito lo destinara a la compra D. más mercancía y las ganancias las invertira en agrandar su negocio. Tiene el firme propósito D. construir otro cuarto en su propiedad, y más adelante lo destinara como local para su negocio. Ella tiene 58 años y estudio hasta el cuarto grado D. primaria, es casada, tiene 3 hijos; 1 hombre y 2 mujeres.
texts.en:
The photo shows the group named “Nueva Estrella” (New Star), which is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico. There are eight members in the group. The photo was taken at the business of Sra. Auria R.J., one of the group members who has been managing a small grocery store out of her home for the past four years. She is known among the customers who buy from her. They say that they are satisfied because Auria is very helpful, offers good prices, and has the variety of products that they need, including fruits and vegetables. Auria says that her loan will be used to buy more merchandise and the profits will be invested in the expansion of her business. She is determined to build another room on her property that will later be used as the location for her business.

Auria is 58 years old, married, and has a fourth graD. education. She has three children, a son and two daughters.

loans.use: Purchase basic food products

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin is married and lives with his wife and three-year-old son in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. His wife is unemployed and stays at home to take care of their son. Amartuvshin operates a motorbike taxi service, which he started in 2007. He has now gained enough experience in the transportation business and wants to buy a car. He is a hardworking and modest person who says," I would like to have a stable source of income." Amartuvshin is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to buy spare parts and cover the maintenance service fees for his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay maintenance fees for his motorbike

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. He sells fish so as to earn a living. He was previously doing carpentry for a living. He has been running his business for 15 years and has employed two people. He hopes to establish other businesses in the future. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money and also get loans. Hence, he has requested 50,000 KES to stock more fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Mougnou [Patience] Group

texts.fr:
Mougnou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Médina Koura de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, l’atieké de manioc les condiments alimentaires, le savons, etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent  a été bien remboursé.  
Kadia M. est un membre du groupe Mougnou qui vend de l’atieké  (couscous à base de manioc très  apprécié par les Maliens).  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en  de bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs pour la cuisson de l’atieké et des sacs de maniocs au fur et à mesure. Elle vend  de l’atieké en détail et au comptant au  marché  de Médina Koura, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe Mougnou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Kadia  compte réaliser 90.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mougnou ["patience"] is a group of women from the Médina Koura district of Koutiala living in traditional extended families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are all married, and average 32 years of age and at least four children. This group of women sells various items, such as “atieke” [a traditional dish], food condiments, soap etc. In order to expand the scope of their business, one year ago the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. They are now on their second group loan, having duly reimbursed the previous loan.

Kada M. is a group member who sells “atieké” (a couscous-like dish made with manioc [cassava] and very popular in Mali).
She plans to use her loan to purchase cartloads of heating wood from the farmers, to be used for cooking  atieké, as well as bags of manioc as necessary. She retails her atieké for cahs at the Médina Koura market, to a very diverse  customer base. While other members of the Mougnou group plan to achieve an average monthly income of 80,000 West African francs each in the course of this loan cycle, Kadia plans to earn 90,000 francs. Apart from repaying the loan, they use part of their revenues to cover everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase manioc and heating wood

loans.name: Tukola Women's Group

texts.en: N. William, 59 years old, has been a charcoal sales businessman for the past 15 years in the town of Lugazi. This high spirited father of 6 says he began this business with savings from his firewood sales business and that it generates 120,000 UGX of monthly profit. William will use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Progression Plus Group

texts.en:
“Progression Plus” is a community bank made up of 14 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Micheline M.. These members are united for the same goal – to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through HOPE DRC.
Micheline sells drinks in her local area located in the south-western area of Kinshasa. She began her business in 1998. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of MFI HOPE DRC and has already received five different loans, all of which she has repaid properly. She intends to reinforce her capital with her next loan by purchasing more crates of drinks. Her business gives her a profit of USD $60 every week. Micheline is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages range between 3 and 20. Four of them attend school. Her ambition is to open a crate drinks facility.

loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Bella works hard to support her family. 

She has a ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of dried seahorse. Bella is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell for her RTW products business. 

Bella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW products to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in her own house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. For the past two years, Mwanasiti has operated an open-air food stall She sells to her neighbouring community members. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and rice for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and rice for her food stall business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice sells beans. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom go to school. Joice is asking for a loan to stock more beans to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with her extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more beans to sell.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mariela Elizabeth tiene 27 años, es madre soltera, vive con los padres y con el hijo de cuatro años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul y cria

Mariela se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos los engorda y los vende, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Ercopa" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas animales y alimentacion para los mismos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar no tener granja propia por es arrendada. Su sueño es auentar la produccion y tener mas animales.

Le gusta ver television.
texts.en:
Mariela Elizabeth, 27, is a single mother living with her parents and her 4-year-old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located I Cachely Grande belonging to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers and raise livestock.

Mariela raises chickens and pigs; she fattens them up for sale.  She makes her purchases at “Ercopa” suppliers each month and sells at the local farmers market.

She is requesting the loan to buy more animals and feed for them.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenge she faces is not having a farm of her own; she leases.  

Her dream is to increase production and have more animals.  She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower, 56, is a widow with three children. In 2008 she started her food and provisions business where she sells such items as soft drinks, sardines, cooking oil and tomatoes. She was motivated to have her own business because initially she sold small items but wanted her business to grow to this size. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about 8,000,000 SLL every month. She faces difficulty with inflation, but her business is in a bustling area with a lot of foot traffic.

The borrower would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

In the future, she plans to grow the shop and move into a larger one. The borrower is a very intelligent woman and will use her loan well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sardines, and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old, single man from Tyre. He has been working in construction, specializing in painting homes and offices for 11 years, but he started his own business in 2008.

Ahmad is a hard worker. He works on improving his business through renewing his tools and searching for new themes and painting techniques, to fulfill his customer's needs and desires.

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to renew his tools and to pay for his electrical home appliances that he is buying for the house that he's preparing to get married in soon.

His previous loan had a positive impact on his business and social life and, at the same time, he was a borrower in good standing. Ahmad is devoted to his business. That's why he works hard to update it with every idea he finds. He hopes to expand his business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy new tools and new home appliances

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Yobana y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 30 años edad, tengo un hijo y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es ser ama de casa”. 

Yobana es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que con la ayuda de su esposo que es técnico en farmacia sacan adelante a sus hijos.   Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la alimentación, educación y vestimenta de su hijo. El sueño Yobana es abrir una cadena de boticas.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of the province of La Convención.  The valleys of Lares and La Convención are important commercial centers, with the main activities being coca plant, coffee, cocoa and fruit production.

In Quillabamba, we visited the communal bank "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan" where we met Yobana, who told us:

"I was born in the city of Quillabamba, am 30 years old, have a son and live in the same city where I was born.  I am a homemaker."

Yobana is a hard-working, enterprising woman who provides for her children with the help of her husband who is a pharmacy technician.  She is in need of a loan for personal use to provide food, clothing and education for her son.  Yobana's dream is to open a chain of general stores.

loans.use: To provide food, clothing and education for her son.

loans.name: Tantassama

texts.fr:
Tantassama est une femme  âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée å un administrateur. Elle a 04 enfants
Tantassama travaille comme revendeuse de boissons depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients à Tokoin Wuiti. Elle achète les produits à la Brasserie de Lomé. 
Tantassama a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons.
texts.en:
Tantassama, 40, is married to an administrator and has four children. 

Tantassama has been selling drinks since 2008. She sells to her customers in Tokoin Wuiti. She buys her products from the brewery in Lomé. 

Tantassama has requested her second loan from WAGES to use to buy drinks.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: María Julia Dinora

texts.es: María Julia, madre soltera, reside  en casa propia con su querida hija de 16 años la cual se encuentra estudiando 2° año de bachillerato. Ella se dedica a la venta de  bonitos juguetes para todos los gustos y preferencias. Su venta la hace de manera ambulante en las principales plazas y escuelas de los alrededores del lugar donde ella habita. Su deseo es poder ver a su hija convertida en una profesional y esto es lo que la motiva a trabajar día a día. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de comprar variedad de juguetes que sean atractivos para los clientes y que le permitan atraer nueva clientela. Tiene la esperanza que de esta manera su situación mejorará y logrará alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en: María Julia is a single mother who lives in her own home together with her beloved 16-year-old daughter who is in her second year of high school.  María Julia sells toys to suit all tastes and preferences.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in the main squares and schools in the area where she lives. Her wish is to be able to see her daughter become a professional.  This is what motivates her to work every day.  She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy a variety of toys that will appeal to her customers and allow her to attract new customers.  She hopes that this will improve her situation and that she will manage to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy a variety of toys

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and is a married woman with 6 children.  Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is 7.

Josie and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops to sell. They also buy coconuts and make copra. Josie does her best to help provide for her family and send her children to school. She applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and school supplies. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and school supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo, vive con su esposo y una hija de 13 años de edad quien estudia, también vive con ellos un tío de 73 años de edad, con su trabajo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.
Actualmente quiere invertir en la compra de cerdos y una vaquilla, estos los necesita para destazar y salir a vender a la zona, para proveer a sus familiares el sustento necesario.
Su aspiración es comprar un vehículo pick up, para transportar la carne y salir a vender a otras zonas, con mejores oportunidades de venta.
texts.en:
Lucia sells beef and pork.  He lives with his wife and his 13 year old daughter who goes to school.  His 73 year old uncle also lives with him.  Through his work he has managed to get his family ahead.

He currently wants to buy pigs and a heifer.  He needs them in order to butcher them and sell them in the neighborhood.  He will do this in order to provide sustenance for his family.

His goal is to buy a pick-up truck in order to transport the meat and go to other neighborhoods to sell.  This will give him better opportunities to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a heifer.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years she has been in the business of selling food items like avocados and lemons in Hai Gwafa, Yei, South Sudan. She requested this loan through BRAC to enable her purchase more lemons to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to enable her purchase more lemons to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married, and a father for five children, one of whom works.

Since 2009, Hamid has been an owner of a laboratory for desalination and water purification. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to change the filters for the maintenance of the system. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to change the filters for the maintenance of the system.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with 4 children, all are currently enrolled in school. His wife is a homemaker. For the past 4 years, Suleiman has run his own general store. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Suleiman will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans and other goods. Suleiman aspires to start his own wholesale business in the future. He joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans and other goods

loans.name: Sechemin-Agontinkon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Appoline Afiavi est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Appoline Afiavi est âgée de 48 ans, et est une veuve. Appoline Afiavi  a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Appoline Afiavi vit seule avec ses enfants. Appoline Afiavi a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis quinze ans, Appoline Afiavi vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses enfants. Appoline Afiavi achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Appoline Afiavi et les autres membres du groupement SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON group is made up of three people who live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Appoline Afiavi, has her hand raised in the photo.  Appoline Afiavi is 48 years old and a widow. She has two children in her care, both of whom attend school.  Appoline Afiavi left school at the primary level. She has been selling charcoal for 15 years in her district, which allows her to meet her different needs and those of her children.   Appoline Afiavi buys her products at the market in Bénin.  This is the third time that she and the other members of the SECHEMIN-AGONTINKON group have requested a loan through ALIDé.  This loan will allow them to grow their businesses and be able to meet the demand of their customers.  The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Geylin Amilcar

texts.es:
Geylin, un joven de 23 años de edad, de oficio agricultor de hortalizas,  nacido de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, soltero, el estudio hasta  tercer año de la secundaria no concluyo sus estudios por dedicarse a trabajar en las labores del campo. El inicio en esta actividad por medio de su padre y su hermano  mayor, su primer cultivo fue el tomates empezó limpiando y preparando el terreno, aprendió a realizar las cercas de madera para proteger la cosecha. Al cumplir 18 años de edad, sembró su primera cosecha  de tomates lo hizo de manera independiente de su padre , además se dedica a la ganadería el se levanta desde las 4 de la mañana a ordeñar vacas alista su jarra de leche lo coloca a en su carretón prepara su caballo y sale a vender al pueblo su fresca y recién ordeñada leche pura. En esto consiste parte de las actividades que el realiza en su vida diaria.
El requiere el préstamo para sembrar tomates, comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizantes. Una de sus metas es que desea ampliar su área de siembra para prepararse en el siguiente ciclo agrícola.
texts.en:
Geylin is 23 years old and works as a farmer.  He was born in Pueblo Nuevo in the city of Estelí.  He is single and has a partial high school education.  He was not able to finish school because he had to go to work in the fields.

He started this activity through his father and older brother.  His first was a crop of tomatoes.  He began by clearing and preparing the land and later learned to build the wooden fences to protect the crop.  At 18 he planted his first tomato crop on his own.  He also raises livestock.

He gets up at 4:00 am to milk the cows, prepares his milk jug, mounts it on his cart, readies his horse, and goes out to sell fresh milk.  These are part of the activities that encompass his daily life.

He needs this loan in order to plant tomatoes, buy supplies, and fertilizers.  One of his goals is to expand his planting area to prepare for the next agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sokhna Amar

texts.fr:
Sokhna est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans et mère de 4 enfants .
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 05/03/2009 et elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Abdou .
Sokhna fait du commerce de détails dans la vente de repas (restauration) activité qu'elle maitrise pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau prét de 350000 elle va acheter du riz de l'huile et des condiments pour son réstaurent.
Madame Sokhna va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire des enfants grâce aux bénéfices.
texts.en: Sokhna is a 49-year-old woman.  She is married and has four children.  She has been a member of the local "Banc Villageois" since March 5, 2009 and also belongs to the Sope Abdou solidarity group.  For quite a long time now, Sokhna has been selling meals in a restaurant and she has become very proficient at this activity.  A new loan of 350,000 XOF (CFA francs) will allow her to buy rice, oil and condiments for her restaurant.  With the profits, Sokhna plans to help her husband take care of their children's education and health.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and condiments for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Carminda

texts.es:
María Carminda, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 1 hijo de 39 años de edad, vive en Trinidad Santa Bárbara.
Doña María, es una persona activa le gusta mucho el comercio, hace 3 años  estableció un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, como blusas, pantalones faldas, bolsos  y  camisas. Además vende recargas para celulares  y hace costuras, confecciona ropa de todo tipo que le piden sus clientes. Ella siempre ha tenido negocio. Este es su cuarto préstamo solicitado a ODEF, y agradece porque su negocio a crecido, tiene bastantes clientes, actualmente va invertir en ropa usada seleccionada, como vestidos, pantalones faldas y blusas, pues ha visto que se le gana mas, ya que  es barata y logra vender cantidad.
El esfuerzo que hace es por tener un bienestar familiar y mantener surtido el negocio.
texts.en:
María Carminda, 60, is single due to widowhood.  She has a 39-year-old son and she lives in Trinidad, Santa Bárbara.

María is an active person who enjoys commerce very much.  She started a business three years ago selling new and used clothes like blouses, pants, skirts, purses and shirts.  She also sells mobile phone recharges and is a seamstress; she makes all types of clothing as requested by her customers.  She has always had a business.

This is her 4th loan requested of ODEF and she is grateful because her business has grown.  She has quite a few customers and she will invest in selected used clothes like dresses, pants, skirts and blouses on this occasion because she’s noticed that she makes better profits this way because it’s inexpensive and she can sell large amounts.  She makes this effort in order to have family wellbeing and to keep her business well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing.

loans.name: Leibnitz Marcelo

texts.es:
Leibnitz Marcelo tiene 36 años es casado, vive con la esposa y con las hijas  de 11 y 4  años. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Marcelo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 8 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Leibnitz Marcelo is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two daughters (ages 11 and 4) in the neighborhood of San Temistocles in the canton of Ventanas.

The Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of San Temistocles, which is in the canton of Ventanas.  This group consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.  

Marcelo is a farmer who has been growing corn for eight years.  He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products at the market in the same place.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  This will be a great help with increasing his income for the consumer needs of his family and for investment.  His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can continue planting.  

In his free time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mrs. Nut is 65 years old, a humble villager who lives in Takhmao town. She has five children, all of whom are already married. Mrs. Nut owns a few plots of farmland that can be used to grow her rice crops. Unfortunately, the farmland provides this family an unsatisfying output which is barely enough to use among the year. Mrs. Nut suggested her husband who used to be a mechanic to restart his business again in order to help their living needs. Therefore, Mrs. Nut wants to acquire some funds from our lenders to buy spare parts for motorcycles and to buy sets of tools for her husband to use to fix motorcycles. She is very pleased about the loan given to her to improve the business and her living standard.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for fixing motorcycles

loans.name: Luz Edith

texts.es:
Luz Edith es una persona trabajadora que siempre ha querido apoyar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos para su hogar.
