La principal razón es porque tienen 2 hijos a los cuales les quieren brindar la mejor educación posible y un futuro económico estable. Debido a que Luz Edith no proviene de una familia con grandes ingresos, ha trabajado fuertemente gran parte de su vida para ir cumpliendo poco a poco sus sueños. Luz Edith no quiere que sus hijos tengan que pasar por las mismas circunstancias y por ello les quiere brindar la mejor educación posible para que puedan trabajar en una actividad que les genere mejores ingresos que los que pueden generar ella y su esposo. 
Luz Edith a sus 39 años labora en casas de familia cercanas, y como actividad independiente quiere comprar un cerdo que le pueda dar crías, y luego vender las crías para que así le genere ingresos en un futuro. Como Luz Edith no tiene grandes ingresos, y su esposo tampoco tiene gran capacidad económica, Luz Edith está en busca de un préstamo que le permita comprar el cerdo y el cuido de los primeros días. Luz Edith manifiesta que con esta oportunidad de comprar el cerdo y generar ingresos extras en un futuro, su vida y la de sus hijos y esposo mejorará enormemente.
texts.en:
Luz Edith is a hardworking person who has always wanted to help her husband generate household income.  The main reason is because they have two children that they want to provide the best possible education for and a stable future.  Because Luz Edith comes from a family with few resources she’s worked hard most of her life to gradually reach her dreams.  Luz Edith does not want her children to have to go through the same circumstances and that’s why she wants to give them the best possible education so that they will be able to work at something that will generate better income than what she and her husband are able to earn.

Luz Edith, at the age of 39, works in nearby families’ houses and as an independent activity wants to buy a sow that can produce piglets for her to then sell and generate income in the future.  Since Luz Edith does not earn much money and her husband doesn’t either, she’s seeking a loan that will allow her to buy the pig and feed for the first few days.  Luz Edith states that with this opportunity to buy a pig and generate extra income in the future her life as well as her children’s and her husband’s will improve enormously.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and sell the litters in the future.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos para su hogar tiene una venta de legumbres en la plaza de mercado de su municipio. Hace aproximadamente 19 años Jose comenzó trabajando como ayudante en una venta de legumbres, y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo fue ahorrando un capital y así logró con mucho sacrificio montar su propio negocio de venta de legumbres. Gracias a que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y su atención siempre se ha caracterizado por ser de las mejores, ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas mensuales en su negocio. Jose busca un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento que requiere la estantería y los cajones de su venta de legumbres y así poder tener una buena presentación en su negocio.

Su sueño es sacar su esposa y su hija adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas en su hogar. Además, con su negocio sueña convertirlo en una gran venta mayorista y así generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.

loans.use: Realizar el mantenimiento que requiere la estantería y los cajones de su venta de legumbres y así poder tener una buena presentación en su negocio.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Her business is selling cosmetics. She visits shops, offices and private houses.

She needs this loan to buy creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products, as she has made good sales and, as a result, her number of customers and the number of orders she receives has increased. This is very positive for her as it means her income will increase, and she will be able to provide her child with a decent life. She would like her child to finish school and she would also like to be able to finish building her modest home.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products.

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en:
A 48-year-old married residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Noem has six children to take care of and earns a living through planting cassava, growing bean and rice. She has been in this business for 10 years. 
Noem has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes to make more crops so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To plow the field

loans.name: Sedjro Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Henriette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Henriette est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Benoît. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Henriette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Henriette vend de la pâte de maïs et des articles en plastiques dans sa région depuis vingt trois ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Henriette s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Henriette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SEDJRO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et des articles en plastiques.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a vegetable vendor for almost 5 years now. She has rented a stall inside the market in her town and sold various vegetables such as beans, tomatoes, okra, cabbage, pechay, and   ampalaya (bitter gourd).
She is married  an has seven children.  Her oldest is 17 while the youngest is 2. 
 Most of her expenses comes from food and school  fees. On the other hand, her husband is a farmer. He grows and sold rice.


Demands on vegetables is at peak this time, there fore she join Kiva's field partner CEVI to avail loan.
Nena wants to purchase variety of vegetables , to filled that was out of stock and also it helps to attract potential buyers. She will be able to settle her obligation and continue provide the needs of her growing children.

She is hoping  that she could make it more sustainable for the welfare of her growing children and also to be able to finance her children's respective studies.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena lives in the city of VilL. D. Garcia, in the State of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two children of 5 and 3 years of age. Ever since she was still single she has been involved in sales by catalogue for home products, and to date she still maintains her business as it is quite profitable. Her youngest daughter is sick with asthma and the treatments are very expensive. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover these costs and those of their house in which they live. Maria Magdalena works very hard for her daughter\'s health and she now requires a loan of $250 to be able to add variety to her merchandise and increase her sales.

She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can help Magdalena to pay for her daugher\'s treatment. Do not leave her alone. Your generosity is of great help. The decision is in your hands, do not doubt it any longer and help them. Magdalena\'s family will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena vive en L. localidad D. VilL. D. García, en el estado D. nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos D. 5 y 3 años D. edad. ElL. desD. que era soltera se dedica a L. venta por catálogo D. artículos para el hogar y hasta L. fecha continua con esta actividad, pues es bastante rentable. Su hija más pequeñita esta enferma D. asma y los tratamientos son muy caros, por lo que con el sueldo D. su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir esos gastos además que continúan pagando L. casa en L. que viven. María Magdalena trabaja muy duro por L. salud D. su hija y ahora elL. requiere D. un préstamo D. $250 DLLS para poder surtir más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas.

ElL. planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un periodo D. 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes ayudar a Magdalena a costear el tratamiento D. su niña, no L. dejes soL., tu generosidad es D. mucho apoyo, L. decisión esta en tus manos, no lo duD. más y apóyalos. L. familia D. Magdalena te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
This 43-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in Fizuli region, Mahmudlu 2 village. He is married and has 3 children.

He started this business 4 years ago.Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought foodstuffs. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his grocery store. This business will allow his family to have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To expand the area of his grocery store

loans.name: Emmanual

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old. He lives and intents to operate his business in Mbale town, Eastern Uganda.

His intended business involves preparing/catering fresh fruits to be served to different business people in offices within Mbale town. The business looks viable as there are few people engaged in such; hence, there is a ready market. He plans to supply the fruits to commercial banks in Mbale, Post Office staff and non-government organizations. He expects to make sales of $20 per day.

His initial investment is going to be $700. This project will help him uplift his standard of living.

loans.use: Fresh fruits packaging and selling

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in construction. She prepares food by order for social events in her community. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Eunice Sánchez Beltrán (food sales to community- together with Araceli). With the loan, they want to buy kitchen utensils and to set up a kitchen where they can prepare food in large quantities.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

ARACELI tiene 34 años, casada, tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en la construcción. Ella se dedica a preparar comida a pedido para eventos sociales dentro de su localidad. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con Eunice Sánchez Beltrán (venta de comida en sociedad con Araceli) por lo tanto con el préstamo esperan comprar utensilios de cocina y acondicionar un lugar especial para preparar alimentos en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Food Sales

loans.name: Goma Khan

texts.en:
Goma Khan lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family and is single. He works together with his brothers weaving carpets.

Goma Khan has good experience around his brothers. He wants to expand this business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines to attract more clients and make good income to support his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new machines for carpet weaving

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess A. is 40 years old, married and has 5 children.  She lives in Benin City where she sells provisions to people living in her community.  She has been in business since 1998 and a LAPO for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $550 to buy more provisions to sell.  She hopes to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Since her husband abandoned her she has dedicated herself to the sale of clothing, given that she was left solely responsible for generating income to pay for household expenses. Also, she wants her children to have a better future by ensuring they get an education. It’s been 23 years since María Juana started with just a little jewelry and, little by little, she began to incorporate clothes and shoes into her inventory to have a greater variety of items to sell.

Currently, María Juana is a woman of advanced age who continues to fight to earn a living to support herself. It’s for this reason that she continues working at selling her products to earn enough to pay for her home. María Juana is asking for a loan of $600USD which she proposes to repay over a four-month period. With this money, María will be able to buy more seasonal clothing that she can offer her customers over the winter. With your help, María will be able to save some money to have for when she is no longer able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que su esposo la dejó, se a dedicado a la venta de ropa puesto que ella es la que tiene que ver por el dinero que entra en su casa para poder pagar todo lo que se necesita. Y también para poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor futuro al tenerlos estudiando. Hace 23 años Ma. Juana comenzó con un poco de joyería y poco a poco fue incluyendo ropa y zapatos para tener más variedad en las cosas que vende.

Actualmente María Juana es una mujer con avanzada edad. Que sigue luchando por sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de ella. Es por eso que continúa trabajando y vendiendo productos para poder sacar para pagar su casa. Es por esto que María Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $600 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar ropa de temporada para poder tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes en esta temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda María podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero para tener para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Azucena De Los Angel

texts.es:
Miss Azucena lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación de Managua. A few years ago Miss Azucena was a stay at home mother and homemaker but eventually decided to help her husband support the family. She started selling sweets, juices and sodas out of her home. As time went by she grew her business and at the present time she has a small general store where she sells a variety of products used in everyday life.

She needs the loan in order to keep investing in her business and to continue expanding since she wishes to, one day, have a grocery store.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Azucena Pérez habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua. Hace años atrás doña Azucena se dedicaba al cuido de sus hijos y su hogar, pero decidió darle apoyo a su marido en los gastos de la casa, es por eso que decidió empezar con un pequeño negocio en su casa, ventas de confites, jugos y gaseosas, pero con el pasar del tiempo decidió hacer crecer su negocio y desde ese entonces lo ha venido haciendo crecer más, actualmente tiene una pulpería y oferta variedad de productos del consumo diario en los hogares. Necesita el prestamo para seguir inviertiendo en su negocio y hacerlo crecer más porque quiere llegar a tener una miscelánea

loans.use: To buy grains and perishable goods

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. E., 36, is a seamstress who sews at her house in Tnoat Chrum village, Boung Tompon Sangkat, Phnom Penh city. She has ten members in her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Savan, is a driver of a three-wheeled- motorcycle taxi . To earn a living for her family, she works very hard everyday. 

She now needs a loan of $300.00 to buy a new motorcycle for her husband’s business operation. His increased income will improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a three-wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
The young Mrs. Elizabeth H. is 31 years old and lives in San Juan de la Concha with her husband, whom supports her dreams and is a licensed lawyer. They have two children than are currently studying. Elizabeth works from home at her small business, where she sells cosmetics. She began the business six years ago with economic support from her husband, with the dream that her family would have a better lifestyle. She sells products door to door, at community centers, and from her home. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase waterproof cosmetics, now that there is a high demand during the summer season. This season is a high selling one for Elizabeth, and more merchandise has given her husband satisfaction, since she has been working hard at this business and helping her family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns

La joven señora Elizabeth Hernández, tiene 31 años de edad, habita en San Juan de la Concha acompañada de un hombre que la apoya en sus sueños y es licenciado en Derecho con quien tiene 2 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Doña Elizabeth apoya en su casa mediante un pequeño negocio personal que tiene de venta de Cosméticos el cual inició hace 6 años con apoyo económico de su esposo, con la ilusión de que su familia tenga una mejor condición de vida visita clientes de casa en casa, en sus puestos de trabajos, centros de estudios etc. Ofreciendo su producto al crédito para que se lo cancelen en sus fechas de pago. Solicita un crepito para comprar cosméticos hidratantes que son de gran demanda en esta época de playa, época que resulta con buenas ventas para ella, moviendo en créditos su inventario le ha dado la satisfacción a su esposo ya que lleva años en este negocio que resulta de gran apoyo en los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan Luis has a general store which he started up because the income he could earn as a laborer was too little. So 12 years ago he decided to start a business in order to have extra income. He is the father of 3 sons ages 17, 14 and 4, and as they grow up his expenses also increase, and he wants to give them a more comfortable and better life.

He is now asking for a loan of US $400, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and some items which his customers have been requesting and which he wants to offer, such as gifts and stationery. With your help Juan Luis will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Luis tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inició por que es poco el ingreso que tiene como trabajador en un taller entonces hace 12 años decidió emprender un negocio para otro ingreso. El es padre de 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 4 años y conforme van creciendo se van incrementando los gastos y el deseaba darles mas comodidad y una mejor vida.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y algunos artículos que sus clientes le están solicitando y que el quiere ofrecerles como regalos y papelería. Con tu apoyo Juan Luis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Ms. Adjo T. is 30 years old and married. She is a seamstress in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, she hopes to strengthen her shop by purchasing new fabric and another sewing machine to expand her business. This opportunity will allow her to earn more money in order to meet the needs of her family now and in the future.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Adjo T. est âgée de 30 ans et mariée. Elle fait la couture à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat des nouveaux tissus et une autre machine à coudre pour agrandir son entreprise. Cette occasion lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de son époux et à ses besoins futurs.

loans.use: Strenghten her business with the purchase of new fabric and another sewing machine

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima M. is 48 years old and is married with five children. She has manufactured palm kernel oil locally for twenty years. Palm kernels are processed through various stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes. Alima is a supplier to food vendors. However, her production is on the low side because of a limited working capital. Greater capital would allow her to buy a machine for processing. She wants to use the loan to buy 50 bags of palm kernels and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency. Alima believes this will help increase her income to help her husband to support their family, including financing the children's educations. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at a group meeting. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral, both to access loans and to provide peer pressure and support to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Sebazungu

texts.en:
SEBAZUNGU G. is among the early clients of VFC. He was born in 1979 in Eastern Province, Bugesera District. He is married and stays with his family in Nyamata Sector/ Nyamata-city.

In 2005, G. started a small-scale business trading shoes. His business was conducted in a small house he was renting for three thousand per month (Rwf3,000). He was living in the same room with 4 orphans (2 boys and 2 girls) as a child-headed household family. After joining VFC, his business grew, and he started to inject the small loan he obtained to purchase other items. According to G., “I was wondering where to find money in order to increase my capital and inject in other businesses which overlap with the shoes I am selling. It is by that reason that I approached VFC and started with trousers since people who were buying shoes could also be in need of trousers.” This business was initiated in 2006 with 10 men's trousers. G. says, "The loan I am going to get from VFC is going to help me to increase my business and hence improve my family welfare."

loans.use: Increase his business and hence improve his family welfare

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 55 years old. She is married with three children. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a merchant who has been selling lace clothes, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past thirty years. She is requesting a loan to augment her working capital to buy more lace clothes, slippers and dressing bags to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to augment her income to support her family.

Alima is a member of a community group called "Mamuli" Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more lace clothes, slippers, and dressing bags

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi Y. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. It is now the rainy season so she needs to cultivate rice; unfortunately, Mrs. Mi Y. does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow the rice field, thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seeds for cultivating. Her husband, Mr. Nat Noeurn, is a fisherman and pig breeder. Mrs. Mi Y. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending school while the youngest one is only four years old and is too young to study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the rice field and to buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 4 hijos, estudió el primer grado de primaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 462, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” de Juli. Al comienzo, hace  06 años, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró frutas para vender por al mayor. A los 20 años de edad se inicia con este negocio con el que continua trabajando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos porque no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Paralelo a este negocio también se dedica al bordado en  bayeta, el cual vende los días de feria.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 30 metros de bayeta a S/.150 y lana a S/. 200.

Su deseo es continuar con su negocio para que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 36-year-old mother of four and lives with her partner. She has a first-grade education and lives at 462 Santa Rosa in Juli, Peru. She is the founding member of the "Little Rome" Community Bank of Juli. It started six years ago with a small loan for her to purchase fruit to sell at wholesale. She started in this business at 20 years old and has continued to work to make headway for her children because she cannot count on the support of her husband. Along with the fruit selling business she also makes a living embroidering cloth, which she sells at the open-air market. She is requesting a $175 loan, which she plans to repay within four months, to purchase 30 meters of cloth and wool. Her wish is to continue with her business so her children can become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 30 meters of cloth and wool

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza U. D. R. vive en casa propia en la zona D. Tembladerani, D. esta ciudad. Esperanza es rentista D. la Caja D. Salud D. esta ciudad. 
Esperanza hizo la construcción D. un departamento pequeño en planta alta D. su vivienda, misma que tiene un avance del 60% y falta la obra fina para concluirla.
El crédito solicitado será para la conclusión del departamento en obra fina.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Esperanza U. D. R. lives in the house she owns in the Tembladerani section of this city. Esperanza is retired from the health department. She had a small apartment built on the top floor of her house, which is 60% completed and just needs the finish work. She will use the loan money to finish the apartment. This is the first time Esperanza has asked for a loan and, as she scored favorably on the socioeconomic analysis, she is eligible for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of an apartment in her house

loans.name: Srin

texts.en: Srin D. is a 51-year-old widowed rice farmer and lives in Pengmeaschoeung Village. She has two children. One is married and lives with her. She has much experience and works hard farming rice. Because of insufficient farmland to grow rice, D. rented farmland from her neighbors to do farming and contracted to pay at the end of the year. Rice farming is the main source of income for her family. Hence, D. would like to request a loan to pay for renting farmland.

loans.use: To pay for renting farmland

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a married woman with three children. She has received schooling through senior high, and her husband is a secretary.

Since 1998, Florence has been in the business of selling soft drinks at Santiwadzi in Elmina. Florence uses her business's income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family. Florence is now requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks because she has seen an increase in demand by her customers. As a result, she expects to generate an increase in profits from her expanded business, which Florence would use to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional soft drinks

loans.name: Bushra M.jamil Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, 25, of Arifwala, Pakistan, is the wife of M. Jamil, who has operated a spare parts business for the past 25 years. The mother of a son and daughter, neither yet of school age, Bushra baji operates an embroidery business, charging $3 per dress. She has a good customer base mainly consisting of her neighbors. Having repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), she is requesting a new one to buy more spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

She is a group leader of four other women in her locality. Shabana baji, Shazia baji Sugran baji, and Parveen baji are each requesting a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for their vegetable-selling businesses.

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if a one does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vehicular spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
la Sra R. es madre soltera tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y se dedica a este tipo de actividad desde hace 8 años, ella vive en la colonia la fraternidad y ha podido salir adelante a pesar de los obstaculos que le ha dado la vida.
el negocio de las tortillas es muy rentable ya que porduce tortillas para varios clientes y con las utilidades a podido pagar su casa y lograr graduar a su ultimo hijo.
para la venta de las tortillas necesita comprar maiz, leña, cal, agua por esa razon necesita el credito.
ella piensa que en un futuro su vida va a cambiar y pueda mejorar su condicion de vida. su sueño es tener una fabrica de tortillas en la cual pueda tener muchas empleadas y asi contribuir con otras familias a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. R. is a single mother, 56 years old, with 4 grown children. She has had this business for 8 years. She lives in La Fraternidad neighborhood and has been able to be successful in spite of life’s obstacles. Her tortilla business is very profitable and she produces tortillas for various clients and with the earnings she has been able to pay for her home and see her youngest child graduate. In order to sell tortillas she needs to buy corn, wood, lime, and water so she needs a loan. She believes in the future her life is going to change and she can improve her quality of life. She dreams of having a tortilla factory where she can have many employees and in this way help other families be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood, lime, and water

loans.name: Shalon

texts.en: Shalon is 36 years old and married. She sells frozen food and drinks at Adewale Badajor Street, Field Bus Stop Igbo-Elerin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of NGN70, 000 to purchase more frozen food and drinks to sell in order to meet customer demand. She says a big 'thank you' to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and drink to sell

loans.name: Bimkubwa

texts.en:
Bimkubwa, a 49-year-old married mother of five children aged 20, 18, 13, 7 and 3, has owned a small stationery business in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to Allah Karim loan group (Group code 2021) and currently earns an average monthly profit of $70 working at her business for two hours each day.   

Bimkubwa is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more stationery items for her enterprise. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow the business.

loans.use: To buy more stationery items for her business.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta B., a 32-year-old resident of Lawis Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, is married to a fisherman. Because it was hard for them to survive if only her husband was working, Crisanta started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a small amount of capital. Their primary customers are their neighbors, and the resulting income finances the daily needs of the family.  

Through the assistance of Paglaum Cooperative, Crisanta was able to previously avail herself of a loan, meeting the repayment schedule religiously. She is now requesting another loan of PHP 50,000 to finance the purchase of additional stocks for her sari-sari store and is looking forward to someday expanding it into a Mini-mart.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. is 29 years old and from the village of Biasong. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Betty operates a family member's business manufacturing clay products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling them to local businesses and community members. Betty has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture more products. This loan will be Betty's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Dady

texts.en:
Dady R. is from the village of Paypayan Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Dady is married and has five small children. To make a living, Dady owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, specifically, selling "buko" or young coconut in the local community. Dady has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from this activity.

In 2008, Dady joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Dady has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Dady is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy "buko" to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dady from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase "buko" or young coconut to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Es Soltera, tiene 69 años y es madre de 05 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y  con familia.

Lleva ya varios años dedicándose al rubro de alquiler de habitaciones , nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 1,000.00 que los utilizó en la construcción de las primeras 2 habitaciones y las ganas de salir adelante, le hizo progresar poco a poco en este negocio.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, en la actualidad tiene 04 habitaciones en alquiler ubicada en su misma casa, habitaciones muy bien cómodas y bien arregladas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, lo invertirá comprando ladrillos, cementos, triplay, pintura, en la confección de puertas y ventanas de madera para la construcción de mas dormitorios, al fondo de su casa.

Ella es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y capaz.

Elsita; manifiesta su Agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberle ayudado a mejorar y hacer posible sus sueños y poder así asegurar su vejez generando sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa belongs to the Community Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Money) in the district of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres department. She is single, 69 years old, and has five children, all of whom are independent and have their own families. For several years Elsa has made a living renting out rooms. She says that she started out with S/.1,000 which was used to build the first two rooms. Her desire to get ahead in life meant that her business gradually became successful. She says that she is doing well and now has four very comfortable and well-kept rooms for rent in her own house. With the S/.2,000 loan she plans to buy bricks, cement, plywood, paint and have wood doors and windows made so that she can build more rooms at the back of her house. Elsa makes all her own personal and business decisions, and as a result she feels more independent, safe, and competent. She would like to say how appreciative she is of Kiva partner, the Manuela Ramos organisation, for having helped to improve her life and make possible her dreams so that even in her old age she can earn her own income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of more rooms to rent

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мавлуда – женщина 47 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды и женской обуви на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Так как ее муж не очень хорошо зарабатывает, она старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Конечно же ей очень трудно. Мавлуда закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Мавлуда хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. Mavluda sells children’s clothing and women’s shoes at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. Because her husband does not make much money, Mavluda tries to work more and earn more money in order to support the family. It is obviously hard for her. Mavluda buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Mavluda wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good assortment attracts more customers. She prefers to obtain a loan for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 31 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling food items, and is applying for this loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. She wishes to extend her thanks to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 29 years old and has a one-year-old daughter named Lovely Angel. Alona is married to Sabas, a farmer in their village in Bacnor West, Roxas, Isabela. Their primary source of livelihood is farming, managed by her husband.

To help her husband in supporting the needs of their family, Alona ventured into the hog-raising business and her income from this is of big help on their farm, like purchasing farm inputs and maintaining the growth of their crops.

Alona is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her small business. She wants the business to grow because this will be a great help in sending their child to school. Alona never gets tired of praising God for giving her a happy family. She prays that God will continue to bless her family and her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 50 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su hijo Miguel de 17 años a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. Se dedica al tejido artesanal, tiene su puesto en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy visitado por sus clientes, entre los cuales se encuentran turistas internacionales, quienes en su paso hacia la ciudad de Puno se detienen a llevarse algún recuerdo de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun sin son artesanales, los cuales los realiza con mucha alegría. Lleva 20 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su puesto de venta sin poder salir a la calle a distraerse. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de ropa artesanal donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo y no tener problemas, ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old and a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her 17 year old son Miguel, for whom she wants to provide a good college education. She sells handmade fabrics from her vending post at La Explanada Laguna Temporal (a place where fairs are held in the city of Juliaca). Among the customers that visit her business are international tourists, who are on their way to the city of Puno but stop in Juliaca to buy souvenirs. Juana says the best part of her job is weaving her fabrics by hand because it gives her great joy. She has been in business for 20 years and the hardest part is having to spend the entire day at her post without being able to take a few moments to relax. In the future, she would like to open a handmade clothing store where she can sell her merchandise in a calmer environment.

Juana is seeking her first loan with MFP and expects to make her payments on time without any problems. She hopes to access more loans in the future. With her loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more wool in order to increase the amount of clothing she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr: S. Diane est née vers les années 1968 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Diane est mariée à Ahouandjinou Grégoire; elle est mère d’une fille âgée de 14 ans. Diane réside au quartier Enagnon une banlieue de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Diane mène comme activité principale la vente des produits vivriers( maïs, haricot, mil, soja, sorgho, riz...). C'est sur commande et a crédit que distribue ses produits à sa clientèle. Mais comme activité secondaire, vend aussi les fruits de ronier de façon ambulante. Diane a déjà eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Diane demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de riz, de haricot et les fruits de ronier.

loans.name: Ana Yensi

texts.es: La Joven Ana Yensi González tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San Pedro ubicado en el Km. 16 ½ carreta hacia Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que ellos habitan donde su suegra , con el primer crédito logro comprar parte de materiales para iniciar a construir  su casa ya que su suegra les regalo un terreno donde ellos formen su hogar ,agradece a Afodenic por la confianza y el apoyo que le han brindado durante estos dos desembolsos , ya que son muchas la familias que se benefician con estos programas de desarrollo para las personas asalariadas que tienen el sueño de tener su casa. Comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar a construir.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer su casa

loans.name: Doña Barbará Group

texts.es:
El grupo Doña Barbara está conformado por cuatros mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y con visión. Una de ellas es Martha Veronica G. de 32 años que comercializa productos de la Avon, marca de productos de cosméticos de gran reconocimiento.

María Lucia M. de 69 años hace once años que vende leña, frijoles cocidos, tortillas, pinolillo y pinol. Estos productos son de gran de manda en su comunidad ya que son parte de la dieta alimenticia.

 Margarita de los Ángeles Gómez Guzmán  de 33 años vende productos de la Avon y cosa de horno que es hecho a base de maíz y queso.  Martha Isabel García M. de 46 años vende desde hace seis años ropa usada y Karla Patricia V. de 38 años desde hace cuatro años que tiene un modesto taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Doña Barbara Group consists of five strong-willed, hardworking, visionary women. One of them is Martha Veronica G.. She sells Avon products, a well-known brand of cosmetic products.

María Lucia M. is 69 years old and has been selling firewood, cooked beans, tortillas, pinole, and pinolillo for 11 years. These products sell well in the community because they are a regular part of the local diet.

Margarita de los Ángeles Gómez Guzmán is 33 years old and sells Avon products. She also sells baked goods made from corn and cheese.

Martha Isabel García M. is 46 years old and has been selling secondhand clothing for 6 years.

Karla Patricia V. is 38 years old and has been operating a modest sewing workshop for 4 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en: Mansour is a 27-year-old married man with one child. He has been working as a carpenter since 2001 to earn income to satisfy his family's needs. Today, Mansour is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase additional wood to satisfy the heavy demand of his clients.

loans.use: purchase additional wood

loans.name: Ivo

texts.es:
Ivo es un hombre muy responsable de 44 años, está casado con la madre de sus 3 hijos.
Desde hace 24 años siembra café y plátanos en sus propias chacras y durante todo este tiempo sus cultivos le han resultado muy rentables, lo cual le permitió brindarles las comodidades necesarias a sus hijos. 
Él trabaja desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, siempre en la compañía de su esposa, pero cuando cosecha los plátanos generalmente madruga, ya que a las 6 de la mañana, su comprador pasa a recoger el producto a su chacra, esta labor la realiza una vez por semana, llegando a vender cerca de 1500 kilos de plátano. 
Para la cosecha de café sus hijos se suman a la recolección, porque Ivo y su esposa lleven el grano cosechado a las acopiadoras de la ciudad y por ello se necesitan de varias manos para la cosecha.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Asimismo, jura guiar correctamente a su banco comunal, por ha sido elegido presidente de la junta directiva. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abona sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ivo is a very responsible 44-year old man who is married to the mother of his 3 children. For 24 years he has grown coffee and bananas on his own fields, and during this time his crops have been very profitable, allowing him to provide the necessities of life for his children. He works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening, always in the company of his wife, but when he harvests the bananas he generally gets up at dawn, since at 6 in the morning his buyer comes to collect the products from his farm. He carries out this work one time per week, and sells about 1500 kilos of bananas. For the coffee harvest his sons join in the picking, because Ivo and his wife take the harvested product to the buyers in the city, and for this reason they need extra hands for the harvest. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making all of his payments on time. Also, he pledges to properly lead his communal bank, because he has been elected president by the board. With the money he requests he will buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maritza Magda

texts.es: La señora Maritza E., es una madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, de los tres la hija mujer esta casada, y los  otros dos estudian para tener una buena educación. Con ayuda de su esposo esperan poder darle el apoyo con los estudios. Su esposo es enfermero y trabaja para la fuerza aérea de Nicaragua desde hace quince años trabajo fijo lo único que su salario es bajo. Es por eso doña Maritza tiene diez años vendiendo gafas, accesorios de celulares, cartucheras, gorras, billeteras y una variedad de accesorios vende ambulante en un semáforo para poder sustentar los gastos de alimentación, pago de agua, de luz y los gastos de estudios. Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio con poco comenzó su venta, todos los día se trasladaba en un semáforo pero ahora esta ubicada en Linda Vista en frente del súper mercado la Unión y aprovecha a toda la clientela que llega de comprar lo cual esta mas segura por los accidente de la carretera, robo y se asolea menos del sol y esta vendiendo mas. Es por eso quiere invertir con este financiamiento la compra de mas lentes, gorras, controles de TV, gorros  navideños, lapiceros y otros que le ayude a generarle mejores ventas a su negocio. Sus planes es poder seguir construyendo su casa para poder vivir en una vivienda digna junto a sus seres queridos. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo económico para invertir en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza E. has three lovely children. Her daughter is married, and the other two go to school to get a good education. With her husband’s help, they hope to be able to give them the support for their studies. Her husband is a nurse, and he has worked for the Nicaraguan Air Force for 15 years. It is steady work, but his salary is low. Therefore, for 10 years Maritza has been selling glasses, cell accessories, bags, hats, wallets, and a variety of accessories. She is a street vendor at a stoplight. She does this to pay the expenses of food, water, light, and education. She started her sales with a little money that her husband gave her. Everyday she went to the stoplight. Now she is located on Linda Vista in front of the Unión supermarket. She takes advantage of the customers who come to buy. There is less danger from accidents on the road and robberies. She is in the sun less, and she is selling more. That is why she wants to use this loan to buy more glasses, hats, TV remote controls, Christmas hats, mechanical pencils, and other things that help her generate more sales in her business. Her plan is to be able to keep building her house to be able to live in a decent house with her loved ones. She is grateful to the institution for the economic support to invest in her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glasses, wallets, hats, remote controls for TVs, phone holders, Christmas hats, and other things to increase sales

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati A. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.  Mrs. A. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son started to attend university this year and her daughter is studying in grade 6.

Both Mrs. A. and Mr. A. are engaged in a grocery store business. They opened their grocery store few years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. They sell different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, noodles, etc.

Now, Mrs. Achary is requesting a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy grocery supplies for their shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery supplies for their shop

loans.name: Nurn

texts.en:
Nurn V., 35, sells vegetables at a local market in town and is able to earn $4 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2000. She is married and lives with her six children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband grows vegetables for sale, earning $2 US per day. The family is also supported by one of the children, who is a worker for a local garment factory earning $2 US per day. 

V. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of $1000 US from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market

loans.name: Djumanazar

texts.ru: Бобомуратов Джуманазар проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 10 детей. Бобомуратов Джуманазар в своей мастерской работает более 10 лет. Он занимается ремонтом электроники. Кредит берет для закупа запастных частей аппаратуры, чтобы предоставит качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Djumanazar B. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 51 years old, married and has 10 children. Djumanazar has been working at his repair shop for over 10 years. He repairs electronics. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of equipment spare parts, in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment spare parts

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  Señora Maritza del Socorro C., labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua, ella tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo y tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y mano de obra para reforzar una de las paredes de su casa de habitación.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Maritza dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza del Socorro C. works as a receptionist at the Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua. She is married and has five children, three of whom are of school age. During the last four years, she has worked with four loans through CEPRODEL, and in this period she has invested the credits in the improvement of her home. She has been an excellent client with CEPRODEL. The credit that she is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and manual labor to reinforce one of the walls of her house. All of this is for the purpose of providing greater security and a better quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand her home

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
el sr. Felix Pedro M. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Namasigue, departamento de Choluteca.
Felix se dedica a la venta de charamuscas de varios sabores, las elabora con frutas, leche, agua, y tambien en algunos casos utiliza saborizantes o refrescos en polvo.
las charamuscas son muy vendidas en esta comunidad ya que es una zona de altas temperaturas y las personas las compran para refrescarse un poco del calor que hace.
sus clientes lo prefieren ya que son elaboradas con mucha higiene, pero lo mejor de las charamuscas es su delicioso sabor.
ahorita don Felix necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas y materiales para la elaboracion de las charamuscas, viene la temporada escolar y la temporada de semana santa y este producto tiene mucha demanda.
con las ganancias que obtenga podra cubrir con los gastos de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Felix Pedro M. is 46 years old. He lives in the town of San Geronimo, Namasigue, departament of Choluteca. Felix sells charamuscas- handmade popsicles frozen in baggies-in different flavors. He makes them with fruit, milk, water and in some cases he also uses flavorings or powdered drinks. The charamuscas sell very well in this community, since it is an area with high temperatures and people buy them to cool off a little from the heat. His clients prefer him since he makes them in a very hygienically, but the best part about the charamuscas is their delicious flavor. Right now, Felix needs the loan to buy more fruit and materials to make the charamuscas. The school year is about to begin and Holy Week is coming and this product is in high demand. With the earnings he will make he will be be able to cover his family's and his home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, milk, water, sugar, bags.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells groceries like toothpaste, milk, sugar and cream. She is 40 years old and married with three children who attend school. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because it is profitable for her. She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Pammai Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are members of the 'Pammai Sellers' group from the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. For many years now, this group of women have been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) in the town’s main market. They are applying for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to boost their businesses. 

The leader of the group is Marie K. in the lefthand side of the photo. The 50-year-old is a widow with five children. Two of her children are still in school and the rest are now grown-ups and living on their own. Marie sells palm oil and has been doing this business for many years now. She and her colleagues in the group will use their loans to buy "barters" (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia es socia del Banco Comunal Universo.
Libia es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Libia  vende verduras al por mayor en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Libia necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tomate y cebolla.
Los sueños de Libia son aumentar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Libia is an associate of the Universe Communal Bank. Libia is married, 40 years of age and has 5 children. Libia sells vegetables wholesale in the Nery Garcia market, an activity that she carries out every day. Libia needs a loan of 2500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of tomatos and onions. The dreams of Libya are to grow her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae T. is 52 and married with 4 children (ages 21 - 30).  She owns a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Faavae has 4 years of experience in this business.  Faavae needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase new sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or US $117 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2002, Faavae joined SPBD.  This is her 8th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faavae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Martin Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene como actividad la confeccion de ropa mas propiamente de vestidos los cuales confecciona para poder luego venderlos a un contratista, esta oportunidad esta costurando vestidos para exportarlos a paises vecinos, el Sr. Martin es una persona muy dinamica y emprendedora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, esta ocacion solicita un credito para poder terminar de construir su  casa en la que vive con su Mamá y su Hermana, ya que lo reubicaron  de zona en la que vivia por que hace diez años la misma se derrunbo, pero, ahora se recupero gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo logrando construir su nuevo hogar. Es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, su deseo es terminar de construir su casita esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin manufactures formalwear and sells them to a contractor, who in turn exports them to neighboring countries. He is a dynamic and enterprising person who wants to succeed in life. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to finish the construction of his house where he lives with his mother and sister. Martin relocated to this area ten years ago because his previous home was torn down, but he has now recovered and thanks to his work, he is able to build a new house. He is a responsible and hardworking person who desires to finish building his house. Martin is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en:
Veronique is 51 years old and she is still married. She makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop. Veronique has been in this business for about one year. The hours of her business are from 6 am to 10 pm every day.

Veronique is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, sugar, wheat, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Veronique hopes that the number of her customers will increase as well as her profits. These profits will be used for further reinvestment and to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, rice, sugar, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Elba De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Elba es una mujer trabajadora de 53 años de edad, madre de un hijo, vive en el bario Esquipulas.
Desde joven se dedico a trabajar, en servicios domésticos, ya que no tenia la ayuda de su compañero ya que estando embarazada falleció lo que fue para ella un gran dolor pero con la esperanza de tener a su hijo. 

Comienza  a buscar trabajo para poder cubrir sus gastos y encuentra  en servicios domésticos  en una casa particular.  En donde hace todos los oficios del hogar lo que le resulta cansado,  también cuida a un niño.
Con su salario cubría los gastos y apoyaba a su hijo, lo que ahora se graduó en mercadeo y la ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Ella se siente contenta por tener un trabajo fijo. A Futuro  espera  ahorrar y vender algo para estar en su casa
Sus planes para su casa es lograr tener mejores condiciones. Con este préstamo comprara láminas para cielo raso el cual instalara para amortiguar el calor, mejor higiene, como una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Elba is an enterprising woman of 53 years. She is the mother of a son, and she lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood. Since the time she was young, she has worked as a domestic. She didn't have the help of her partner, since he died when she was pregnant. For her this created great pain, but yet she had the hope of having his son. She began looking for work so she could cover the household expenses, and started working as a domestic in a private residence. There she did all of the household tasks, which was tiring for her as she also had to care for a son. With her salary she covered the expenses and supported her son. He is now a graduate in marketing, and he helps her with the household expenses. She feels content to have a regular job. In the future she hopes to save some money and to sell something so that she can remain in her home. She plans to make some improvements to her home. With this loan she will buy ceiling plates which she will install to absorb the heat, and to provide better hygiene and a better appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ceiling plates which she will install to absorb the heat, and to provide better hygiene and a better appearance.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es conviviente y esta esperando su primer hijo, vive en la casa de sus suegros y su mayor sueño es construir su casa.
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones.
Marianela tiene un puesto en el mercado de plantas Aprovisa, en donde vende plantas ornamentales, flores, entre otros, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y también las cultiva, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su pareja. Además Marianela tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Américas en donde vende ganchos, aretes, actividad que dejo de realizar por el momento por lo cuidadoso de su estado. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de macetas y plantas.
texts.en:
Marianela lives with her partner and is expecting her first child. She lives in the home of her in-laws and her greatest dream is to build her house. She is a member of the Las Palmeras Community Bank and she is most grateful for the training sessions. Marianela has a stall in the Aprovisa plant market, where she sells ornamental plants, and flowers, among others. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and also grows them, an activity that she does with the help of her partner. Marianela also has a stall in the Las Americas market where she sells charms and earrings, an activity that she has stopped for the moment to take care of her pregnancy. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flowerpots and plants.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of flowerpots and plants

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en: This is 49 year-old Shanti C.. She is married and has 3 children aged 28, 25, and 20. In 1998, she established her small store business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase additional inventory for her small store. In the future, Shanti plans to continue adding inventory and expanding her business. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: purchasing inventory for store

loans.name: Laila's Group

texts.en:
Laila Z. lives with her six family members in the historic city of Multan. She has two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school. Laila has a business selling medicines.  Laila went to school through 10th Grade. She then got married and could not complete her education, but she wants to give her children the best possible education which is why she works. Her husband is a driver by profession. Both Laila and her husband work full-time to fulfill the basic needs of their family. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for the expansion of her medicine business. With the loan, she will buy medicines to sell in her shop.. She hopes that she will earn a good income by improving her store with additional medicines available for selling. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She hopes that she will enjoy increased profits with the help of the loan. 
Note: In this photo, her group member Nusrat Mai, is showing her embroidery business.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for reselling

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married. His wife is a business woman. They have three children - two attend school, while the third is one and a half years old and still too young for school. They live in a rental house with no electricity or piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is paraffin oil.

Julius has been operating his carpentry business for the last six years. He sells his goods on a retail basis to his neighbors and passersby. With the 20,000 Kshs he is requesting, he wants to purchase a lorry of timber. His major challenge is the lack of capital to purchase more stock. He hopes that someday he will open a showroom to market his products. Julius decided to work with Yehu to gain access to financial services to improve his business.

He also earns income from his wife’s business earnings.

loans.use: To purchase a lorry of timber.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Rosa es la tesorera del Banco Comunal 30 De Agosto y la dueña de la casa donde se reúnen las socias, nos cuenta que ella junto con otras compañeras ya estaban en otro Banco Comunal pero que decidieron separarse y así formar este nuevo Banco en el cual es su primer ciclo.

Tiene tres hijos de una unión libre que mantiene hace 16 años, su marido es chofer particular.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de  todo tipo de ropa, su forma de venta es bajo pedido, tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos ya que les da facilidades de pago, ella cobra los fines de semana lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el día con la ayuda de su esposo. La mercadería va a comprar una vez al mes a Guayaquil ya que allá hay más variedad de productos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar un setenta por ciento  en comprar ropa de damas y el resto en prendas de hombres.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The community bank named "August 30" meets in the Picoaza district in the city of Portoviejo. The region is known for its commerce, its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its happy population. Rosa is the treasurer of the community bank and it is in her house that the meetings occur. She, together with a few other colleagues, used to belong to a different community bank but they decided to break away to form their own. This will be their first loan cycle as a group. She has three children and she lives with her boyfriend. He is a taxi driver. She sells all kinds of clothing, selling her products on order. She has many clients and they order her products especially because she offers them flexible payment methods. She collects payments on the weekends, a great advantage to her because when she picks up a payment she always makes new sales. She works on the weekends with the help of her boyfriend. She purchases her merchandise once a month in the city of Guayaquil, location where she finds the best selection. Seventy percent of this loan will be used to purchase ladies' clothing and the rest will be used to purchase men's clothing. Her dream is to purchase a car to help her make her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' and men's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel rental rooms and provide better service.

loans.name: Elizabeth Monserrate

texts.es:
En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Elizabeth esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y se desempeña como fiscal de reglamento, le gusta el Banco por la seriedad de sus amigas y compañeras y por la ayuda que recibe de la institución. Tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta bella relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 2 Años, el priM. ya está en la escuela. Su marido es pescador y comerciante de pescado.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado, trabajan tres días a la semana en la venta del pescado desde las 5am hasta las 16h00, en los otros días su esposo se dedica a la pesca, sale los días lunes y regresa los miércoles o jueves con el pescado y es allí donde empieza la labor de la señora ya que tiene que limpiar el pescado para ir a venderlo en buen estado, muchas veces ellos compran a otros pescadores para cumplir con los encargos que tienen de sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar combustibles y pescado ya que tiene que cumplir con los clientes.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Arenales, of the parish Crucita, every 15 days there is a meeting of the 6th of July Communal Bank. This area is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.

Elizabeth has been part of the Communal Bank since its inception and is its fiscal regulator. She likes the bank because of the seriousness of her friends and colleagues and for the help she receives from the institution. She is 25 years old. She is married, and from this beautiful relationship has two children aged 8 and 2. The first one is in school. Her husband is a fisherman and a fishmonger.

Together with her husband, she sells fish. They work three days a week selling fish from 5am to 4pm. On the other days, her husband fishes. He goes out on Monday and returns on Wednesday or Thursday with the fish. This is when her work starts, since she has to clean the fish in order to sell it well. Often they buy fish from other fishers in order to meet the orders they have from their customers. 

This loan is for buying fuel and fish in order to meet the demand of their customers.

Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish and fuel

loans.name: Poeng

texts.en: Poeng L. is a 37-year-old village woman who has had a job selling earthworms since she was single. Her husband is a local fisherman (pictured). The humble couple has two children; one is enrolled public school, one works in garment workerand has a regular salary per month. Currently, she also sells fresh fish and earthworms with her husband to wholesale and other fisherman for profit. This couple runs their business in the market and is earning approximately 5 a day. In addition, Poeng L. also planted rice two months ago, but her crops are not growing well. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and the remainder to buy seeds for planting her farmland.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and the remainder to buy seeds.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili P. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pairs of trousers and dresses to sell. Lili is 25 years old and married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children, of whom only one goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more pairs of trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Gabriela

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 22-year-old mother who lives with her family in Limón, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Evelyn has described her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a pleasant disposition. She has been working in her sales business over the past two years with the assistance of her aunt, and has observed that making sales to members of her community is an effective way to earn an income without neglecting her family responsibilities, because she can set her own work schedule. Evelyn also consults her husband before making serious business decisions. This will be her 1st loan with Fundación Mujer. 

Evelyn has a business of selling women´s clothing. The majority of her clients are friends, acquaintances and neighbors who live in her community. Her general routine is to wake up early and take care of domestic tasks such as cooking and cleaning. When the first part of her work day is complete, she gets ready to head out into the community, dedicated to the activities of her business, such as making sales, collecting payments or purchasing merchandise.
