When she is out, she relies on her mother to take care of her baby. 

Evelyn has the goal of earning enough income from her sales activity that she would be able to open a store or central location from which to sell items. Her main obstacle is a lack of the working capital necessary for making investments in clothing merchandise. Evelyn hopes to use this loan to purchase various women´s clothing items such as sports clothes and casual wear.

loans.use: To purchase women´s clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia S., from the village of Barangay 25, Gingoog City, is 43 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing, cosmetics, personal care and shoe products from Natasha and Avon in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses. Amalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts & blouses

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She has two years of experience working with mobile phones. She sells rechargeable phone cards from her house. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her parents. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards to sell. Most mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards; it is less common to have an annual phone contract. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her business and own her own phone shop.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Rather than dwelling in the past, CCT* Community Partner Lorna D. L., 45, has decided to prepare for the future. She was not able to make it to high school, but she stamped it on her mind that not graduating from a college is only a small part of her history. Lorna is married to Ibarra, a store owner. They live in Tondo, Manila, where they are raising their only child, who is now in elementary school.

Lorna co-runs a residential sari-sari (variety) store with Ibarra. Here, they buy sacks of rice and sugar and sell it retail. The rice is sold per kilo, while the sugar is repacked into pouches of usually a half kilo each. Lorna has been in business for twenty years, and they run their present sari-sari store without hiring any employees. Monthly they earn around Php 9,000.

Because she believes that her business has a future, she decided to borrow Php 14,000 to help her grow her business. She will use this loan money to purchase more sacks of rice and sugar. Lorna will make sure that her products are always available for her customers. Also, part of the loan money will go for the schooling of her child.

Lorna mentions having difficulties with customers who incur debts and with competitors in the area. However, she sees the future positively, when these difficulties are met with corresponding solutions. She dreams of a flourishing business, and a child of her own who will be finishing college with flying colors.

	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Manuel Enrique L

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel Enrique M. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “hotel Barceló Monte limar” desempeñándose como  Albañil tiene  Cuatro años  de trabajar para esta institución, es Casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de el y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Enrique M. is employed by the Barceló Montelimar Hotel as a bricklayer.  He’s been employed there for four years.  He’s married.  

He has had two loans with CEPRODEL which have been used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand, stone, gravel, cinder blocks, etc. to enlarge and improve his dwelling. 

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to him because they have helped improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida S. M. lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its sugar and agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in the area of Peer Karian. She is 25 years old and married. She supports her family financially by making paranday, an ornament used to tie-back hair. She earns reasonable profits from her business, which helps her pay the utility bills. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and manufactures furniture on order. He runs a shop in the market where he fulfills the demands of his customers by making their desired furniture. He has been in this business for over six years. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy woods, nails, and furniture polisher in large quantities, which will enable him to manufacture furniture and earn more money.  Rashida is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain maximum profits from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase woods, nails, and polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and four siblings. He has been working in a local supermarket since 2009 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. As is common among young Lebanese men, he is working and pursuing his education at the same time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his university education fees. He is studying architecture and this is his third year. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a company and be able to help his parents more with his income.

loans.use: To pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Rutwe Women's Group-Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Aisha, aged 40, runs a used clothing sales business in Kihihi Town. The divorced mother of one has been operating this business for the past five years. She says she started this business with capital from an agro-produce sales business. When I ask her about what she thinks has made her achieve this longevity in a business as fickle as this, she says it all boils down to diligence, prayers, good human relationship skills and a sense of determination. 

Aisha says this business generates 100,000 shillings weekly as accrued profits. She is already casting her mind to the future with a view of expanding her business into a bigger and more profitable enterprise. She says she is requesting this loan to purchase more bales of clothes to resell. She is affiliated to Rutwe Women's Group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Djankishi

texts.ru:
Djankishi A. rodilsya v 1956 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye pomoqayut yemu po rabote. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. 
Djankishi uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom, on delayet kanservirovanniye frukti i ovoshi a takje soleni. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti i ovoshi dlya podqotovki na konservi i soleni dlya razvitiya i uludsheniya svoyeqo bizssa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyey jeni. Ranshe ona zanimalas etim delom no potom ona zabolela i seychas yeyo muj zanimayetsya etim biznessom.
texts.en: Djankishi A. was born in 1956. He is married and has two children who help him in his work. He lives in the Absheron Region together with his wife and beloved children. For the last nine years, he has been canning fruits and vegetables as well as making marinades. At present he needs 200 AZN in order to buy fruits and vegetables to make preserves and marinades to build his business further. He has learned his trade from his wife. She used to run this business but later on she had gotten ill, and now her husband  has taken over.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eryin Johanna

texts.es: La señora Eryin se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Sus esfuerzos de tener un medio de vida es su prioridad. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado por  brindar la mejor atención a sus clientes. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, Ella inicio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de mejorar su condición. Por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como cremas, perfumes, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas  Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Eryin has a general store business. Her priority is to have a way to earn a living. She has always been known to provide better customer service. Her business is carried out itinerantly. She started her business to support herself. She had looked for work but could not find employment and it was through great sacrifice that she needed to find a way to improve her situation.  She managed to start her business and it has been very successful. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as skin lotions, perfumes, undergarments, pants, and shirts. Her dream is to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase skin lotions, perfumes, undergarments, pants, and shirts

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in a city called Arifwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She is married to P. who has a business selling fruit. He sells fruit on different streets of the city by visiting with his four-wheeled cart. He purchases fruit from the fruit market and starts going to sell them early in the morning. Shahida is a housewife who manages her household work by staying at home. She also helps her husband by arranging the fruit on his cart so he can easily sell them.  

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell and earn better profits. Shahida is hopeful that this investment will help him improve his business further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 26 years old, and she has two children who are ages 3 and 9 years old. Her husband is a farmer. This business has enabled her feed her family. Marie Claire owns a store in which she sells a variety of items including foo stuffs such as salt, rice, sugar, and she also sells other items such as soap, candles, radio cells, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop such as soap, candles, sugar, etc.in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy items to put in her shop such as soap, candles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ar: حفيظه امرأة متزوجة وهي ام لثلاث اولاد تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاولية لها في هذا العمل اكثر من سنة تحب عملها وتريد من خلاله الاعتماد على الذات والتكفل في دفع تكاليف تعليم الاولاد وزيادة مدخول لعائلة ولكنها تعرض لنقص في المدخول ورأس المال وهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية عملها من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وتطويره وتكبيره وصيانته هي امراة طموحة تحب ان تعتمد على ذاتها في مواجهة الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة ييتميز بالعمل الدائم والاسعار الجيدة لها طموح بأن تصبح ذات مكانة كبيرة في المجتمع وصاحبة محل كبير يضم جميع انواع المواد الغذائية والاولية
texts.en: Hafiza is a wife and mother of three who, through relying on herself, works to pay her children’s tuition and to further augment the family’s income. For the past year, she has been working at a market selling foodstuffs at very reasonable prices. Hafiza is very driven to overcome these hard economic times and to one day emerge a prominent women in her community with a large store. In the meantime, she wanted to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase more inventory and further expand and renovate her store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her market and further expand and renovate her store.

loans.name: Sara Noemi

texts.es: La señorita Sara tiene 23 años, es natural de Lima, soltera y esta cursando estudios de Derecho en la Universidad Cesar Vallejo, actualmente realiza practicas en un Estudio Juridico. Su deseo es graduarse como Abogada e instalar una notaria en el pueblo de donde ella es. Elprestamo lo invertira para pagar un Diplomado y un Congreso con relacion a su carrera.
texts.en: Miss Sara is 23 years old and was born in Lima.  She is single and is studying law at Cesar Vallejo University.  She is currently an intern at a law firm. Her wish is to graduate as a lawyer and to set up as a notary in the town where she lives.  The loan will be used to pay for completing her Diploma and attending a conference related to her career.

loans.use: to pay for completing her diploma and attending a conference

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина находится в счастливом браке уже многие годы. У нее двое взрослых детей.

Галина имеет свой бизнес: торгует на рынке платками, шарфами, шапками и купальниками в сезон.  Она с удовольствием занимается именно этим направлением и всегда торгует только качественными вещами. Галина жизнерадостная и приятна в общении. Прибыль тратит на свою семью и помогает детям и внукам. 

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на приобретение купальников для летнего сезона. Увеличение ассортимента привлечет новых клиентов и увеличит доход семьи.
texts.en:
Galina has been happily married for many years. She has two grown-up children. Galina has her own business: she sells shawls, scarves, hats and swimwear in season at the market. She enjoys this type of work and always sells only quality items. Galina is a cheerful and friendly person. She spends her income on her family, helping out her children and grandchildren.

Galina is applying for a loan of 20,000 UAH in order to buy swimwear for the summer season. Expanding her stock will attract new customers and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: to increase her stock of swimwear

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en: Ana Mae is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Ana Mae has a shop where she sells noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy noodles, beverages and canned goods. Ana Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ana Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Hilda y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 32 años edad, tengo seis hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es ser ama de casa”. 

Hilda es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que junto con su esposo Elmer que es albañil sacan adelante a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities here are coca, coffee, cacao and fruit production.

In the town of Quillabamba, we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet Hilda who tells us:

“I was born in the town of Quillabamba.  I am 32 years old, have six children, and live in the town where I was born.  My main business activity is being a housewife”. 

Hilda is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who, together with her husband Elmer who is a builder, gets her children ahead in life.  On this occasion, she needs a loan for personal use (to pay for her children's education).

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI V est un groupe composé de  sept membres qui tous des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne..
texts.en:
The Benkadi V solidarity group is composed of seven members, all married women who average 43 of years of age and five children each, and who live in polygamous families in Banco, the country seat of a rural town in the prefecture of Dioïla in the Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, AWA, seated first from the right, plans to purchase inputs and small equipment, and pay for labor to maintain approximately 0.25 hectare of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold locally at the Banco market and in N'Golobougou to a clientele composed of both men and women. The group members intend to earn an average profit of about 20,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds, and small equipment, and to  pay for labor

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos Luis es un señor de 55 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene el apoyo de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Carlos Luis es un micro crédito de ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones), para comprar mercadería para la pulperia, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Don Carlos Luis es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Carlos Luis is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa, in Caña Blancal, Puntarenas province. This community is noteworthy as a rural zone that attracts many visitors to its beaches. The main economic activities are tourism and agriculture/ranching. 

He says that he receives support and help from his wife, which makes it easier for him to continue with his business. He also says that his work is very interesting, since he has seen how his business has grown little by little, with demand becoming stronger, and his neighbors in the community are satisfied with the service provided. 

At this time, what Carlos Luis is requesting is a microloan of ¢500,000 (five hundred thousand colones), to buy merchandise for his general store, and to provide the best support and maintenance possible for his business.

Carlos Luis is a member of the Caña Blancal communal bank, one of EDESA's 110 partner organizations in Costa Rica. With this loan, he hopes to continue to grow on both the personal and economic levels. He also emphasizes that thanks to this type of organization and the measures to facilitate credit, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a movie maker and photographer. He offers his services at different parties and marriage ceremonies. With the loan, he will buy a new digital movie camera that will allow him to offer better quality movie-making services to his clients and earn him better profits. 

Fehmida herself is very caring lady. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Fehmida is hopeful that an investment will help her husband grow his business and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fehmida.

loans.use: To buy a new digital movie camera

loans.name: María Florencia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por una comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, lugar que se caracteriza por su riqueza natural regalándonos bonitos paisajes, su gente es muy cálida y amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos,  se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 66 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, seis de ellos son casados e independientes su hija soltera trabaja y ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad  pero es una casita pequeña.

Doña María se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa también se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos y pollos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y  alimento para animales. 

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" communal bank. She lives in the community of Parroquia del Valle. This is a place known for its natural abundance and lovely landscapes. Its inhabitants are warm and friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their people. She is a small business owner, raises animals, and farms.

María is 66, a widow, and has 7 children. All of them are adults. Six of them are married and independent. Her unmarried daughter works, and helps her financially.  She owns the house where she lives, but it is a rather small house.  

Marie works at her household chores, and as she stays home, she also works raising and selling pigs and chickens, which she sells when she has any financial need. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Shaarkan's Group

texts.en:
Shaarkan is the leader of this group. She is 63, and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised a son, age 22, who works as a policeman. 

In 1999 with an initial investment of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Shaarkan started to sell shoes. She now runs a grocery store, in order to earn money to meet her family's needs. She applies for this loan because she needs additional money to purchase more products to increase her product sales. She will purchase beverages, cookies, candies, and other supplies. In the future, Shaarkan plans to expand the store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Milagro De La Concepcion

texts.es: Milagro De La Concepción tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, día a día Milagro tiene que mantener a su familia, el objetivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, cremas, perfumes, ropa en general, prendas de oro laminado, plata, bolsos entre otros. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ya tiene varios y han sido de gran ayuda con su negocio.
texts.en: Milagro De La Concepción is 32 years old. She sells general merchandise and has been doing this for more than 6 years. Every day, Milago has to take care of her family. The purpose for the loan is to buy footwear, perfume, clothes in general, rolled gold jewelry, silver, bags and the like. This is not the first time she has asked for financing as she has several loans and they have helped her greatly with her business.

loans.use: to buy footwear, creams, perfume, clothes in general, rolled gold jewelry, silver, bags and other

loans.name: Saliori

texts.fr:
Saliou est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il n’a pas enfants. 
Saliou travaille comme revendeur de produits de premières nécessités(riz, sucre, lait , huile végétale) 03ans. Il achète les produits à Lomé et vend à ses clients dans une boutique de la place.
Saliou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en: Saliou is a 30-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has no children. He has been working as seller of staple foods (rice, sugar, milk, vegetable oil) for three years. He purchases his goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and sells to his customers in a local store. Saliou has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy grocery items.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женат. Ему 51 год. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Он 10 лет как занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdugafor lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 51 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Abdugafor has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years.  He breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mathew's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the secondary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 7,500,000 SLL in order to meet immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments.

Mathew is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kenema, the fifty-nine-year-old is married and has eight children. One is in primary school and seven are in secondary school. Mathew has been a professional teacher for the past 30 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy galvanized corrugated iron and doors for the completion of a family house he has begun.

loans.use: to buy galvanized corrugated iron and doors for the completion of a family house he has begun

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Leobardo es padre de familia y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para elaborar la barda alrededor de su casa, necesita compara block, cemento, varilla y arena, ya que su papa de dedica a la construcción y le ayudara a realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y mejorarle una mejor protección.
texts.en:
Leobardo is a father and he worries for his family's safety.

He is requesting a loan to build a wall around his house. He needs to buy cement block, cement, rebar, and sand. His father works in construction and will help him with this improvement.

He wants to improve the quality of life for his family and to improve their protection.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha, 53 years old, is a skillful lady. She is married and lives with her family: a husband and two daughters. One of her daughters is studying, and another does sewing work at home. 

Ayesha and her husband both are very hard-working people. They are involved in a business selling bed sheets. 

Their business contacts are of their community members but also outside of the community as well. They both have strived a lot to establish their business. Now, they are in a position where they can receive a good number of orders from their clients and earn a good income by filling those orders.

With this loan, they will purchase bed sheets in larger quantity to be able to fill their orders on time and generate a good income.

They are very confident about the further expansion of their business after the loan investment.

Note: One of the members in the group has an embroidered shawls business, which is why they are holding embroidered shawls.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosos paisajes, sus cuatro ríos quienes bañan a la ciudad, su gente es muy amable y cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora Blanca tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Ella labora medio tiempo en un bar y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su familia y también a vender joyas de plata, vende estos productos recorriendo la ciudad.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar joyas para incrementar este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is a member of the community bank Fuerza Trabajadora. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its beautiful scenery and the four rivers that bathe the city. Its people are very kind and cordial; they maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Señora Blanca is 19 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter who is 2 years old. Her husband works in a carpentry shop. They don't have their own house, so they rent.

She works half time in a bar. She dedicates the rest of her time to her family and also to selling silver jewelry. She travels throughout the city to sell these products.

This is her first loan with her community bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She will invest her loan in buying jewelry to increase her business.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Johan

texts.es: Johan, tiene la edad de 22 años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal, como lo son los abonos, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra. El actualmente cuenta con una plantación es estado regular pues acaba de pasar la cosecha y su cafetal necesita de la mejora de condiciones para mejorar para la próxima cosecha, por lo cual es que hará esta asistencia a su cafetal. El pretende con el crédito y la mejora a su cafetal obtener el máximo de ganancias para su bienestar familiar y tener una estabilidad económica más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Johan is 22 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife who is his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy the supplies he needs to maintain his coffee plantation.  He will buy fertilizers and herbicides, and pay laborers.  Johan currently has a plantation which is in an average state.  He has just harvested and he needs to improve the condition of his plantation so that he can improve his next harvest.  This is why he will provide it with this care.

Johan plans to use his loan to improve his plantation so that he can obtain maximum profits for his family's well-being and enjoy greater financial stability.  This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munguntsetseg, 38, runs a grocery store in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. She has been running her business for 4 years and already has had permanent clients. She lives with her husband and her children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional tent.

Her store business has been running successfully for several years and last summer she bought a car with her earnings. Now Munguntsetseg wants to expand her store sales volume to improve her business. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the groceries for her store.

loans.use: to purchase the groceries for her store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Hawa. She is married and has 4 children, age 21, 18, 8 and 6. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her, one for school and the other to assist her in her business. In 2010, Hawa established her plastic pans and dishes business. She began her business just to provide assistance to her husband. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to buy pan dishes for 3,000,000and rubber dishes for 1,000,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock levels. In the future, Hawa plans to educate her kids, to send her kids abroad and to build a house. Even thow she was not able to send her children in the US but she was able to build a house through the additional profit. She is saying thanks to Kiva, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pans and dishes for her shop.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a hardworking married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Two of her children attend primary school and she cherishes that so much. She used her previous loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed. All her chicks died due to the diseases and other conditions. She now deals in the selling of general merchandise and works for many hours each day throughout the week. She has also setup a mango growing project which is doing well and that earns her additional income. Her vision is to expand all her projects that is the shop and mango project in order to tap high profits because of the available market and educate all her children though she has not been able to fulfill her dreams due to limited capital.
She needs money to buy more items like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, biscuits, cooking oil and others to sell.

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is a very happily married man and is father of two little girls of 7 and 4 years of age, whom for he and his wife alike, are the engine that moves them to continue their daily efforts. He depends on his business of packaging sales, since 1992, some time after the passing of his father, the one who started the business to begin with. Motivated by sheer necessity to have a means to live and to finish the studies that he was at the time still completing. Today he is successful in his job thanks to constant hard work and the daily struggle for his family.

The support of his own has been indispensable to give him the strength to overcome the obstacles that have materialized. Today Servando needs a loan of $925 that he wil use to purchase materials and hence increase his earnings. Help Servando to keep and expand the business that with so much effort, work, and dedication he has built with the sole objective of giving his family what they need. Do not doubt it any longer. Support him. He and his family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Servando es una persona que esta felizmente casado, es padre de 2 pequeñas de 7 y 4 años de edad, que al igual que su esposa son el motor que lo mueven para continuar su esfuerzo cotidiano. El cuenta con un negocio propio de venta de estopa, inició en 1992, tiempo después de fallecer su padre que era la persona que originalmente comenzó con este proyecto, impulsado por la necesidad de misma de tener medios para vivir y de terminar los estudios que en ese momento estaba realizando. Actualmente continúa con éxito gracias al trabajo constante y la lucha diaria por su familia.

El apoyo de los suyos ha sido indispensable para que tenga la fuerza necesaria para vencer los obstáculos que se le han presentado. En este momento Servando requiere un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS que utilizará para la comprar de materia prima que incrementará su ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Ayuda a Servando a conservar y hacer crecer lo que con tanto esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación ha construido con el único objetivo de darle lo necesarios a su familia. No lo dudes más y apóyalo, el y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente

loans.use: purchase material

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin was born in Salyan region, Khaladj village, single. He has been in this business for 4 years.
He wants to improve his cattle breeding to cover his family expenses. Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Mrs. Samrith S., 60 years old widow, lives with her two children and two nephews in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a housing rental business and barely makes enough money to supplement the family. To help in financing the entire family, her son-in-law operates a motor-taxi business, and one of her children sells fruits in front of the garment factory. Moreover , S. is requesting for a loan amount $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her son-in-law to run a business and small part of money is to repair house for rent. In the future, she hopes to have sufficient money to build a number of rooms for rent.

loans.use:
To purchase  a motorcycle for her 
son- in -law to run a business.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.en:
Jose Raul is married and has three children; his family is the motivation behind the start up of his own business selling food eleven years ago. Noticing the great opportunity and lack of competition, he decided to start selling tacos and added other products, such as roast meats, as demand increased. His business grew and he now sells his products in several markets.

Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1200 to be used for supplies to expand his product line and improve his service. This will ensure that he meets his customers' demand, allowing his business to grow. Jose considers your assistance a blessing and he and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

José Raúl es un hombre emprendedor, está casado y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas desde hace 11 años. Al observar la oportunidad y poca competencia de este giro en los mercados decidió comenzar a vender tacos, obtuvo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y gracias a la creciente demanda que tenía fue incorporando la venta de otros alimentos como cabrito y carnes asadas, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora se instala en diferentes mercados.

Para poder mejorar la calidad de su servicio e incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, en estos momentos José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Forma parte de los logros de José, él y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar, tu ayuda es de gran bendición.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Mr. Emin is a low income vulnerable person. He is 32 and married with two children. He lives in the town of Saatli. The town is in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic, in the Caucasus region.

Emin rents a small tea shop and has hired a young man to assist him (he is pictured). His family's expenditures are increasing as his chidren grow older. Emin has trouble with his business income; it is very small compared to all the necessities demanded for his children.

Emin serves his customers very well, but the equipment he has is not enticing to bring in new customers. Emin applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to invest in his business. He hopes KIVA’s lenders can help him change his life.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Geralder

texts.en: Mrs. Geralder O. is 25 years old, married and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to people living in her community. She learnt her business for a year before she started her own in the year 2004. She needs $400 loan to buy more provision, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Arwin

texts.id:
Arwin adalah seorang pemuda yang memiliki keahlian di bidang mesin. Dia membuka usaha bengkel. Saat ini bengkelnya dikontrak oleh sebuah biro perjalanan. Jadi setiap bulan ada pendapatan tetap. Dalam satu bulan dia bisa mendapatkan uang Rp 3.600.000,00 dengan keuntungan Rp 1.200.000,00 setelah dipotong modal. Peralatan yang sekarang dia miliki hanya bisa untuk mengerjakan minibus. Arwin berencana menggunakan pinjaman Rp 7.500.000,00 yang dia peroleh untuk membeli alat – alat bengkel yang besar dan lengkap untuk mengerjakan bus. Hal ini akan menambah keuntungan yang dia peroleh.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Arwin is good with machinery, therefore he opened a workshop to fix buses. At this moment his workshop is being contracted by one of the bureau of transportation. Therefore he gets a fix income of Rp 3.600.000,00 and a profit of Rp 1.200.000,00. The equipments he has right now can only repair mini buses. Arwin intents to to use the Rp 7.500.000,00 loan to buy bigger workshop equipment so that he can also work on bigger buses. Thus increasing his profit.

loans.use: membeli alat – alat bengkel yang besar dan lengkap untuk mengerjakan bus | Buying more tools for Bus workshop.

loans.name: Laila Yvonne

texts.es:
Marzo de 1989, cuando Laila aún no estaba casada comenzó a vender cosméticos de reconocidas marcas y ropa entre amistades y familiares, ya que en su casa no contaban con suficiente dinero para poder mantenerla. Después se casó y dejó el negocio, después de que sus hijos comenzaron a crecer y con lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza para pagar todos los gastos que les piden en la escuela de sus hijos. En el 2002 reinició sus ventas pero ahora vendiendo pollos rostizados los fines de semana y tortas y tacos durante la semana. Poco a poco se a ido haciendo conocida en su comunidad.

Sin embargo Laila está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses con este dinero Laila podrá comprar material como; carne, pan, tortillas, masa, verduras, desechables, condimentos, aderezos, así como enseres menores tales como platos, sartenes, cuchillos, comales, etc. Con tu ayuda Laila podrá salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo a que sus 2 hijos salgan adelante con los estudios.

loans.use: Comprar materia prima para elaborar los pollos rostizados

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. Chen N., 47, collects raw materials to sell to the recycling plant for profit. She earns about $2 a day. Her husband Mr. Son Wa, 51, sells srambled eggs for about a 5 dollar profit a day. Because scrambled eggs are very popular in their village, he hopes to increase the number of eggs he can sell. She will use the loan to buy more eggs for her husband so they can increase their income and their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase eggs.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria has always been a courageous women and role model. Every since she started her family, she also started her own business buying and selling cheese.

She buys her products during the regional fairs around Juliaca, the city where she lives. Afterwards, she takes care of the packaging and together with her husband, Aurelio, distributes and sells the cheese in the city of Juliaca.

These loving parents work hard in order to offer their adorable children a roof over their heads and most of all, education. They are both convinced that education is the best legacy they can give to their children.

Doña María, analyzed the growing demand on her products and has therefore decided to ask for a loan in order to rise the amount she can invest to buy cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María siempre demostró ser una mujer muy valerosa y ejemplar, desD. que decidió formar su familia se dedicó íntegramente a la compra y venta D. quesos al por mayor. Ella adquiere sus productos los días D. feria en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donD. radica, Juliaca, y los acondiciona para ser vendidos en la ciudad capital D. su país, lugar donD. se encarga D. la distribución y venta su querido esposo Aurelio.

Estos ejemplares y amorosos padres trabajan arduamente con el fin D. ofrecerles un techo propio y sobre todo educación a sus adorables hijos. Ambos están convencidos que la educación a sus hijos es la mejor herencia que pueden brindarles.

Doña María, analizando la demanda del mercado decidió aumentar el monto D. inversión, es por ello que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy more cheese in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Simoambar 3 Group

texts.es:
Every morning Paulina Hernández T. sells butchered and cleaned chickens from home. She has been doing this for the past 2 years, and in the afternoons sells shoes by catalog, offering her goods to family members, friends and neighbors. With a loan, she will invest in both businesses so she can have an income to help her husband with family expenses. She belongs to the SIMOAMBAR 3 solidarity group along with Leticia Adriana, who sells perfume and cosmetics, Herlinda Sánchez M., who sell chickens, and Milagros de Jesus E., who works with amber.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

PAULINA H. T. SE DEDICA POR LAS MAÑANAS A LA VENTA DE POLLO DESTAZADO EN SU CASA, LLEVA DOS AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD, POR LAS TARDES VENDE CALZADO POR CATALOGO OFRECIENDO A FAMILIARES, AMIGOS, VECINOS. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN AMBOS NEGOCIOS YA QUE OBTIENE INGRESOS PARA OPOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO SIMOAMBAR 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA LETICIA ADRIANA (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS), HERLINDA S. M. (VENTA DE POLLO) Y DOÑA MILAGROS DE JESUS E. (ARTESANA DEL AMBAR).

loans.use: Invest in businesses.

loans.name: Akoss

texts.fr:
Madame Akoss A. is the person to the right in the picture, together with the woman on the left who helps her. Akoss is 25 years old, married and mother of one. She runs a restaurant in Lavie, a small village about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She specializes in making traditional plates like fufu and pastas. She is applying for her first loan with FECECAV to purchase yams and corn to improve her business which will help her to support the needs of her family and satisfy the demand of her regulars.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Akoss A. est la personne située à droite et l’autre personne est sa collaboratrice. Akoss est agée de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle opère un restaurant situé à Lavie, un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de , la capitale togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la préparation des plats traditionnels comme fufu et la pâte. Elle désire avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV acheter les ignames et du maïs pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle fidele.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 37 years of age. She currently lives in her own house with her family. Her husband is 42 years of age, and their 5 children are 16, 14, 11, 8, and 6 years old. They live in the western zone of the province. Lucia sells beverages and other products as a street vendor. Her husband is a delivery person for the Sobolma LTDA company under a yearly contract. She and her husband have been working for several years. She has medium competition with regards to her beverage business, whereas her husband has no competition because he has a steady job. They are both successful in their jobs because of their years of experience and constant care. With this loan, they will purchase a motorcycle that costs about 5,000.00 BOB. This is the Lucia’s third loan request in this institution, and she has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible member. She currently has another small debt in different institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia cuenta con 37 años de edad y actualmente vive junto a su familia en su casa propia. Su esposo tiene 42 años de edad y sus cinco hijos son de 16, 14, 11, 8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona oeste de la provincia. Lucia se dedica a la venta de refrescos y otros productos al por menor y de manera ambulante. Su esposo es cargador de la empresa Sobolma LTDA. bajo un contrato que es anual. La pareja desarrolla sus actividades desde hace varios años atrás La competencia es mediana en cuanto a la venta de refrescos, respecto a su esposo no haycompetencia ya que es un empleo fijo y seguro, ambos tiene éxito en sus actividades debido a su antigüedad y constante esmero. Con la presente solicitud comprarán una moto que tiene un precio aparoximado de Bs. 5,000.-. Esta solicitud es la tercera de Lucia en la institución y en el tiempo de relación comercial demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad. Actualmente tiene otra deuda pequeña en otra institución.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of wigs to resell in her community.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi C. joined the TYM Fund since 1999. Before she joined the Fund, she faced a lot of difficulties in doing business because of lack of starting fund. After several years of investment in raising animals and knitting hats, her family economy improves. Currently, there are several clothing workshops in her area. She applied to be a worker, earning 100 USD/ month. She wants to also raise animals at home, beside working in the workshop, to earn more money. Her husband is a hard worker and helps her a lot. Beside working on the rice field, he also works and earns 100 USD/month. She has 3 children who are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest in raising animals and fix the farming utilities. The family’s average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

 Chị Ngô Thị Chấu tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1999. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn vì thiếu vốn .Qua các năm vay vốn chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đan mũ kinh tế dần dần nâng lên. Hiên nay ở địa phương nhiều công ty may được thành lập chị xin vào may gia công cho các xí nghiệp may thu nhập 1,5 triệu đồng / tháng . Chị muốn ngoài thời gian đi làm chị tâp chung chăn nuôi thêm để phát triển kinh tế. Chồng chị là người chịu khó biết chia sẻ công việc cùng gia đình. Hiện tại ngoài công việc làm ruộng anh còn đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Chị có 3 con hiện đang còn nhỏ và trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và sửa chữa chuồng trại. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: A. Nargis is a 30-year-old mother whose husband has no fixed income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she processes and sells dried apricots. She uses all the money she makes to care for her three children and provide for their education. Nargis has 10 years experience processing and selling dried apricots. She is very polite and considerate and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she increases her net worth month by month. Nargis requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 9 months. She would spend the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose of processing them to increase her inventory. With your help this will be possible. Nargis expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to increase inventory

loans.name: Ibrahim S.

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim S. S.. Ibrahim was born in Kabala 46 years ago. He is married to a business woman. S. has eight children – five are in secondary schools, two are in primary schools, and the youngest is not yet of school age. Ibrahim has been a business man in Kabala for the past 20 years now. He sells roasted meat, Ataya (a Chinese green tea), and also owns a shop where his wife sells tea and drinks.

This is the very first time Ibrahim is seeking a loan from SMT. He was a very successful business man in Kabala before rebels looted his shop, where he sold bags of cement and rice. His family supplied him with the initial capital necessary to start with the new meat and soft drink business. The business is growing, but at a very slow pace. He thus came to SMT to seek a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to enable him to re-enter the business of selling cement and rice.

loans.use: Ibrahim would like to re-enter into his previous business of selling cement and rice.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. seis hijos (todos con familias), estudió el quinto año D. primaria y vive en el Jr. Chambilla Nº 341, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

DesD. hace cuatro años es socia del Banco Comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Juli. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 pudo comprar más prendas D. vestir (ropa) para seguir vendiendo en el mercado. Este es el negocio al que se dedica por varios años. Para apoyar a su hijo que decidió viajar a los Estados Unidos trabaja sin descansar desD. los 51 años D. edad ya que no contaba con el apoyo D. su esposo. En la actualidad continua con su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  más prendas D. vestir para seguir con su negocio.

“Gracias a los créditos que obtuve del Banco Comunal he incrementado mi negocio y mis ganancias”, manifestó muy contenta Paulina.

Su mayor deseo es volver a ver a su hijo que se encuentra muy lejos y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Paulina is 58 years old, is married, is the mother of six children (all with their own families), she studied until the 5th year of primary school and lives in Jr. Chambilla Nº 341, Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department. For the past four years she has been a member of the “Pequeña Roma” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she could buy more articles of clothing to continue selling in the market. She has worked on this business for various years. To support her son who decided to travel to the Estados Unidos has worked without rest since she was 51 years old as she did not have her husband's support. She currently continues with her business. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy more articles of clothing to continue with her busines. “Thanks to the loans that I obtained from the Communal Bank I have expanded by business and my earnings”, Paulina said very happily. Her greatest wish is to see her son again who is very far away and to be able to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es negociante, gracias a que hace 3 años pudo abrir una tienda, logrando con ella, aumentar los ingresos económicos en su hogar. Para Olinda, dedicarse a la venta y a la atención al cliente es lo que más le gusta realizar, ya que se familiariza con sus vecinos, además, dentro de su comunidad es una de las pocas bodegas que existen, esto le favorece, por lo que sus ventas son buenas, y sobre todo, ayudar a las personas a satisfacer sus necesidades en la alimentación es satisfactorio para Olinda. Lo difícil es la compra de su mercadería en la ciudad cercana y el trasladarlo a su comunidad. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido problemas de pago hasta el momento, ha sido responsable y puntual en todas las cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado Olinda tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos que vende, y tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olinda is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a business owner because three years ago she was able to open a store, achieving through this an increase in the economic income in her home. For Olinda, working in sales and customer service is what she most likes to do as she gets to know her neighbors. Moreover, within her community it is one of the few stores that exists, and this favors her, which is why her sales are good. Above all, helping people to satisfy their nutritional needs is satisfying for Olinda. The difficult thing is purchasing her merchandise in the nearby city and transporting it to her community. It is her second loan with MFP and she has not had problems with payment to date. She has been responsible and punctual in all of the payments. With the money requested Olinda plans to increase the quantity and variety of the products that she sells and have more to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products in her store

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeurn K. lives in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman who can catch a little fish to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Chim Pao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, she faces a problem during dry season because she does not have enough rice seeds to grow rice.

to solve this problem, Mr. Khoeurn K. is asking for a loan for his purpose. He hopes to increase his rice revenue and improve his living conditions. He is 35 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To cultivate rice during the dry season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is 38 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support when she was a young girl. Currently she lives in Accra with her family. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now runs a clothing stand and has been selling clothing materials of all kinds over the last 3 years in their busy market center. Through this business she has supported one child to complete junior high school, who is about to enter senior high school. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and a large quantity of assorted clothing materials to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Her dream has to do with providing a good quality education for her kids. She belongs to a village bank called Fervent.

loans.use: To purchase good quality and a large quantity of assorted clothing materials

loans.name: Nasim Akhtar Jeorge Qamar Group

texts.en:
Nasim Akhtar Baji is a married lady and has been a citizen of the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past seven years. Her husband's name is J. Q., and he has been running a motor workshop in the community for the past six years. People come to his workshop to repair their vehicles. 

Nasim Baji is the mother of two sons, both of whom are enrolled in kindergarten. She is a highly determined lady, so she keeps herself busy by sewing clothes. She saves her income to be able to admit her son to a good school. Nasim Baji is applying for a loan to buy repairing tools for her husband’s motor workshop. 

She is the group leader for some other women from her locality. Irshad Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine to prepare embroidered dresses to sell. Rehana Kosar Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Razia Begum Baji, Alisha Baji, and Kalsoom Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools for her husband's motor workshop

loans.name: Rodica

texts.en: Rodica N.’s property consists of 0.88 ha of arable land and 0.90 hectares of vineyard. On the arable land, Rodica grows potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers for sale. At present, Rodica has purchased 700 kg of seed potatoes to plant during the arable period. She needs to buy tomato and cucumber seeds, film for her greenhouse, and more fertilizer. She obtained her first loan from Microinvest in 2007 of 60,000 MDL for a period of 12 months for the purchase of seed potatoes and fertilizer. The purpose of this loan is to purchase tomato and cucumber seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline A. is the mother of five children ages 13, 12, 9, 7 and 6-month-old Cinderella, pictured here. Jackline is a widow and lives in Kasawino next to the Nyamasaria slum, here in Kisumu.  She sells vegetables and is asking for 10,000 KSH to help pay school fees for her children. Jackline said that her situation has become more and more difficult in recent months. She heard about K-MET from friends who received loans and had success increasing the profit of their business.

loans.use: paying school fees for her children

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana and her husband are engaged in fishing to earn for the daily living of their family. Victoriana is 46 years old and she resides, with her family, in Barangay Minanga Norte somewhere in Iguig, Cagayan. She has two children: Irene, 25 years old, works as a saleslady in Tuguegarao City and Ailene, 19 years old, is presently a second-year college student. Victoriana and her husband sacrifice a lot so they can continue sending their youngest child to school so that someday she will be able to finish college. 

Ailene, their youngest, is a working student in order to support her studies and to lessen her parents’ sacrifices. Victoriana sells the fish, caught by her husband, in their village. She roams around their village or goes to the market of Iguig to sell the fish. Her husband is a fisherman and she assists him in providing for the family’s basic needs. Victoriana is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 ($250US) to buy fish nets to make her husband's fishing easier. The loan will be of great help to increase their income. That amount will really help them to improve their daily finances.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets to be used in fishing.

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Сайдали Салихов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Сайдали имеет столовую, собственную. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается вместе со своей семьей, более 10 лет. Его старший сын занимается покупками продуктов, дочка официантка, жена повариха и т.д. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать столовую и еще запастись продуктами питания.
texts.en:
Saidali S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of seven. Saidali owns his own cafe. He and his family have been in this area of business for over 10 years. His eldest son does the shopping, his daughter is the waitress, his wife the cook, etc. This client is seeking a loan from us to make repairs to the cafe and stock up on groceries.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to Cafe

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. is from the village of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 47 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Lydia fishes and sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her second loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement her family's needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat K. is very persistent and dedicated to giving her children what's needed to get ahead in life. For this reason, she works daily in the fields tending and harvesting vegetables that she sells in the market. A lot of the time the chores in the fields result in little compensation, and so recently she set up a sales post in her home for fruits and candy. This allows her to tend to her home as well. Nazokat wishes to have more capital to invest in her work so that she can increase her income and improve her beloved children's well-being. She will use this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Alberto Miomo

texts.pt:
Alberto Miomo C. nasceu em Gaza, tem 62 anos de idade e casado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendas entre os 10 aos 40 anos de idade. Somente os três mais novos e que se encontram a estudar.

Alberto sai de gaza quando criança para capital Maputo a procura de emprego, começa a trabalhar para um oficial Português como empregado doméstico, mas devido a sua dedicação no trabalho o português consegue arranjar uma vaga para ele numa das escolas oficias e faz a 6ª classe do antigo sistema. Anos depois o patrão volta a Portugal e ele fica desempregado então emigra para áfrica do sul e trabalha nas minas, mas devido à morte do seu irmão durante a escavação na mina seu pai obriga Alberto a deixar aquele emprego alegando que era muito perigoso, assim ele regressa a casa da sua irmã esta que vivia no Município da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia. Dois anos depois consegue arranjar um emprego como estivador bracal e devido à dedicação e força de vontade é promovido para gerente do STIVA durante 20 anos auferia mensalmente um valor de 25.000.00MT, mas quando ele é avisado acerca da sua reforma constrói de imediato uma barraca em sua casa. Hoje ele é reformado e aufere um valor mensal de 8.500.00MT o que não satisfaz as sua necessidades então numa conversa com a sua esposa que e nossa cliente fala acerca dos nossos serviços aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negócio. O impacto da sua actividade é notório, pois fornece produtos básicos a comunidade reduzindo distâncias anteriormente percorridas em busca do mesmo serviço. Tem viajado uma vez por semana, pois é único com barraca e porque também tem facilidade de transporte, tem tido de lucro 2.500.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois iram ajudar muito nos momentos críticos do seu negócio, para alem dos seus filhos não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Alberto na Hluvuku e Kiva, os 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu negócio, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro para dar inicio a criação de frangos.
texts.en:
Alberto Miomo C. was born in Gaza. He is 62 years old, married, and the father of 7 children with ages between 10 and 40 years old. Only the three youngest are in school. Alberto left Gaza when he was a child for the capital, Maputo, in search of work. He began working for a Portuguese official as domestic help. Due to his dedication to his work the Portuguese was able to arrange a spot for him in one of the official schools, and he finished the 6th grade in the old system. Years later his boss returned to Portugal, and he was left unemployed. He went to South Africa and worked in the mines, but due to the death of his brother during an excavation of a mine, his father demanded Alberto to leave that line of work claiming it was too dangerous. He came to live with his sister who lived in the town of Namaacha which borders Swaziland. Two years later he was able to arrange a job as a cargo loader, and because his dedication and force of will he was promoted to the manager of STIVA. For 20 years he earned a monthly sum of 25,000MT, but when he was advised of his retirement he immediately constructed a stand in his home. Today he is retired and earns a monthly sum of 8,500MT which does not satisfy his necessities. During a conversation with his wife, who is our client, he learned of our services and solicited a loan in the amount of 15,000MT to strengthen his business. The impact of his activity is notorious. He provides basic products to the community reducing the distances people previously covered in search for the same service. He travels one time each week, and he is the only one with a stand and also because he has transportation. He has earned 2,500MT and is able to save 1,000MT, and that has helped in the critical moments of his business. Besides his children he is not responsible for anyone else. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to increase the volume of his business. He is confident that he will pay off the loan before the due date and request another loan to begin raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Нурматов Шавкат- молодой мужчина со средним образованием ,ему 30 лет. Имеет жену и троих детей. У Шавката дружная семья, все вместе трудятся, зарабатывая свой хлеб собственным трудом. Более 12 лет они откармливают мелкий и крупный скот на дому.  Шавкат закупает скот на рынках подешевле   и оставляет на 3-4 мес. откармливать. Это приносит ему хорошую выгоду и он решил заниматься этим делом навсегда.Кроме этого у него есть и другой доход который позволяет ему двойную пользу: он водит грузовую автомашину.Шавкат перевозит всякие материалы, скот, сено короче всё по сезону.Он старается всячески подработать на жизнь.
texts.en:
Shavkat N. is a young man, who has secondary education. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. Shavkat's family is friendly. They work together, earning their bread with their own hard work. They have been raising cattle and small livestock at home for over 12 years. Shavkat buys livestock at markets at low prices and feeds it for 3-4 months. Because this brings him a good profit, he decided to be involved in this business forever. Besides this, he has another source of income, which provides him with a dual benefit: he drives a heavy-duty truck. Shavkat transports various materials, livestock, hay and basically everything seasonal. He tries to earn a living in many ways.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 60 years old and single. She owns a general store in the village of Rio Del Grande, Enrile, Cagayan. Her store is located in front of her house and it is open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.

Luciana wants to borrow 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to buy different merchandise for her store. She also sells root crops and different kinds of vegetables. The income from her business is being used to meet the needs of her family. Despite her age, Luciana is very determined to further develop her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a store

loans.name: Consuelo Antonia

texts.es: Consuelo Antonia C. García tiene 45 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, y así buscar nuevos ingresos, ya para que sus hijos tuvieran la oportunidad de estudiar. Consuelo es una mujer que tiene todo el deseo y empeño de salir adelante. Ella se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene realizar las tareas del hogar y atender a sus hijos. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, pan y refrescos. Su mayor sueño es seguir proporcionándole a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Consuelo Antonia C. García is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has been operating a grocery store for more than 3 years.
