She looks for new ways to generate revenue so that her children can have the opportunity to study. Consuelo is a woman who has all the desire and determination to get ahead. She wakes up very early to perform the household chores and attend to her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase basic grains, soap, detergents, bread and soft drinks. Her biggest dream is to continue providing her family with income to meet their basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 38-year-old divorced woman raising her only child. She has owned a clothes shop since 2006 to earn income to satisfy her child needs. Today, Fadia is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es: La señora Dorila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. repuestos y al mismo tiempo brinda servicios D. arreglos y mantenimientos D. artefactos, juntamente en acuerdo con su hijo mayor, trabajan juntos, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. brinda el servicio diariamente  por las mañanas y tardes. Lleva 06 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, comprará repuestos para licuadoras, lavadoras, planchas, allas arroseras. Nos cuenta que brinda un servicio D. calidad, para que  así; sus clientes queden satisfechos y contentos.Dorila, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dorila belongs to the communal bank Manos Unidas (joined hands), Tarapoto district, Sam Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She is married, 55 years old and has 4 children, all of them already independent. Her fighting spirit which has always characterized her and her drive to get ahead by her own means, have helped her start her own business selling spare parts and at the same time offering repair and maintenance services of appliances together with her oldest son. They work together, she is located in her own house, where little by little she became well known among her customers and today she tells us that she is doing very well in this activity. Currently, she continues with the same business where she offers services daily in the morning and afternoons. She has been working this business for 6 years and feels very happy with what she does. With this loan for S/. 1,300.00 she will buy spare parts for blenders, washing machines, irons, steamers. She tells us that she offers a high quality service, so that her customers are satisfied and happy. Dorila feels very calm and happy with what she does and thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to her achievement of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts for electrical appliances.

loans.name: Emierissa

texts.en:
Emierissa  is from the town of Solinog,Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 34 years old.  To make a living, Emierissa owns & operates a business venture in retail. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of clothes in the local community. 
 In 2008, Emierissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emierissa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Emierissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emierissa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her clothes retail business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 38 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial center where most people make a living as traders and farmers. Augustina supports herself and her family by selling charcoal. She buys her supplies of charcoal in nearby communities and sells it in the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy charcoal in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is a 25-year-old woman whose husband is a soldier at Bilpam. She has one young child who does not yet attend school.  Agnes runs a business selling used clothes and shoes. She started two years ago and unfortunately business is declining due to lack of customers.  That is why she is requesting a loan from BRAC southern Sudan, so she can stock bedsheets to sell. In the future, Agnes hopes to buy two sewing machines for designing bedsheets to sell.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is forty-two years old. She is married, has given birth to five children, and all of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family.

Joyce trades in second hand clothes. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Joyce has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to procure stock in bulk.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Eveling Violeta

texts.es: La señora Eveling tiene 51 años de edad, casada, procreo  cinco hijos, actualmente reside en un barrio Villa Reconciliación, se dedica a la venta de cosmético el cual vende al contado y al crédito, también alquila un cuarto lo cual ha sido de mucho para poder pagar gastos en su hogar, su esposo trabaja en construcción pero en el país de Costa rica  junto  a mis cuatro hijos están allá trabajando por que se hizo difícil el trabajo aquí en nuestro país y teníamos que buscar una solución aunque muy duro pero hay que salir adelante por que hay necesidades de alimentación, pagos de agua, luz, vestimenta entre otros, solo una hija esta con conmigo. Este préstamo lo quiere para comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hiero y terminar de construir un muro que parte lo tiene con zinc ya que es de mucha necesidad para mejor seguridad ya que solo vivimos dos mujeres que espero que pronto regrese mi familia. Da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible las mejoras  a su vivienda con el crédito anterior mejoro el cuarto del alquiler para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
Eveling is 51 years old, is married, and has raised five children. She currently lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She works selling cosmetics, which she sells both for direct payment and on credit. She also rents out a room, which has been a great help to be able to pay household expenses. Her husband works in construction, but in Costa Rica, along with her four sons. They are working there because the work situation became difficult in their country they had to find a solution. Although it is very hard, one has to keep going because there are needs like food, payments for water and electricity, and clothing, among other things. Only one daughter lives with her. She wants this loan in order to buy stone, sand, cement and iron, to finish building a wall that is partly built out of zinc. This is very necessary because they are two women living alone. She hopes that her family returns soon. She thanks the lending institution for making it possible to improve her home with a previous loan. She improved the rented room, in order to provide a better service to her renters. This has been very beneficial.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to finish a wall that she has

loans.name: Mrs. Nhaeth Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhaeth V. is a village bank president who leads 22 people who all live in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nhaeth V. is a mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker and the other two are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Nhaeth V. and her husband, Mr. Vy Von, are farmers who own a 0.9-hectare field to cultivate rice. In her rice farming, Mrs. Nhaeth V. faces a problem because the soil is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline for her water machine to water her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline .

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sandhya K. is a resident of Bhakepati in the Kathmandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing villages of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Sandhya lives in a single family with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is studying in grade 9.

Both Mrs. Sandhya and her husband, Mr. Dipak K., are engaged in their own flower garden. They grow different types of food in their garden. They sell their flowers in the local market. Now Mrs. Sandhya is requesting a 15000.00 Nepalese rupee loan to buy different types of seeds and fertilizers for their work.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Madzdi

texts.en:
Madzdi T. is from the city of Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City. He is 33 years old and is married. Madzdi owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling "okay-okay" (used clothes) in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Madzdi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Madzdi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny M. A., tiene la edad de 34 años, está en unión libre, y no tienen hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros para así aumentar su número. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yorleny tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yorleny M. A., 34, is in a common-law relationship and has no children. She will use the funds to buy a few calves. She wants to provide them with adequate care so that she can earn the highest possible profits upon their sale. She also wants to increase the number of animals and raise them under better conditions. She has a space that is suitablel for cattle raising. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the terms she was offered. Yorleny has been in cattle raising for several years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future; she also aims to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a few calves.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive, en la zona villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa Marcela y su familia que consta de tres hijos mayores y sus respectivas familias.

Es rentista jubilado de una institución estatal.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para realizar algunas mejoras en las habitaciones y techos de su domicilio, ya que por esta época constante de lluvias ha ocasionado que el techo de su habitación tenga filtraciones de agua y necesite urgentemente un cambio parcial de calamina (calamina es una hoja de aluminio que se usa comúnmente para techar habitaciones).
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Villa Exaltación neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives together with his wife, Marcela, and his family which is made up of three older children and their respective families. He is a renter who retired from a state institution. The loan is destined for the acquisition of construction materials to make some improvements to his home including the rooms and the roof. It’s the rainy season and the constant rain has caused leaks in the roof in his bedroom. He urgently needs to partially change the corrugated roof (“calamina” is a sheet of aluminum that is commonly used for roofing). This is his first loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of corrugated tin roof and other materials to repair his home's roof.

loans.name: Carmen Leonor

texts.es: Carmen es de 34 años de edad, es soltera, labora como secretaria en un Instituto de Educación primaria, en sus ratos libres y los fines de semanas se dedica a vender productos de belleza, lo cual le ha ayudado a complementar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos, en ASDIR es el quinto crédito que solicita los anteriores los ha pagado puntualmente, necesita el financiamiento para surtir y aumentar su mercadería en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old, single, and works as a secretary at an elementary school. In her free time and on the weekends, she sells beauty products. This has helped to supplement her income for covering her expenses. She is requesting her fifth loan from Asociación ASDIR and has repaid her previous loans on time. Carmen needs the money to restock and increase her inventory of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
Susita Y. is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in Hda. San Antonio Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Susita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 8 years and earns a living by buying and selling root crops. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF, to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to extend her productive hours

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: Etelvina tiene 32 años, es una alegre mujer que vive con su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos Fredy y Leyla de 5 y 2 años respectivamente. La venta de Anticuchos es la actividad a la que se dedica, junto a su hermana, quien es socia en el negocio. De esta manera vende este tradicional plato, elaborado a base de corazón de res y papas cocidas con salsa y ají, en un paradero de buses donde hay mayor concurrencia de gente, siendo sus principales clientes los chóferes, pasajeros y vecinos de la zona. Este negocio le es rentable, por lo que espera mas adelante tener su propio restaurante, en donde pueda  preparar y vender sus deliciosos platillos, pero para ello deberá trabajar y juntar el capital necesario para realizar su sueño. Por el momento desea dedicarse íntegramente al trabajo para poder sacar a su familia adelante. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus paltillos así como una parrilla, además comprará mesas para dar mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Etelvina is a 32 year old cheerful woman who lives in her own home with her children Fredy and Leyla, ages 5 and 2 respectively. She sells “anticuchos” with her sister, who is also a partner in the business. They sell this dish, which is made of beef hearts and potatoes cooked in a chili sauce, at a bus depot where there is a large influx of people. Their main customers are drivers, passengers, and residents of the area. This business has proven to be profitable, and she hopes to eventually open her own restaurant where she can prepare and sell her delicious dishes. However, she needs to continue working so that she can obtain the necessary capital to fulfill her dream. For now, Etelvina wants to devote herself entirely to moving her family forward.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Etelvina promises to complete all of her payments on time. The loan she requested will be used to purchase ingredients and a grill for preparing her dishes. She also plans to acquire tables so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, a grill, and tables

loans.name: Kisakwa

texts.en:
Kisakwa S. is 26 years old. He and his wife, Monica, have two children. Kisakwa is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last six years.
  
He learned about KADET from a neighbor who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to prepare twenty acres of land to plant wheat, which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land to increase his wheat production. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and plant more wheat for commercial purposes. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale wheat farmer. He is a hard-working man and determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare twenty acres of land to plant wheat

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Cette femme est âgée de 35 ans,  elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des articles de quincaillerie, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005, actuellement son stock est en épuisement, voulant  se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers articles de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
This woman is 35 years old and has been involved in the sale of hardware items since 2005. Her stock level is currently low and so she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to replenish it with more hardware items.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware items

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa G. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Marisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Marisa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the thirrd loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. A. tiene 29 años. Esta casado con la Sra. Maura Cuellar y tienen un hijo menor de edad. 
Tienen su casa propia en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
El Sr. A. tiene una casa de Bordados en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 11 años. Su Sra. le ayuda en los bordados a maquina y costura.
 El Sr. Francisco necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderías en cantidad a menor precio como telas de varios tipos, remeras, gorras y otros. 
 En el futuro desean habrir una sucursal en la ciudad de Luque donde también hay mucho movimiento comercial.
texts.en:
Francisco A. is 29 years old. He is married to Maura Cuellar, and they have a young son. They have their own home in the city of San Lorenzo. Francisco A. has had an embroidery workshop in the city of San Lorenzo for 11 years. His wife helps him with the sewing and the machine embroidery. Francisco needs a loan to acquire merchandise in bulk at a lower price, such as various types of fabric, t-shirts, caps and other items. In the future they want to open a branch in the city of Luque, where there is also a lot of commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, t-shirts, caps, etc.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida K. is the leader of the group. Forty-seven-years-old and married, she has three sons, the first of whom works in Russia, while the others study at school. In order to earn a living, Farida works as a teacher, while her husband is a painter. This year they have started to breed cattle, and with money received from the loan Farida wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future she plans to save some money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

Aishahan T. is 19 years old. A year ago with the initial investment of 200 soms she started to put credit on mobile balance (for each payment she gets 5 soms). In this way she makes 1000 soms per month. Now she wants to start sewing national cloth and dressmaking supplies. And she applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials. Navat S., 40, is married. She has a son and two daughters, both students. In order to make money Navat works as a nurse and her husband works in Russia. Navat also breeds cattle; she has been doing it for fifteen years. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future Navat wants to repair the house and save money to be able to pay for her children’s education at university. Asal S. is the treasurer of the group, 37. Sewing national cloth and dressmaking supplies Asal makes money to cover her personal expenditures. She has been sewing for 20 years and her monthly income is 7000 soms. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the future she plans to open a sewing workshop. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf for breeding

loans.name: Nomelia

texts.en: Nomelia P. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan. She is 45 years old. Nomelia is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Nomelia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Nomelia has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nomelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nomelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nomelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be also used to purchase new raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Nomelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 24 years old and he is married.  Innocent is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of cosmetic goods as his picture indicates.  He has been in this business for about 3 years and the hours of his business are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Innocent needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Innocent has a vision of wholesaling.  If he starts to wholesale goods to the retailers from his business area, he really hopes that his profits will increase which in turn will allow him to keep expanding his business for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: a variety of cosmetic goods for sale

loans.name: Wiston Didi

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

En este Banco encontramos al señor winston, y nos cuenta algo de su vida. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años y tiene tres hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y también vende artículos de belleza.

El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es un vendedor ambulante, vende artículos para el hogar (planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, tostadoras, entre otros artículos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Dice que es cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo donde le dan precio para comerciante.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar toda clase de artículos para el hogar mas que todo planchas y licuadoras que es lo que mas se vende. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios ciclos y está muy agradecido porque lo han sacado de muchos apuros.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial para vender en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Winston is a member of this community bank and he tells us about his life. He has lived with his girlfriend for the past 20 years and they have three children together. His girlfriend is a housewife and she sells cosmetics. He sees himself as a fighter. The business he has is difficult but he always looks to advance in life. He sells household items in the streets (irons, fans, blenders, toasters, etc.). He works every day from 8am to 8pm. He says that he feels tired but he knows he has to keep going for the sake of his family. He purchases his merchandise in Portoviejo, where he gets special deals. This loan will be used to purchase all kinds of articles for the home, but especially irons and blenders, articles that are most sought out. He has been a member of the community bank for many loan cycles and he is very grateful for the support as they have helped him significantly. His dream is to have a store from where to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase irons, blenders, toasters etc..

loans.name: Dicko Fall

texts.fr: Madame Dicko fall K. est une veuve de 66 ans qui habite  à Bambilor. Elle est commerçante. Elle s’adonne à  l’achat et la vente de légumes tels que choux, piments, etc depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a choisie ce métier pour avoir des revenus qui lui permettent de  faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes car elle est soutien de famille .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis novembre 2009. Elle a déjà bénéficiée d’un  prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un  crédit de 200 000 francs CFA dont le but est de  renforcer  son étal en légumes et mieux les diversifier en vendant de l’huile de palme, des carottes, et des navets. Ce crédit lui permettra  d’augmenter ses bénéfices  pour mieux gérer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dicko Fall K. is a 66 year-old widow living in Bambilor. She is a merchant who has been buying and selling vegetables (such as cabbages, hot peppers, etc.) for over 20 years. She chose this business to have revenues which would allow her to face the daily expenses of her family, since she is the breadwinner. She has been a member of the Bambilor branch since November 2009, and has already been the beneficiary of one loan from this organization. She is requesting a 200,000 loan to strengthen her vegetable stand and to diversify it by selling palm oil, carrots and turnips. This loan will allow her to increase her benefits to better manage day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. is from the village of Baan, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Cristina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and medicines. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and medicines

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun R., 48, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Seng, 50, have been married since 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home; one is a garment factory worker, while the other two attend school. They family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saroeun has been operating a business producing bath mats for five months. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, but because his motorbike is old and requires frequent expensive repairs, she is requesting a loan of $300 to replace it.

loans.use: To buy a replacement motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Ruth has a poultry business which she has had for less than a year.  She does outside catering  

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chicken.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to own a plot of land. Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase more chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Q. is from the Barangay of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married to Antonio Q., and blessed with 4 children, 3 of whom are school-aged and one who is already married. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a crab-dealing business. She is also receiving support from her husband, who is a fisherman. She’s been engaged in the crab-dealing business for 15 years. Together with her husband, she is earning at least 3,500 PHP. 

Just this year, Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting 5,000 PHP as her first loan, which will be used for additional capital for her existing crab-dealing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, her children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital in her crab-dealing business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 58 years old and married to Ernest. They are blessed with five children, ages 22, 20,19,18 and 16 years. She has been in the farming business for five years which earns her about $125 per month. Over this period she has been able to master the fast-moving farm products and also has identified potential clients, so she is most likely to excel.

She was introduced to Kadet by friends who have benefited from Kadet loans, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business so as to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and manure

loans.name: Pauline Wambui

texts.en:
Pauline is 55 years old.  She is married to N. Kabia. They have two children. Pauline has a grocery store, which adds to her husband's income. She has been running this shop for a period of five years, with a profit of about Kshs 4,000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She wants to use it to buy carrots and tomatoes for sale. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family by expanding her shop to get more income.  She also hopes to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. His farm produces maize, beans and bananas, which are all sold locally. He also operates a shop and a hotel business in the same region. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. His major challenge has been the high cost of farm inputs, which affects his production. In the future, he would like to acquire more land to enable him to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane K. lives in the Lugala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  For the last 10 years, she has made a living selling charcoal seven days a week. She supplements her income by selling smoked fish. Jane is applying for a loan of 100,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. Her main problems are transportation, especially during the rainy season, and customers who fail to make payments on time.  Her goals are to become a wholesaler, and to educate her children through the university level. Jane lives in a home that she owns, and has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Gertrudis es una mujer trabajadora, con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, zapatos y bisutería, iniciando hace trece años, con ahorros  provenientes de su esposo quien labora como técnico operarios.
Su negocio ha crecido gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado en treces ciclos, lo que ha mejorado parte de la infraestructura como la compra de vitrinas para lucir mejor sus productos.
Con este nuevo préstamo mejorara la división de los cuartos, ya que están en mal estado lo que es de gran relevancia para su familia. Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a hard working woman.  She has a small business selling clothes, cosmetics, perfumes, shoes and costume jewelry.  She started out three years ago with savings she got from her husband who works as an operations technician.  Her business has grown thanks to loans that Afodenic has granted in 13 cycles.  She has improved her infrastructure buying display cases to showcase her products better.

She will use this new loan to subdivide rooms in her house which currently are in poor conditions; this is very relevant for her family.  She will buy building materials and supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron rods to start the project.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron rods to start the room subdivision.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is married to a mason and has three children. Together they take care of the family. Salamatu assists her husband in the general welfare of the home.
Salamatu cooks various kinds of food for sale. She displays the food on a table. The loan Salamatu is asking for will serve as additional capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Boniface Mwanza

texts.en:
Boniface M., who is 26 years old, operates a quarry business. He is married to Elizabeth, who is 24 years old, and together they have a daughter and a son aged four and two years respectively. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing customer.

Boniface’s business is located in Lukenya and it has been in operation for the last three years. The business earns him a monthly profit of about $219. He intends to use entire loan amount to purchase a stone cutting machine and blades. If the loan boosts the business, he intends to buy another quarry.

In the future, Boniface wants to have a big quarry and buy lorries for transportation of stones to the sites. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase a stone cutting machine and blades.

loans.name: Fenya

texts.en: Fenya M. lives in the village of Azatan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She has been a farmer for over 20 years. Even though it is difficult, Fenya enjoys the work. With the help of her husband she has also been able to raise three children – a 13-year-old daughter and two sons (6 and 12 years old).  In order to grow the family business she would like a loan to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers. She expects the family income to increase by 20 percent. She has a simple dream – for her children to live happy lives.

loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is employed and he contributes to upbringing of his children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Binti faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans and potatoes. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Duo Los Hermanos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS HERMANOS
El grupo está integrado por  dos personas él es  Benjamín Basilio C.  quien tiene  23 años  es soltero   inicio con su negocio de especies  (Pepitoria, ajonjolí etc.)  Desde  hace 11 años a la venta ayudando a su papa, su padre falleció y él se hizo cargo del negocio y hermanos menores de edad, el ayuda  al sustento diario de cada uno de ellos enviándoles  dinero cada mes su  meta es poder traer a su familia donde él vive actualmente como también poder crecer más en sus ventas de especias en el Mercado Municipal.solicita el credito para la compra de especies. La señorita Catarina Beronica A. C. tiene 19 años es soltera  vive con su hermano  ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas (tomate, pepino, lechugas manzanas etc.)  desde hace 4 años  inicio con la ayuda de su hermano quien le dio el capital ella aun estudia   su primaria por las noches su deseo es poder  crecer en su venta de verduras para poder ayudar a su hermano para poder sustentar a su familia,ella solicita el credito para la compra de verduras y verduras.
texts.en:
"DUO LOS HERMANOS" Group

The group is comprised of two people: Mr. Benjamín Basilio C., age 23, who is single.  He began a spice business selling pumpkin and sesame seeds.  For the last 11 years he had been helping his father, who passed away, so he took over the business and cares for his younger siblings by sending money to them every month.  His goal is to bring his family to live nearer and to increase his spice sales in the town market.  He will use the loan to buy spices.

Miss Catarina Beronica A. C., age 19, is single and lives with her brother who gave her the capital to begin business.  She is still studying primary school level at night.  Her dream is to expand her vegetable business to help her brother support the family.  She plans to use the loan to buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit and spices

loans.name: Perusi

texts.en:
Perusi is 56 years old and is married with 8 children between the ages 10 and 22 years old. Her business is well organized. She employees two people in her business. Her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day and she has ten years of experience.
 
Perusi has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With this loan, Perusi will build her own house and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane est un homme marié de 44 ans et père de 4 enfants, qui vit chez lui même avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Né et grandi à Bougouni et n’ayant pas avancé à l’école, très vite il commença des activités économiques, notamment l’achat vente des articles de quincaillerie: peintures, colles, pinceaux et autres articles divers, qu’il a appris auprès de son grand frère.  Avec une expérience de 2 ans, Monsieur Souleymane maîtrise son activité.
Il  décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso afin de renforcer ses activités.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 20 bidons de  peintures, 30 pinceaux, 5 sacs de chaux vive et bien d’autres articles divers pour sa boutique afin d’attirer davantage la clientèle. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Avec ce prêt, il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane is an married 44-year-old father of four.  He lives with his wife and children in Bougouni in the Torakabougou neighborhood.

Born and raised in Bougouni, he has no advanced education and began working very early.  From his older brother he learned the business of buying and selling hardware products:  paints, glues, brushes and other items.  With two years’ experience, Souleymane has mastered the business.  He has decided to participate in Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program to strengthen his business.  

With this loan, he plans to buy 20 jugs of paint, 30 brushes, 5 sacs of quicklime and lots of other similar articles for his store in order to attract more customers.  This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso.  He buys his stock in Bamako (the capital of Mali), and his customers are local.  

With this loan, he hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which he plans to use to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells clothes. She is 38 years old, married, with four children and all of them go to school. Betty took out a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cinthia Katherine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Cinthia Katherine; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, artesanías y gaseosas, ella tiene un kiosco en la estación de trenes en el distrito de Ollantaytambo y también la socia trabaja en un empresa que vende aceites de consumo, ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 7:00 p.m y el negocio de venta de golosinas, artesanías y gaseosas lo realiza su mama, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo y ampliar el negocio de Kiosco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, galletas, caramelos, gaseosas y artesanía al por mayor.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Srta. Cinthia Katherine, 22, is a member of the SIEMPRE ADELANTE community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Srta. Cinthia is single.  She has a business selling candy, snacks and soft drinks that she operates from a kiosk at the train station in the Ollantaytambo neighborhood.  She also works for a cooking oil sales company, delivering cooking oil to local stores.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm while her mother tends her kiosk business.  She wants to expand the kiosk business, so she is applying for a loan to buy wholesale supplies of various snack products: lollipops, crackers, caramels, soft drinks, etc.  

Srta. Cinthia is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy wholesales supplies of candy and snacks for her retail business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, 41 years old, is a married woman with three daughters. The oldest child is 16 and the youngest is only 6.  Elvie and her husband are farmers in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  Elvie has been growing rice for 15 years. Her average income per month is Php 15,000.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  In future, Elvie hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that sells ready to wear clothes like t-shirt & blouses. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ready to wear or RTW clothes to sell.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth, vive con su familia, dos hijas de 16 y 18 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de merienda, este negocio es rentable porque cerca tiene la escuela, donde ofrece a los estudiantes y profesores sus platillos típicos de comida.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, como queso, pollo, condimentos, aceite y bebidas, le ayudara esta compra a tener disponibilidad de productos, con los que puede mejorar el negocio.
Su aspiración es que el negocio sea rentable y cuente con mayor número de clientes, para así garantizar una mayor ganancia económica.
texts.en: Ruth lives with her family, two daughters who are 16 and 18 years old. She is dedicated to selling packed lunches. This business is profitable because nearby is a school where she offers her typical food dishes to students and teachers. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for the business, such as cheese, chicken, condiments, oils and drinks. This purchase will help her ensure products are available and allow her to improve the business. Her aspiration is that the business is profitable and that she has a greater number of customers so she may guarantee more income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like chicken, condiments, oil and drinks (soda and juices)

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells gari and palm oil at Elmina. The picture above depicts Adjoa standing close to the gallons she uses to store the palm oil. She has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution. Her future plan towards her business is to buy land.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution.

loans.name: Ricardo Limber

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive Don Ricardo, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en  escuela. Su mujer es ama de casa.

Nuestro amigo para ganarse el sustento diario se dedica al comercio, el junto a su esposa elaboran dulces de distintos sabores y formas, para luego llevarlos a vender, vende todos los días ya que sus productos son muy apetecidos. Lleva en este negocio ya por 20 años.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para elaborar los dulces. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su negocio mejore cada día mas.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ciudad Alfaro” (New City of Alfaro) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, noted for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are well-known nationally and internationally; it’s the place the famous straw hats come from.

Ricardo, 48, lives in this place.  He is in a common law relationship and has an 8-year-old son that goes to school.  His wife’s a housewife.

Our friend earns his livelihood working as a merchant.  Together with his wife he makes candy of various shapes and flavors to then sell.  He sells every day since his products are quite tempting.  He’s been in this business for 20 years now.

This loan will be used to buy foodstuffs needed to make the candy.  He’s been in the communal bank almost since the beginning and likes it because he can finance his business with the loans.  His dreams are to stay in business and that it produces more every day.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mumtazan's Group

texts.en:
Mumtazan is married and her husband has a business selling milk. Mumtazan also offers her full support to her husband in his business. She takes care of his cow by giving timely food and water. She milks the cow every morning while her husband delivers the milk to people's homes. 

Mumtazan is 34 years old and doesn’t have any children.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another cow to get a larger quantity of milk for selling. He has a good experience in his business and he has a good number of clients in his region. 

Mumtazan is very hopeful that an investment will help him make more profit by selling a larger quantity of milk. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another cow for milk selling business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with four children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for a year and also earns an income from selling rice.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marter

texts.en:
Marter is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread and onions in Hai Gwafa in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Marter requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school

loans.use: to purchase more bread and onions for sale.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 18, 14 años de edad; la socia trabaja en un hotel en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja en turismo, la socia desea invertir en la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viajara para traer ropa a la ciudad de Lima y comprara ropa de temporada al por mayor, la socia desea vender a sus compañeras de trabajo, la socia invertirá su dinero en la compra de ropa al por mayor y viajara a la ciudad de Lima para invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta y poder tener mejores ingresos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Atipay communal bank in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Maria is 40 years old and single.  She has two children, ages 18 and 14.  She works at a hotel in the city of Cusco; she works in tourism.

Maria wishes to invest in the buying and selling of clothes.  She will travel to get clothes in the city of Lima.  She will buy seasonal clothes wholesale.  She wishes to sell to her work colleagues.  She will invest her money in the purchase of wholesale clothes.  She will travel to the city of Lima to buy clothes to sell.  This way she will be able to have improved income.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of clothes.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in this business for the past one year. He is 37 years old and married to Mary, and they have two school going children.

He got to know about KADET LTD through one of their existing clients. This is John’s first loan from KADET, and he will use this loan to increase his stock in his shop, by adding sugar, salt and washing detergents for sale.

In the future, John intends to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and washing detergents to sell

loans.name: Mardina

texts.en: Mardina is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife takes care of the children at home. He was an employee in major car maintenance workshop until 2010, when he opened his own workshop. He is very skilled and specializes in car exteriors. Even though he is fairly new to the business, since he was a repairman for a long time, he is well known for his fast, convenient, and excellent work. He is a sharp and diligent man who says: "It is very difficult to run a business when you buy raw materials at retail price". He is requesting 1,600,000 MNT to buy mass amounts of spare parts.

loans.use: To buy mass amounts of spare parts.

loans.name: Sainte Marie Group

texts.fr: SAINTE MARIE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Edith (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un plombier du nom de Christophe. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Edith vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Edith n’a pas  fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs une quinzaine d’année, Edith mène comme activité la vente de nourritures (riz, haricot, et voandzou)  dans son quartier. Edith s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Edith et les autres membres du groupe SAINTE MARIE  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: SAINTE MARIE is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative is Edith (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 47 years old and married to a plumber by the name of Christophe. They have one child in school and in their care. Edith lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensures that the different household expenses are covered. Edith did not go to school. For about fifteen years, she has had a business selling food (rice, beans, and voandzou in her district. Her supplies come from one of the markets of Benin. This is the first time that Edith and the other members of the group SAINTE MARIE have requested financial support from ALIDé for bolstering their working capital and their business, as well as for responding further to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of grain (rice, corn, etc.) and sauce condiments

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 50 años es una mujer alegre. Ella tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Yurica y Liz a las que cuida en casa de su madre ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Su madre hace muchos años viajo a Estados Unidos, donde vive en la actualidad, por ello ella tuvo que encargarse de los bienes de la familia. Gracias a sus 7 parcelas, puede sembrar maíz, papa y habas en cantidad. Cuida con mucho esmero, pues es uno de los mejores de la zona. Cuenta que en donde gana más dinero, es en el maíz, ya que hace secar para venderlos por arrobas, eso es su técnica. También cría animales, ya tienen varias gallinas, 40 cuyes y 10 conejos, los cuales le brindan ganancias extra, ya que los engorda para luego vender a un mayor precio en la ciudad de Lima y Cerro de Pasco donde tiene buenos clientes, además aprovecha para visitar a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “palomitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Gloria, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de maíz; ya que en esta temporada es donde más sale.
texts.en:
Gloria, 50, is a cheerful woman. She has 5 children but only 2 of them live with her: Yurica and Liz are the two she cares for in her mother's house, which is located in the town of Ataura.  Many years ago her mother went to the United States, where she lives now, so she had to take care of the family assets. Thanks to her 7 plots of land, Gloria can plant corn, potatoes and beans in bulk. She handles the farm with great care, so it is one of the best in the area. She says that where she earns more money is in corn, so she dries it to sell by the bushel; that's her technique. 

Gloria also raises animals and has several chickens, 40 guinea pigs and 10 rabbits, which gives her extra income.  She fattens the animals and then sells them at a higher price in the city of Lima and Cerro de Pasco where she has good clients.  She also takes the opportunity to visit her children. 

Gloria belongs to the Communal Bank "Palomitas (Popcorn)" and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She thanks all of you for your support; it makes it possible for her to continue with her work.  Gloria also promises to be punctual with her dues, and she likes working with people who are responsible and caring. Gloria, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested money in purchasing natural fertilizer for her crops of corn, because this is the harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 50 years old and has seven sons and daughters; three of them have their own jobs.

Hussein started to collect scrap and junk tools from all around or buy them and re-sell them by weight to factories or some workshops who use them. It has been almost 4 to 5 years now since he started doing that, and it has been working so well that he is able to support the rest of his children who still go to school.

Now Hussein has applied for a loan to open a small storage room or build one to collect all his junk and scraps there instead of keeping them in the back of his truck with not much space to collect more.

loans.use: to open a small storage room or build one to collect all his junk and scraps.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Alice.  She is married and has three children aged 29, 23 and 9. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  

In 2007, Alice established her provision, drinks and toiletries business. She never went to school and her mother trained her to do business, so when she was grown up she started her own business. This business is a source of livelihood for Alice and her family. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month.

Alice requires a loan in order to buy sardines, mayonnaise, milk, sugar, drinks and toiletries for her business. Alice would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. In the future, Alice plans to build a house and support the University for All Her Children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sardines, mayonnaise, milk, sugar, drinks and toiletries for her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor  Francisco  nació en la localidad de la Angostura  actualmente se encuentra viviendo en la localidad de limoncito por mas de cinco años convive con la señora Dilma   tienen dos hijas una  de 4 años de edad y otra de 2 años. El se dedica a la mecánica los fines de semana en la localidad del Torno en el taller de su hermano, y entre semana trabaja como albañil en la ciudad de Santa Cruz. El crédito lo esta solicitando para comprar material de construcción para terminar su vivienda ya que  le falta construir un cuarto mas para las niñas y así brindarles  mayor comodidad a su familia, el esta muy agradecido con la institución por  la oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the town of Angostura. He has been living in the town of Limoncito for more than 5 years with his partner Dilma and they have 2 daughters. One is 4 years old and the other is 2 years old. 

He is a mechanic working on weekends in the town of Torno in his brother’s workshop and during the week he works as a bricklayer in the city of Santa Cruz. 

He is asking for a loan to buy construction material in order to finish his house as it needs one more room for the children in order to give the family more comfortable living conditions. 

He is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity it gives him of improving the quality of life for him and all of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish his house

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old, married to Naomi, and they are blessed with two children. He has been selling cereals for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to build his own store for his stocks of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a stock of dry maize, beans and wheat for his business.

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, necesita invertir en su negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para su negocio y comprar la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de tortillas como: maíz, leña, gas, bolsas plásticas, de esa forma podrá siempre mantener la clientela y las ganancias serán mejores cada dia.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque realizo la inversion en materiales para su negocio tanto de pupusas como de hacer tortillas, ademas resolvio problemas de salud de sus hijos. Actualmente su familia esta estable.
texts.en:
Alma needs to invest in her business, so she is requesting a new business loan to buy the ingredients needed to make tortillas, such as corn, firewood, gas and plastic bags.  In this way, she will always be able to retain her customers, and her earnings will grow each day.  

Her previous loans helped her, because she was able to invest in supplies for her business, which involves making pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran snack) as well as tortillas.  In addition, she was able to resolve some health problems that her children had.  Now her family's situation is stable.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas and plastic bags

loans.name: Sabougnouman I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN I sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à BARAKOLOBOUGOU, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, HALY, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare d’arachide.
La production sera vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "SABOUGNOUMAN I" are married women averaging 38 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in BARAKOLOBOUGOU, a village in Dioïla Prefecture, Region of Koulikoro. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of further organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. They are on their fifth collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, HALY, who is standing in the middle of her row in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 0.75 hectare of peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. 

HALY plans on making an average profit of about 85,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy(whose photo shows that she plants bananas) lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is fifty years of age, married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She has been an active farmer for over thirty years, dealing with horticultural crops and dairy livestock.

Nancy has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES 40,000, which is to be used to purchase dairy goats. She wants to have over five thousand dairy goats and be the leading milk producer. The income from this business will help her pay school fees for her children.

The challenges that Nancy faces are poor markets, unfavourable climatic conditions, and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven began his startup business, "Youth Works Enterprises Incorporated", two months ago. This 19-year-old young man from Little Rock is a jack of all trades. Steven’s business involves cleaning construction sites, working as a handyman, washing and detailing cars, and anything else his customers are willing to pay him to do.

A few months ago, a community partner informed Steven about Accion Texas Inc. and explained to him what the nonprofit organization can do for entrepreneurs. Steven inquired and proceeded to apply for a microloan from Accion. Once he was approved, Steven began utilizing his Accion loan to buy new and updated tools, pay for fuel to travel to each job location, cover car maintenance, and print fliers to advertise door to door.

Most of his customer base is comes from word of mouth and the little advertising he does daily around the neighborhood. He currently lives with his parents but hopes to earn enough to take the leap and move out someday on his own.

loans.use: to buy new and updated tools, pay for fuel to travel to each job location, cover car maintenance, and print fliers to advertise door to door.

loans.name: Maribel Cesilia

texts.es:
Maribel es una persona bastante habilidosa en el area de la cocina, desde siempre le ha gustado preparar ricas recetas para complacer a sus comensales.

Prepara diferentes platos tipicos de la region caribe y es muy reconocida por su buena sazón.

Vive con sus dos hijos a los cuales ha intentado siempre ofrecerles lo mejor.

Solicita un prestamo para la compra de surtido, insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion de sus recetas, esto le permitirá tener sus alimentos siempre disponibles y frescos para sus clientes.

Poco a poco podra cumplir su sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a charismatic and attentive woman who runs her own business, a grocery store that she started to earn income that would help her family. She had the strength and determination to overcome adversity, pick herself up, and move forward. Her efforts have paid off in the eight years since she opened the store. 

Maria's great motivation is to keep moving forward and strengthen her business, stocking it with goods such as grains, fried snacks, sodas, and general grocery items. This investment will allow her to offer her customers higher quality and better service, boosting her sales significantly, and thus her income. 

Maria says that her overriding ambition is to keep growing her business and one day transform it into a supermarket, where customers can find whatever they need. The store would then be more profitable and allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life.  

Funding this loan means you will be supporting the efforts of Colombian women!

loans.use: Compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion de sus alimentos.

loans.name: Radio Musondolya Group

texts.en:
Mpabaisi is 59 years old and married with 15 children. He is a member of Radio Musondolya Group living in Kasese, Uganda. Mpabaisi is a teacher by profession and has been in that service for 10 years and runs a retail shop to supplement his income. Mpabaisi has a dream of expanding his business into a big sugar-selling center. Mpabaisi wants money to buy sacks of sugar to sell. 
 
He is a member of Radio Musondolya Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar to sell

loans.name: Possible Bhageshwor Health Clinic

texts.en:
The Bhageshwor Health Clinic and Birthing Center provides medical care for 1,638 people every year. But with only 4 to 12 hours of low-voltage electricity each day, the facility lacks the power to bring modern medical services to the region. 

Bhageshwor patient Loksari (pictured) is expecting her fourth child in a few months. "This will be our last baby. We are doing family planning after this," Loksari said. She has been attending a pregnant mothers support group at her village and it has been very helpful for her. Loksari added, "I am resting a lot and have been eating a lot of fruits and green vegetables. I want to have a healthy baby." With electricity, her pregnancy and delivery will be safer for both her and her baby.
