Rose runs a second hand clothes store and a posho mill as her secondary business.  Rose has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KSH.  She is borrowing a loan of 40,000 KSH which she will use as follows: 20,000 KSH to purchase maize stock and the remaining 20,000 KSH to purchase second hand clothes.  She is planning to use the anticipated profit to educate her children.  Rose is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying her previous loan.  Her hope and dream is to grow her business and buy a vehicle for transporting her goods to the market place for sale.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Teou

texts.en:
Teou M., 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

M. sells food, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. M. has to spend USD 38 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 60 on other necessary expenses every month.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz S. lives in Istaravshan, a city in Northern Tajikistan. He is 31 years old and married with four children. 

Abdulaziz is the sole provider for his family and earns a living from his farming and animal husbandry business. Every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over a 5-6 month period, later selling the adult cows and sheep to local butchers.

Abdulaziz is currently thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more young cattle. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 5500 Somoni.

Extend your solidarity to Abdulaziz so that he can move forward successfully and accomplish his goals. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007 IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Rwamarengye Mixed Farmers Group

texts.en: B. Deodanta is an individual client in Rukungiri. She is 44 years old and married with 3 children, all are in school.  She also takes care of other dependents. Deodanta has been an agriculturalist in Rwamarengye for 5 years, growing and selling matooke (bananas of the plantains type).  Being trustworthy has made her successful.  She is able to make 100,000 UGX in weekly profits.  She started this business after realizing that it was profitable. Previously she was involved in selling coffee.  Although she was able to get some profit from that business, it was too tiring for her as a woman.  This is one of the reasons why she changed businesses. She needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke for resale.

loans.use: To buy matooke (bananas) for resale.

loans.name: Pierrine

texts.en:
Pierrine is thirty years old, married and has one child. Her husband works as a businessperson. Pierrine sells clothes, especially bed covers and bed sheets, which she has been doing for five years.

Pierrine is requesting a loan to buy more bed covers and bed sheets to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Pierrine plans to reinvest and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more bed covers and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. After noticing the absence of such business in his town, he decided to open an entertainment shop in 2005. He is the only income provider for the family.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop using new bricks and doing some painting so he can increase the number of customers visiting him and allow them to enjoy a comfortable pleasant place.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres  hijos de 7, 3 y 1 años, el mayor esta en escuela. El marido trabaja en Petroecuador.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). También vende ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que a veces no tiene con quien dejar sus hijos que están muy pequeños por lo que su situación se vuelve a veces muy complicada pero allí ella sigue luchando dia a dia para salir adelante y progresando en su negocio. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente dice que le encanta vender. Su mercadería la recibe en su casa.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como pantalones blusas, camisetas, además de  perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque le han dado mucha ayuda a ella y a sus compañeras, además es la presidenta del Banco. Sus sueños son tener un negocio grande en su casa
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in the Santa Clara neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by local and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports on the Pacific.

This is where we met Carmen, 31.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 7, 3 and 1 year old; most of them are in school.  Her husband is employed at Petroecuador.

She sells Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She also sells catalogue clothing.  She works for periods every day because sometimes she doesn’t have anyone to leave the children with and they are still little so her situation sometimes becomes quite complicated but she hangs in there struggling to get ahead every day and progressing in her business.  She sells door to door and through prior orders.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She says she loves to sell.  She receives her merchandise at home.

She will use this loan to buy clothes like: pants, blouses, t-shirts as well as perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and other products.

She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because they have given her and her fellow members much help.  In addition, she’s the bank President.  Her dream is to have a large home-based business.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Ayisietu

texts.en:
Ayisietu A. is a single mother of one child; she is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. Having completed her junior high school education, she sells kenkey (a staple in the Ghanaian diet made from fermented maize dough) and palm-nut soup for a living. In the photograph, she is scooping palm-nut soup. 

Her goal is to grow her business to earn more money to look after herself and her child. The loan will be used to purchase more bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to boost her sales. She intends to reinvest the profits to grow her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to prepare more kenkey (fermented maize dough) to boost her sales

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. G. is 28 years old and the mother of two. Being the breadwinner in her family, she works hard in her tailoring business. She is able to provide basic needs for her family including educating her children.  

She has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya and this has helped her to improve her business. She hopes to open a boutique in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin R. M. is 27 years old and married. His wife runs a green grocery store and they have two children, ages 3 and 1,  to whom they hope to give good education to the university level. 

Kevin's business is located at a market at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. 

He owns a butcher shop known by the name Forks Choma/Butchery in which he sells meat to the local people. He has been in this business for three years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy a freezer to keep the meat fresh to increase profits as well as meet his customers' needs. He hopes to open many more butcheries in future. He describes himself as a risk taker.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan A. lives with his mother, wife, and two children in Katnaghbyur village, in the Lori region. The family earns income by farming. Vachagan has his own machinery, which is very useful in running the business.
 
Vachagan has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds and to renovate the cattle house.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and to renovate the barn

loans.name: Martha Lily

texts.es: Martha Lily se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre se preocupo por proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Se encuentra ubicado en  su vivienda y de manera ambulante. Ella trata de esmerarse cada día más para aumentar su clientela y la calidad de sus productos, por ello solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de cremas, tratamientos, perfumes, lociones, lápiz labial, delineadores, polvos y tintes. Desea agrandar su negocio cada día mas y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en: Martha Lily has been selling cosmetics for a living for more than 4 years because she has always been  worried about providing for her family.  She sells from home and as a street vendor.  She strives everyday to increase her clientele and the quality of her products.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase creams, treatments, perfumes, lotions, lip pencils, liners, powders and dyes.  She wants to expand her business more every day and at the same time improve her services.

loans.use: to purchase creams, treatments, perfumes, lotions, lip pencils, liners, powders and dyes.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 47 years old and married with four children between the ages 10 and 20 years old. Her business is well-organized. She employees five person to help her. Immaculee starts from 6 am until 11 pm every day and three years of experience. Immaculee operates a restaurant..

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy new materials for her restaurant. With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy a new material for her restaurant

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 26 years old and lives in village Tserovani, East Georgia. Lasha is married and lives with his wife Natia, two daughters 8 and 5 years old, his parents and brother in his home village. 

Lasha is a car repairman and works in the village. Also he is involved in the family dairy farm. They have four milk cows, whose dairy products are sold in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Total average monthly income from both activities accounts to 1000 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit Lasha plans to expand their cattle-shed. That will allow him to keep more cows and sell more dairy products. In the future Lasha will put aside some savings which will be used for the purchase of additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom go to school.  Monica sells salt and sugar.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more salt and sugar to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una clienta de 33 años de edad que vive con su esposo e hijo en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Chepen – La Libertad.  En este hogar prima una buena relación familiar. Existe una ayuda mutua entre Manuela y su esposo que contribuye al pleno desarrollo de sus actividades.

Manuela se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años. Ella cuenta con un puesto de prendas de vestir en una de las avenidas más concurridas de su localidad. Manuela tiene clientes establecidos que están muy contentos con la calidad de su servicio y productos. El esposo de Manuela es mototaxista y ambos contribuyen con el desarrollo económico de su hogar.

Manuela solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para completar los ahorros que ella y su esposo tienen para comprar una mototaxi (moto con cabina en parte trasera para el transporte de pasajeros) que  su esposo utilizará para brindar este servicio de transporte público, pues actualmente este trabaja con una moto alquilada. 

Manuela es una clienta muy responsable pues el crédito que nuestra entidad le concedió anteriormente, lo canceló sin un día de atraso. Esta inversión permitirá el desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 33 year-old client who lives with her husband and son in a rental house in Chepen district, La Libertad.  There is a good family relationship in this household.  Manuela and her husband help each other and this enables them to make full progress in their business activities.

Manuela has been selling clothes for ten years.  She has a clothing stall in one of the busiest avenues in her town.  She has regular customers who are very happy with the quality of her service and products.  Manuela's husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and they both contribute to the financial progress of their household.

Manuela is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to put together with some savings that she and her husband have made, so that they can buy a motorcycle taxi (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers) that her husband will use to provide a public transport service as, right now, he rents his vehicle.

Manuela is a very responsible client as she repaid her previous loan from us without a single day's delay.  This investment will allow her family to make progress financially.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunzaya is 32 years old and she lives with her husband and 2 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in their own flat in the center of Darkhan. 

Mrs. Ariunzaya is a teacher of Mathematics in the local secondary school. Her son attends a secondary school and her daughter goes to the local kindergarten. Her husband runs a taxi business, using his family car, carrying passengers between Darkhan and the capital city, which is 220 kilometers away.  On average, he makes one trip per day to the capital city, occasionally two. Mrs. Ariunzaya’s father is a former taxi driver and he is unemployed at the moment. Mrs. Ariunzaya wants to buy an another car to use for the taxi business as well. Her father will act as a taxi driver to earn some extra income for the family. Mrs. Ariunzaya is going to use her family’s savings, but needs some money on top of it to buy a car with lower mileage. 

The loan that Mrs. Ariunzaya is taking will be used to buy the second hand car and to use it for taxi business employing her father and to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a second hand car to use as a taxi business, employing her father and to increase her family’s income.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: This borrower wants to purchase goats from the market. She will sell the meat in the market. She is requesting a loan to increase her business fund. She is 45 years old. She is married but her husband has died. She has two children. One is going to school.

loans.use: to purchase goats to start a business.

loans.name: María Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Prod Natura, vive por la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, este  lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajo.
 
Doña María tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los cuales 3 son casados e independientes, 3 estudian uno en colegio y dos en la escuela y 2 de hijos ayudan en el trabajo de la casa. Su esposo trabaja como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo y trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca TIENS (vitaminas, adelgazantes, suplementos nutricionales, productos de belleza, etc.), este  trabajo lo  realiza hace 4 años, vende sus productos de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir de productos naturales para ampliar su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Prod Natura community bank. She lives in the parrish of Victoria del Portete. This place has cold weather. Its people are dedicated to livestock and farming. Many work in the city of Cuenca in different areas of work.

María is 48 years old. She is married and her married union has resulted in eight children of whom three are married adults, three are college students and two are in school and help her with the housework. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The house that they live in is her property, the result of effort and work.

María is dedicated to selling TIENS brandname, natural products (vitamins, slimming products, nutritional supplements, beauty products, etc.) She has done this work for four years. She sells her products from Sunday to Sunday without fixed hours.

This is her second loan with the community bank and her new loan will be invested in natural products to expand her business. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase natural products like vitamins, slimming  products, nutritional supplements, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase handbags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: Mirna tiene 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es viuda y madre de dos hijos de 32 y  20 años con quienes vive en casa propia. El trabajo de Mirna es la venta de comida, actividad que lo realiza en su casa, de lunes a sábado, pero los domingo y feriados vende cebiche, plato tipico peruano, y que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes. Lleva ya cuatro años en este negocio, y durante este tiempo ha crecido mucho como negociante y por consecuente en su economía. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a su hija con el cuidado de su nieto, además de poder hacer otras actividades en su hogar, espera por ahora solo mantener su negocio y espera se consolide con el tiempo. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, y esta contenta de pertenecer a éste grupo comunal, pues todos son muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para arreglar su local además de algunas piezas para arreglar su mototaxi, que lo utiliza para transportar su insumos del mercado a su casa.
texts.en:
55-year-old Mirna is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is a widow and mother of two children aged 32 and 20, whom she lives with in a house of their own. Mirna's occupation is selling food, which she does from her house from Monday to Saturday. On Sundays and holidays she sells ceviche, a typical Peruvian dish which is in great demand by her customers. 

Mirna has been running her food sales business for four years. During this time she has grown a lot as a businesswoman, and her economy has improved as a result. What Mirna likes about her work is that she still has time to help her daughter look after her grandson, along with other activities at home. At the moment her aim is just to keep her business going, and she hopes to strengthen it over time. This is Mirna's sixth loan with MFP, and she is happy to be part of this community group as they are all very responsible. With the money she has requested, Mirna will buy materials to improve her premises as well as some parts to fix her mototaxi which she uses to transport supplies to her home market.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her premises, and fix her mototaxi

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been a farmer in his hometown of Kitale for over 10 years, producing and selling milk, eggs, maize and vegetables and selling to the local market. He has also been in a motorcycle transport business. He is married with four children, two adults and two minors who are still in school.

James has made a loan request of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds at 30,000 KES as well as build a bigger and better poultry unit (building) at 60,000 KES. He says this third loan from Juhudi will make his farming business better and improve his family's living standards.

He adds that diseases and poultry feed scarcity are real challenges, though they are surmountable.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Kirungi

texts.en:
Kirungi is a married man with four children. He is a very hard-working man of 42 years of age who plans to educate his children to college level.

From his 4-year-old business of cattle trading alone, Kirungi generates a profit of about 500,000 UGX per week and from farming also he makes 100,000 UGX profits in the same period of time. With his double income, Kirungi is able to sustain children in school and provide for the family.

However, despite his double income, he says his herd is not big enough in relation to his increasing market. It is based on that fact that he has requested a Kiva loan to buy more cows for re-sale to double the sales and  profits.

loans.use: To buy more cows to re-sell.

loans.name: Muliki

texts.en: Muliki is a 44-year-old married woman with 7 children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Muliki has been selling cassava flour for 20 years in which she acquired capital from farming. Her hardship is price fluctuations and her vision is having her own food store for cassava flour plus an educated family. Muliki needs the loan facility to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Shiela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Shiela has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with seven children, five of who are enrolled in school while the rest have finished school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. He owns a house with has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Ali has operated a fish and seafood selling business for the past ten years. His potential clients are mostly hotel owners. He faces a major challenge of lack of sufficient capital to run the business efficiently. He aspires to increase sales in his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more fish and seafood for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula, D. 43 años D. edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y empeñosa. Vive en compañía D. su pareja, dos cuñados, dos suegros,, y su menor hijo D. 9 años en la casa D. sus suegros. La actividad que realiza Tula es la venta D. zapatos femeninos,  pmercadería que lo consegui en la ciudad D. Lima y lo compra en el emporio comercial D. Gamarra, escogiendo los modelos más elegantes, y lo ultimo en moda, para luego venderlos en sus amistades, familiares y vecinas. Tiene 3 años dedicándose a esta actividad, durante este tiempo supo captar clientela. Lo que le gusta D. su actividad es el D. socializar, tener más amigas con las que pueD. intercambiar opinión D. gustos para el vestir D. calzados, además del tiempo libre, lo emplea para cuidar a su hijo. Por otro lado, le molesta cuando sus clientes no terminar D. cancelar sus pagos y eso le afecta en su capital D. trabajo. Mas adelante desea incursionar en la venta D. cartera y ropa femeninas. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibirá, por ello se compromete en ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas para tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra D. zapatos y carteras, para tener mas variedad en los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Tula is 43 years old and a hardworking, cheerful, and determined woman. She lives with her partner, two brothers-in-law, her in-laws, and her nine-year-old son. They all resiD. at her in-laws’ house. Tula sells women’s shoes. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima from the Gamarra commercial emporium. Tula selects the most elegant and the latest styles of shoes so that she can sell them to friends, relatives, and neighbors. She has been in business for three years and has been able to attract customers. What she likes about her job is being able to socialize. She has many friends with whom she can share opinions about their tastes in shoes. During her free time, she looks after her son. On the other hand, Tula is bothered by customers who do not complete their payments because of the negative impact on her operating capital. Going forward, Tula wants to start selling women’s handbags and clothing.

This will be her first loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful for the support that she has received. For this reason, Tula promises to be punctual with her payments so that she can access more loans. The amount she requested will be invested in the purchase of shoes and handbags so that she will have a wider variety of products to offer.

loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Juana Estela

texts.es:
Con el préstamo la señora Juana Estela podrá surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de mercancía que le están solicitando que tenga a la venta en su negocio. 
Doña Juana Estela  tiene aproximadamente dos años con su negocio en el cual su esposo le apoya a tender a los clientes, cuando no tiene trabajo de albañilería, con estos ingresos solventan los gastos de manutención de sus cinco hijos, cuyas edades son de entre 8 años y 2 años de edad.
texts.en:
With this loan, Juana Estela will be able to stock her business and offer her customers the diversity they are demanding.
Juana Estela has had this business for approximately two years. When not working in construction, her husband helps her to serve her customers. This income helps them cover the maintenance expenses of their five children, aged 8 to 2.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Inn, 55, is married and the father of five children who are dependents. Three of them work in Thailand, one works in a private company and the last one is still in school. He has been selling rice for five years. In addition, he works as a laborer and plants spice for additional income. With his current business, he earns 7 U.S. dollars per day. 

This is Inn's second loan with VisionFund and he completely repaid his first loan. Now he is requesting another loan to renovate his house and  buy food for resale. With this loan, he hopes to have a decent house for living in and increase his business to earn more income.

loans.use: to renovate his house and buy food for resale.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah 60, is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, Penninah has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the market. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Olvin Damin

texts.es:
Olvin de 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en San Luis Planes Santa Bárbara con su familia.
Olvin desde pequeño realiza actividades de cultivo de café con su familia y trabajos de serigrafía, es una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente tiene cultivado 1 manzana de café, de la cual saca producción de café pergamino húmedo y lo vende en el mercado local, pero muchas veces llegan los compradores hasta su casa. Esta motivado con el cultivo ya que este producto tiene gran demanda y va obtener buenas ganancias. A solicitado este préstamo de L.13,000.00 para invertir en siembra de vivero ampliando así 1/4 mas de manzana de terreno, donde va cubrir pago de jornaleros y fertilizantes para dicha siembra. Su plan es mejorar la producción y seguir obteniendo ganancias.
texts.en:
Olvin is 30 years old and single.  He lives in San Luis Planes Santa Bárbara with his family.  Ever since he was little he has worked with his family growing coffee.  He also does screen printing jobs.  He is a very hard-working person.

He currently has one “manzana” (just under a half of an acre) where he is growing coffee.  He takes his production of wet parchment coffee to sell at the local market.  However, the buyers often come to his house.  He is motivated with farming because this product is in great demand, and he will get good income.

He has requested this loan for 13,000 lempira to invest in planting the nursery.  This way he will expand to ¼ of a manzana more land.  He will use the loan to pay the day workers and to buy fertilizers for the crop.  His plan is to improve production and to continue getting income.

loans.use: to invest in planting the coffee nursery, to pay the day workers, and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Kiwambi Umoja Mbangamao Group

texts.en:
Denis, standing left, is a 42 year-old married man with four children, all attending secondary education. He is has been working hard producing maize, beans and rice for over four years. He has farming problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Denis is looking for financial support to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. In the five years to come he has a vision to boost the scale of production from 15 to 45 acres in expectation of earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. 

Her business is a beauty salon. She has been in the business for 3 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy weaves, hair chemical and pay for maintenance of the salon machines. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and nurture upcoming business people.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair chemical and pay for maintenance of the salon machines.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene has a business where she sells household furniture made out of metal. These items are becoming very popular in these poor sectors of Guayaquil because they offer convenient furniture at affordable prices. Marlene is also very popular because she offers her clients the option of financing the products. She currently has 50 clients that she collects payments from. Marlene has 3 children and is married. She is not from Guayaquil, but moved there in search of work and better opportunities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in furniture products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy 6 small steers

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena and her husband are hard working market vendors from Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She runs two kiosks where she sells men’s shirts, underwear, and socks. Yelena’s husband has a small grocery kiosk. Both of them recognized the value of being self-employed, so five years ago Yelena decided to start her own clothing business. She chose to sell practical but inexpensive items that are always in demand. To save costs, she has developed a relationship with a local shirt and sock manufacturing plant where she buys product in bulk for good prices.

Yelena has requested a loan for $500 to increase her available working capital. We have been happy to provide Yelena with financial assistance in the past and expect her business grow and thrive in the future.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. Sek S. O. is 24 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with his wife and their only child.  He works as a cameraman and earns $3 per day, while his wife earns $2 per day working as a fruit-seller.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle.  Public transportation is very expensive, so Mr. Sek S. O. knows this will save him money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: 48-year-old Elshan lives in the Salyan region, Girkhchirak settlement . He is married and has two children. Elshan has been breeding calves for the past 7 years.. He supports his family with this business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy  baling presses and cotton-seed.

loans.use: To buy cotton-seed and baling presses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. owns a restaurant, where she sells drinks and water. She is 63 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She needs $400 to buy more drinks to sell. She has been in business since 1972 and she has been recieving loans from LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and table water for sale

loans.name: Isabel's Group

texts.es:
Isabel is 45 years old and Ricardina is 68 and they both have belonged to the Communal Bank “Radiant Sun” for 5 and 4 years respectively. In their Communal Bank, the two mentioned that they learned how to work, to have their own business, to be disciplined, punctual and above all to save. Initially, Ricardina was selling fruits and sewing bedspreads, but as a result of her sickness she stopped these activities and began selling breakfast at the Santa Clara market. However, Ricardina says that she would like to sell fruits again in a fixed place. This time, Ricardina is taking advantage of the Christmas season, she will sell clothes that she will buy in Huancayo. On the other siD. Isabel has been a craftswoman in textiles since she was young and she does her work on looms, such as tapestries, individual and covers, that are sold in the markets of Ayacucho. Moreover she sells clothes, bread, and other products at the markets of Tambo and Huaytara, and in the markets she buys hens and rams and sells them in Ayacucho. Ricardina and Isabel need loans of 1000 soles each, that they will invest in the purchase of materials for tapestry such as wools, processed threads, dyes and also sweaters, pants, blouses, polos, oats, milk, cinnamon and sugar. Their savings will be used for the studies of their children and for Ricardina’s medical treatment. Ricardina dreams of having her own house, while Isabel dreams that her children will be professionals and can have all goods necessary

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel tiene 45 años y Ricardina tiene 68 años y pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Sol Radiante” desD. hace 5 y 4 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal, las dos mencionan que aprendieron a trabajar, a tener un negocio propio, a ser disciplinadas, puntuales y sobre todo a ahorrar. Ricardina inicialmente vendía frutas y tejía colchas, pero a raíz D. su enfermedad dejó D. realizar estas actividades e inició L. venta D. desayuno por el mercado Santa Clara. Sin embargo, Ricardina dice que le gustaría nuevamente vender frutas en un puesto fijo. Esta vez, Ricardina aprovechando L. campaña naviD.ña, venderá ropa que comprará en Huancayo. Por otro lado Isabel desD. muy pequeña es artesana en textiles y realiza trabajos en telares como tapices, individuales y caminos, que son vendidos en los mercados D. Ayacucho. Además elL. venD. ropa, hoja D. coca, pan, entre otros productos en las ferias D. Tambo y Huaytara, y en las ferias compra gallinas, carneros y los venD. en Ayacucho. Ricardina e Isabel necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en L. compra D. materiales para los tapices como lanas, hilos procesados, tintes y también chompas, pantalones, blusas, polos, avena, leche, caneL. y azúcar. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para los estudios D. sus hijos y para su tratamiento médico. Ricardina sueña con tener una casa propia, mientras que Isabel sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales y pueda tener todos los bienes necesarios.

loans.use: Ricardina and Isabel need loans of 1000 soles each, that will be invested in the purchase of materials for tapestry such as wools, processed threads, dyes and also sweaters, pants, blouses, polos, oats, milk, cinnamon and sugar.

loans.name: Soudure Elanyo Group

texts.fr:
The "Soudure Elanyo" Group was founded by two young courageous men named Kokou A., age 39, and Kodzo D., age 34. They are both married. The former has five children, while the latter has three. Their shop was created nearly three years ago. They would like to use this loan to buy corrugated metal sheets to make gates and doors to sell.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

La soudure Elanyo est fondée par deux jeunes hommes vaillants qui se nomment Kokou A. et Kodzo D. qui ont respectivement 39 ans et 34 ans, tous mariés. Le premier a 05 enfants tandis que le second en a 03. Cet atelier est créé bientôt 03 ans. Il désirent par ce crédit acheter des tôles pour confectionner des portails en vue de les revendre.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets for making metal doors and gates for homes

loans.name: Mursal

texts.id:
Mursal, the father of a girl, works as an electrician (home installation technician). Through his work he has been able to support his wife and child. Nonetheless, he wants to increase his earnings. Currently in each installation job he is only compensated for the cost of service, because all the required parts have been purchased by the houseowner. If all the electric equipment was the responsibility of Mursal, his earnings would be twice what he used to get paid just for servicing - Rp. 50,000 (USD equivalent $5.40).

As a result, he has submitted for a loan of Rp. 3,500,000 (approx USD equivalent $400).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Bapak satu orang putri ini bekerja sebagai instalatir listrik. Dari hasil pekerjaannya selama ini dia sudah mampu menghidupi isteri dan anaknya. Namun, dia ingin mendapatkan penghasilan yang lebih besar. Dalam satu kali pemasangan, dia hanya dibayar ongkos jasa saja, karena semua bahan dibeli oleh pemilik rumah / villa. Seandainya semua bahan alat – alat listrik ditanggung oleh Mursal, keuntungannya 2 kali lipat dari jasa semula yang hanya dibayar Rp 50.000,00/titik lampu. Oleh sebab itulah dia mengajukan pinjaman senilai Rp 3.500.000,00.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cables, bulbs, bulb caps,and other assorted items

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 32 years old and a native of the village of Capachica. When her children started to shcool, she and her husband decided to relocate to the city of Juliaca, so that their little ones could receive a better education and a better quality of life.

A few years after relocating to the city, her husband passed away, leaving her alone to take care of her two young children. Since then, she has been both mother and father to her offspring, working very hard and tirelessly in various activities to earn a living so that her little ones would not suffer deprivations. After many years of effort , she finally, with the help of her brothers, was able to start up a funeral service for the local population in Juliaca. For this purpose, they rented a space near the hospital, so as to be able to offer an appropriate service to people who were going through very difficult circumstances due to the loss of a loved one.

Doris´s wish is to fix up her premises, and for this she turns to you to ask for a loan to carry out her plan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Doris de 32 años de edad, es natural del pueblito de Capachica, desde que sus niños se encontraban en etapa escolar decidieron junto a su esposo radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, con el fin de que sus pequeños reciban una mejor educación y calidad de vida.

A los pocos años de radicar en dicha ciudad su abnegado esposo falleció, dejándola sola a cargo de sus 2 menores hijos, desde entonces se convirtió en padre y madre de sus retoños, trabajando ardua e incansablemente en diversas actividades para ganarse el pan de cada día y así sus pequeños no puedan pasar limitaciones económicas.Tras muchos años de esfuerzo y empeño finalmente con apoyo de sus hermanos decidió instaurar un espacio para brindar servicios funerarios a la población Juliaqueña, para esto alquilaron un local cerca del Hospital, con la finalidad de brindarle un apropiado servicio a la población que atraviesa circunstancias muy difíciles por la pérdida de un ser querido.

El deseo de Doris es implementar su local, con ese fin recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Invest in improvements to her selling space.

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en:
Khuth S. is 43 years old and has lived in Kampong Cham province with her two children for many years. She earns about $5 a day running a vegetable store in a busy market in her town. Her husband, Chom Sarong, is 39 years old and makes a living growing lotus rhizome, which is used in Cambodia both as a food and a medicine. He makes about $7 a day selling this crop to people who come to his house to buy it.

Khuth S. has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy wood to repair her leaking house. Her goal is to have a stable home which is dry during the long rainy season. (Her husband is pictured because she was not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair her leaking house.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie A., 43 years old, is married with three children. She has three years of experience with her food vending business. Her business is open six days a week and she earns approximately 250 Tala (~104 USD) per week.

Marie has received three loans from SPBD. SPBD loans are Marie’s only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for loans from traditional banks. The loan will help Marie hire labor and purchase materials for her food vending business. She hopes to improve her business, so that she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase cooler, mutton flaps, oil, flour and cordials

loans.name: Allpaurccuna Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Allpaurccuna, which means "From where does the Earth come" in Quechua, is dedicated to agriculture and the raising of animals, and many of the women in the village bank are dedicated to the purchase and sale of cochineal (a red dye that comes from a certain insect), tuna, and other products that they sell in the city of Ayacucho.

The members have different businesses such as selling tuna, cochineals, young animals, fertilizer, and other goods relating to agriculture.

The members of the bank need varying loan amounts totaling 5,700 soles. The loans will be invested in the purchase of tuna, cochineal, tara, young animals and fertilizer.

The dreams of the women are that their children will be professionals, their businesses will get better, and that they will continue to have good production on their ranches and farms.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in the purchase of tuna, cochineal, tara, young animals and fertilizer for agriculture.

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Román, 41 years of age, is the owner of a vehicle with which he provides public transportation service in his hometown of Juliaca. His daily performance and perseverance have allowed him to improve his financial situation and the quality of life for his beloved family. During this time, Román has been associated with a transport company called “Las Maravillas”, providing service on one of the city’s designated routes. In all his years of work, his vehicle, an indispensable tool of the trade, never gave him any mechanical trouble, but now Román wants to provide thorough maintenance in order to ensure peace of mind for his passengers and his family. He looks forward to your support of this intention.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Román, de 41 años de edad es propietario de una movilidad con la que presta servicio de transporte urbano en su ciudad natal, Juliaca, su desempeño y constancia diaria le están permitiendo mejorar su situación económica, permitiéndole así, mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Durante este tiempo, Román, estuvo asociado a una empresa de transporte denominada “Las Maravillas” de la línea 5 de su ciudad, durante estos largos años de trabajo su indispensable herramienta de movilidad no le causó ningún problema mecánico, pero Román desea brindarle un mantenimiento completo para asegurar la tranquilidad de sus pasajeros y de su familia, Román espera contar con vuestro apoyo para este propósito.

loans.use: Perform thorough maintenance of his vehicle which he uses to provide public transportation

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Thoen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of niN. people is located in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province.  Mrs. Koem T. is the Village Bank President. She was born in 1965. Mrs. Koem T. has three children, two of whom are door-making workers; the youngest oN. is attending school.

Mrs. Koem T. owns a small piece of land on which she grows mango trees. She now faces a problem because the plantation has been damaged by insects. Therefore, Mrs. Koem T. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to kill all the insects in order to make her crop more productive. Aside from this business, Mrs. Koem T. is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Khiev Samoeurn, always assists his wife in both businesses.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to kill  insects in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Bahrinisso

texts.ru: Раджабова Бахриниссо живет в районе Кободиен. Занимается торговлей. Торгует паласами и коврами. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Она разведена и имеет троих детей. Так что ее бизнес единственный источник ее семьи. Развитие бизнеса поможет ей улучшить условия в деле и соответственно получать дополнительный доход для семьи.
texts.en:
Bahrinisso R. lives in the Kobodien region of Tajikistan. She is divorced and has three children. Bahrinisso sells rugs and kilims for a living and is applying for this credit to expand her inventory. As her business is the sole source of income for her family, investing into her business will help her expand it and consequently allow for additional income for her family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luís C. C. se ve a la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para útiles escolares. El señor C.  en este momento  no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para completar comprar material  de la escuela para sus hijos. Donde José Luís trabaja es una fábrica y su esposa también para ayudarle con los gastos familiares con estos ingresos que ellos perciben pagarían el préstamo otorgado.El necesita $125 dólares.
texts.en:
José Luís C. C. is asking for a loan for school supplies. At this time, Mr. C. doesn’t have enough money to finish buying materials for school for his children. José Luís and his wife work in a factory to pay for the family expenses with this income that they will collect to repay the loan. He needs $125.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo N. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Zebo has a grocery store, which she runs herself, in addition to caring for her family and home. She began her small business 7 years ago with financial support from her husband, who has sold spare parts for automobiles for some time. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income, and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). Zebo is planning to use the loan to purchase a wider range of goods to sell. She promises to repay her loan within 5 months and thanks everyone who decided to support her.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Samina Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is 30-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Samina baji’s husband's name is N., and he is a mason. Samina baji runs a grocery shop in her house. She is running this shop to meet household expenses, because in Pakistan inflation is increasing rapidly and it’s difficult for one person to meet the house's expenses. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Joshphen baji wants a loan to buy tools for her mobile phone repair shop. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Hamidan Murad Ali Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a 58-year-old widow and resides in an area called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. She is the mother of two sons who are involved in a fruit-selling business.

Hamidan baji worked really hard after the sudden death of her husband. She worked as a maid for 5 years in a school and began a business selling fruit, then handed it over to her sons. Now, by the grace of God, her sons' businesses are going well. So she is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruit so that her sons will be able to sell more fruit and earn more profit.

Hamidan baji is the group leader for several more women. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her "cold corner".

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Mrs. Luzminda J. is 53 years old, married and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She sells the fish he catches at the public market or to their neighbors.  Life is hard for the family to survive with 7 children to feed.  But it's indeed a challenge for the couple to make effort in making a living especially in sending them to school.

Because they wanted to buy additional materials for fishing like fishing nets, they requested a loan from  Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 20,000. They set aside an amount for the fishing accessories and at the same time to put up additional capital for their little sari-sari store.  A back-to-back business actually to make a daily income.  Luzminda has 2 productive years of membership to Paglaum. Aside from the financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed other benefits like insurance and savings.  She hopes that with Paglaum's help and patience and her own hard work, she will be a successful vendor someday.

loans.use: purchase of fishing materials and additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 50 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a commercial driver while Christiana sells local gin to people in her community. The demands for her local gin are high and she tries to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more local gin to sell.

Christiana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has been a business woman in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Tushikamane group loan (Group code 2006). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Gloria is 32 years old, married, and has three children: ages between 7 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 38 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has run a coffee shop since 2005.

Imad requests a loan of $700 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop like “Narguileh” and coal. Nargileh (also known as “Shisha” in Egypt) is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A water pipe is used to smoke fruit flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S, Europe and other countries.

This is the first time Imad has requested a loan. He is special in his work because his coffee shop is a nice and relaxing place. He knows how to treat his clients. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and didn’t have a lot of clients. Now that he is known, his coffee shop has been doing better.

Imad decided on doing this business because he always wanted to open a coffee shop and he also wanted to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans on purchasing the shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Thi Nguyen

texts.en:
Hồng Nguyen is 31 years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Hồng owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately VND5000000 a month from these activities.

In 2002, Hồng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services in order to improve her living situation, as they enable her to engage in business activities. Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, which was used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future. Hồng is now requesting a new loan of VND15000000 which she plans to use to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Разокова Мавчуда молодая девушка , которая замужем , но детей пока не имеет. Её бизнес заключается в пошиве национальных платьев. Она проживает и работает в городе Худжанде. На рынке «Паншанбе» она арендует небольшой цех. До сегодняшнего дня она была ученицей одного мастера модельера, и теперь  она хочет отдельно купить себе машинку и шить самостоятельно платья.Она уверена что начав свои услуги у нее будет поток своих постоянных клиентов и она станет хорошим мастером по пошиву платьев. Она благодарна что микроинвест поддерживает начинающих своё дело людей.
texts.en:
Mavchuda R. is a young woman, who is married but does not yet have children. Her business is making traditional dresses. She lives and works in the city of Khujand. She leases a small factory at the Panshanbe market. Until today, she has been an apprentice of a master dress-maker and now wants to purchase her own sewing machine and make dresses herself. She is confident that, once she starts her own business, she will retain her loyal clients and become a good master dress-maker. Mavchuda is grateful that MicroInvest supports people starting their new businesses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dress making

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Файзулаев проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 27 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Хасан занимается производством и реализацией кирпичей. У него имеются постоянные покупатели, котроые торгуют на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается более 5 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить объем производства т.е. закупить нужное сырье.
texts.en:
Hasan F. lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. He is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. For the last 5 years Hasan has been making and selling bricks. He has steady customers who purchase his wares to sell on the market. Hasan wants to take out this loan to purchase a large batch of raw materials in order to increase the amount of bricks he can make and sell.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production increase

loans.name: Najeb

texts.en:
Najeb is the son of M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 children. He is a tailor and works hard to earn money for the completion of his family’s requirements. He needs to buy a new sewing machine for his shop because he has had many problems during sewing with his old machine. In addition, he wants to enlarge his business and to hire a student to support him in this business.
He wants to take an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani and he is very glad that has the chance to progress.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for expanding tailoring business.

loans.name: Batduger

texts.en:
Batduger U. is 41 years old, married, and the father of three, aged 4 - 11. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land he owns (residents own their land for free in Mongolia) in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Two of his children are attending a local elementary school and the youngest son is attending a local kindergarten.

Batduger is a professional welder. In 2006, he started running a small business making iron doors, fences and stoves. His spouse, Shinehuu, helps his business. Batduger requests a loan to purchase raw material and to build a work place on his land next to his ger. His says: "I really want to have a small house for my family’s needs. I'll keep working hard to have it." Thanks to his friendly and hardworking personality, he should succeed.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and to build a work place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing manioc and making manioc flour

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: aliou B. est un societaire qui habite non loin de la caisse de bayelaye a guediawaye ou il gere une boutique.il sollicite un credit de trois cent(300 000)frs pour renforcer son stock.ceci lui permettra de maximiser son ses benefices afin de mieux faire face a ses charges familliales.
texts.en:
Aliou B. is a member who lives near the Bayelaye bank in Guediawaye, where he manages a shop. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to bolster his inventory. This will enable him to maximize his profits in order to cope better with his family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Eunice Ajune

texts.en:
Eunice O. is a 35-year-old lady who is married to Sylvester. They have three children, ages 6, 7 and 9. She has been selling charcoal for the last eight years in Kondele, a populous slum in the outskirts of Kisumu city. 

Eunice learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend who is an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to increase her stock of charcoal in order to satisfy the demand of her clients. 

She aspires to develop a plot of land, which she has purchased, and start a more environmentally friendly business.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Increase the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer was born in 1975. He lives in the city of Baku. He has run this business for 3 years now. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Pastoli's Group

texts.en:
K. Pastoli is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 45 years old and married with 5 children, with the eldest at the university.

He is grateful for what the loans are doing for him, his business and family. He hopes to continue using them. He has had a shoe selling business in Kyaliwajjala, Namugongo for 25 years. His secret to business success is having enough stock for his customers at the right time.

Pastoli has a dream of educating his children and taking care of them in all aspects of life for a better future. He needs a loan to be able to buy more shoes for sale for increased stock.

loans.use: Buying more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
Jacoba tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente D. la municipalidad D. su localidad. Tienen 4 hijos, pero sólo uno, que aún es estudiante, vive con ellos y los demás ya tienen sus propias familias y son independientes. DesD. hace 17 años se dedica a la costura, a razón D. haber aprendido empíricamente cuando apoyaba a su tía en su labor D. costurera. Actualmente, Jacoba sólo cose y elabora ropa para damas y niños, labor que realiza en su misma casa y donD. cuenta con el apoyo D. una D. sus sobrinas, quien se encarga D. hacer los cortes a las telas. Pero esta no es la única actividad a la que se dedica Jacoba, ya que también es muy buena en la cosmetología y con los cortes D. cabello, oficio que ejerce desD. hace 23 años y ya cuenta con clientes regulares. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es dar lo mejor D. sí para que  sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, además le es rentable porque aparte D. brindar sus servicios D. costura a diversas personas también confecciona ropa que venD. ella misma.
Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta D. trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son buenas personas, solidarias y sobre todo, entre todos se llevan muy bien. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. telas para confeccionar mayor cantidad D. prendas, también adquirirá materiales para su pequeña peluquería.
texts.en:
Jacoba, 51, lives with her husband. He works for the municipality in her area. They have four children, but only one lives with them and is still dependent upon them. The others are independent and have their own families. For 17 years she has devoted herself to dressmaking. She learned how to do this when she helped her aunt with her seamstress work. Currently, Jacoba sews and makes clothes for women and children only. She works at home, where she has the help of one of her nieces who cuts the fabric. But, this is not the only activity Jacoba does. She also is very good at cosmetology and cutting hair. She has been doing that for 23 years, and she has regular customers. What she likes the best about her work is giving the best of herself so that her customers feel satisfied. Also, it is profitable because besides offering her services as a seamstress to various people, she also makes clothes that she sells herself. This is her 13th loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her communal bank is that her colleagues are good people. They are supportive, and above all, they get along very well with each other. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy fabric to make more clothes. She will also get more supplies for her small beauty shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textile materials

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin takes good care of her rice field. A 45-year-old married farmer, she has now four children with the eldest being 26 years old.

For Jasmin, her farming business is very important because it gives her family food to eat and also supports her children’s education. To support her farming, she requested to loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other inputs that Jasmin’s farm needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya S. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit élevage de poulets de chaire. Elle achète des poussins, les élève jusqu'à l'âge adulte et les vend sur pied. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son élevage lui offrent la possibilité de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Rokhaya S. is a 53-year old woman, she is married and she has 4 children in her care. This loan will be invested in her small chicken coop. She purchases chicks, she raises them until they reach a certain age, and then she sells them by travelling door to door. The revenues realized from her farm will allow her to contribute towards her family's support.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small chicken coop

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
En la vivienda del señor Miguel Ángel S., está haciendo falta la barda perimetral. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que contratará para hacer la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo, para realizar su proyecto.
Le preocupa la seguridad de su familia; tiene temor de que pueda pasar algo, en especial a sus dos hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga.
Las personas que aparecen en la imagen son su esposa y sus dos pequeños, él no pudo estar al momento de la visita, su trabajo se lo impidió.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel S. needs to put a fence around his house. But at this time he does not have the necessary means to buy the material or to pay the contractor who would make him the best one. He is requesting a loan because he is worried about the safety of his family, and he fears that something could happen to his two small children. He plans to repay the loan with part of what earns from his job as a truck driver. The people in the picture above are Miguel's wife and his two children. He was not available when the picture was taken since he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 35 years old and married with a 13-year-old daughter. She runs a small retail shop selling sugar, flour, and mchele (rice). She's been in business for three years and has one employee. She also earns some income from working in a salon. She requested this loan from Faulu for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice and sugar.

Faith describes himself as hardworking and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has been empowered by the training. In the future, she hopes to live better and eventually expand her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 39 años, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposo (Jhonny), de 40 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Bryan de 14, Jimena de 6 y Florentino de apenas 10 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en su acogedora casa que es propia, ubicada en la sierra del Perú.

Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa que dedica casi todo el día a atender su negocio en un local alquilado. Hace 19 años decidió implementar un salón de belleza donde pone a prueba toda su habilidad con las manos y donde también da forma a los cabellos de múltiples clientes que la buscan, pues no hay un negocio igual por la zona, por esa razón tiene muy buenas ganancias.
A Blanca le agrada mucho atender en su salón, ya que se entretiene y le alcanza el tiempo para atender a sus hijos. 
Asimismo, hace algunos meses se le ocurrió comprar algunos adornos para venderlos en su mismo local, en una pequeña vitrina; así empezó su pequeño bazar, el cual con el tiempo también ha crecido.
Ella se da abasto sola para sus dos negocios, porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy segura que será puntual y responsable en cada uno de los pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal con sus compañeras del banco comunal que es muy organizado. Blanca tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en equipar su salón de belleza para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y también comprará mercadería para su negocio de venta de adornos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old. She lives peacefully at home with her husband Jhonny, who is 40 years old, and their three children: Bryan (age 14), Jimena (age 6), and Florentino (age 10 months). They live in a cramped house that they own in the mountains of Peru.

She is a very hardworking woman who spends most of her day attending to her business from a rented location. Nineteen years ago, Blanca decided to start a beauty salon where she honed her manual skills for styling the hair of clients who seek her services. There are no other similar businesses like hers in the area, so she is able to generate very good revenues.

Blanca enjoys working at her salon, but she also manages to have time to look after her children. A few months ago, she bought a few decorations to sell from her salon. She keeps these items in a small display case, which was the start of a small bazaar. Over time, this part of her business has grown as well. She is able to cope with having two businesses because it allows her to stay ahead and provide the best for her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Blanca is very confident that she will be responsible in making each of her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members. Her Communal Bank is a very organized group. Blanca will use the loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon to make her customers feel more comfortable. In addition, she will buy merchandise for her decoration sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her beauty salon & decorations to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela B., 57, is a hard working single mom. She makes sure that she provides enough for her family so that they can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for 20 years. She also has her own barbeque stand for extra income.

Angela has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow 11 times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy added stock for her variety store. Her business lets her earn a net profit of PHP 8,800 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 17,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital by buying assorted grocery items for her expanding business. 

She prays for good health so that she will have the energy to manage her developing business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Panji

texts.en:
K. Panji is 46 years, married with 4 children. From an early age he dedicated himself to working the land, having inherited perseverance for this type of work from his parents. He plants different types of vegetables like: wheat, onion, watermelon, etc. Panji has regular clients to his crops, which means his crops have an assured sale. The funds he requests are for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Panji is a hard worker and he believes in the importance of working really hard on his land in order to enable him to get the best results so that he can improve his family's living, put away savings and repay his loan on time.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida A. is from the village of Lumbia in Cagayan de Oro. She is 54 years old. Adelaida is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Adelaida raises and sells pigs and other livestock. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to expand her business. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Adelaida's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies
