location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
La señora Kari inicia abriendo su negocio desde las 5:30 Am vendiendo leche de vaca a sus clientes y a la vez ofrecer variedad de producto concluyendo sus ventas hasta las 9:30 pm, la pulpería esta ubicada en su casa de habitación.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de de granos básicos, pollo, carne, leche, cosméticos y ropa.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Kari es madre soltera de dos hijos la cual ella trabaja arduamente para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Kari opens her store at 5:30am selling cow's milk to her customers. At the same time, she offers a variety of other products and stays open until 9:30pm. Her store is located in her house. The loan will be used to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, milk, cosmetics and clothing. It is worth mentioning that Kari is a single mother of two children for whom she works hard to provide the best for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products like: basic grains, meat, chicken, milk, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Flora Martina

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Flora es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Flora tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Flora son tener local propio y brindar calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the communal bank Laureles. She is 45 years old and is a live-in partner. She has 5 children. She has a restaurant in a rented site where she works every day. Flora needs a loan of $450, which will be used to purchase rice and sugar. Flora's dreams are to own the site of her restaurant and give a better quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Gerardo Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo Porfirio C. C., se dedica a los trabajos de  campos desde hace más de 35 años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de agua en el verano   y en algunas ocasiones el mal invierno, él  inicio con el apoyo de otros agricultores, los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder  hacer trabajos de conservación de suelo, para mejorar  la   producción y venderla a  un mejor precio,  el habita en el municipio de Nindiri , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los ingresos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de 25,18,15 todos varones los mayores ya son independientes; el menor estudia su secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder  brindares una mejores condiciones de vida . Agradece a los fondos Kiva ya que a través de Afodenic, recibe el financiamiento para la comprar de insumos y fertilizantes para la aplicación de dicho cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo Porfirio C. C. has done farm work for more than 35 years. His greatest difficulty is the lack of water in the summer and the occasional bad winter. He started wiht the support of other agricultural workers. His future plan for his crop is to be able to do soil conservation work to improve production and be able to sell at a better price. He lives in the town of Nindiri with his wife who helps with the expenses of the home. They have three children who are 25, 18, and 15 years old, all are male, and the older two live on their own and the youngest studies in high school. His plans for his family are to provide them with a better quality of life. He is thankful for the Kiva loans, as Afodenic has provided the loan money to buy fertilizers for his current crop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ssebuuka Wobadde Group Of Mityana

texts.en:
N. John Baptist is a cheerful 48-year-old married father with seven buoyant and enthusiastic school-going children.

John has been selling produce in Kyandando, Mityana, for the last ten years and with earnings from this fortitude-requiring business, he has managed to educate all his children. His likable nature has allured him to his clientele over these years and it is the reason why he has lasted this long.

John is looking forward to giving his business a greater boost after getting this loan. With this loan he wants to buy more produce like maize, groundnuts (peanuts) and beans. Since he began operating, John says he has been making 240,000 shillings per month.

loans.use: To buy more maize, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Emilio Mardoqueo

texts.es: Emilio Mardoqueo M. P. de 30 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Delicias de Concepción, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a compañera de vida, su padre de 62 años de edad y su madre de 50 años de edad quien se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar. Emilio es un joven muy trabajado quien debe esforzarse por llevar el sustento diario a su familia, ya que en la actualidad es el único que tiene trabajo. Emilio posee una tapicería en la cual se encarga de reparar todo tipo de muebles hechos a base de madera, es muy conocido en su zona de trabajo por realizar excelentes reparaciones. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una pick up con el cual pueda trasportar los muebles reparados para dejarlos a domicilio, esto le permitirá cobrar un poco más de manera que pueda obtener mayores ingresos lo cual sea de muchos beneficios para su hogar.
texts.en:
Emilio Mardoqueo M. P., 30, lives in Delicias de Concepción, Morazán department, with his life partner, his 62-year-old father and his 50-year-old mother, who is in charge of household chores. Emilio is a hard-working young man who must work hard to bring daily support to his family because he is the only one currently working. Emilio has an upholstery shop where he repairs all kinds of wood furniture; he is very well-known in his area because he makes excellent repairs. He is asking for funds with which to buy a pick-up truck so that he can transport the repaired furniture and make home deliveries. This will allow him to charge a bit more so that his income will increase thus providing many benefits for his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pick-up for home deliveries.

loans.name: Magaly Diana

texts.es:
La señora  Magaly Domínguez es socia de banco comunal Luz y Vida hace nueve ciclos, vive  en una casa arrendada  con sus hijos de 8 años y dos meses de edad y su esposo que trabaja en una mecánica en la comunidad El  Aguacate en el sector Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra  ubicada a 2.550 metros de altura en la parte sur de la cordillera ecuatoriana, es la tercera ciudad más grande  e importante del  Ecuador después de Quito y Guayaquil y desde 1999 ha sido designada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO.  Aquí encontramos  numerosas iglesias que son un símbolo de  religiosidad impuesta por los españoles a nuestros antepasados donde podemos visualizar  una arquitectura imponente con valiosos detalles en mármol y oro.

Magali tiene 31 años de edad es una mujer  muy activa ya que siempre busca la manera de generar ingresos económicos para su hogar vendiendo comida los viernes, compra y vende yogurt en su comunidad y también se dedica a criar pollos tanto para el  consumo de su familia como para la venta.  Con el  crédito comprará más  pollos y  alimento como maíz, engorde, etc.  para su crianza.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a  tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Magaly Domínguez, 31, has been a member of the “Luz y Vida” (Light & Life) communal bank for nine cycles; she lives in a rented house with her children, who are 8 years old and 2 months old, and her husband, who is a mechanic, in El Aguacate, Monay sector, Cuenca. Cuenca is located 2550 meters above sea level in the south part of the Ecuadorean Andes; it’s Ecuador’s third most important city after Quito and Guayaquil. Since 1999 it has been designated Patrimony of Humanity by UNESCO. One finds numerous churches here which are a symbol of the religion imposed by our Spanish ancestors and where we can admire imposing architecture with valuable marble and gold details. Magaly is a very active woman who always seeks to generate income for her home by selling prepared meals every Friday; she also is a yoghurt merchant and raises chickens both for family consumption and for sale. She will use the funds to buy more chicks and food like corn and chicken feed. Her greatest wish is to have her own home someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, corn and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is currently in the business of selling bags of sugar, beans, and maize flour at the store and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of such goods to sell. Mary is 49 years old and is widowed. She has 8 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike and build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of such goods to sell

loans.name: Zoila Hortencia

texts.es:
Zoila de 25 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Para el bienestar de sus dos hijos ella decidió hace un año invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos en su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella ha trabajado desde las 06h00am hasta las 19h00pm, ahora no solo vende víveres sino también verduras y legumbres. Ella quiere continuar con su tienda porque la ha ayuda a tener mas tiempo con sus hijos. 

Para poder incrementarla mas con alimentos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres, carnes y frutas. En el futuro quiere tener mas ingresos para poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Zoila is 25 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, a place located where most of its inhabitants are of limited means. For the well being of her two children, she decided to invest her savings and buy foodstuffs to sell out of her home one year ago. Little by little and with much effort, she has been working from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and now she also sells vegetables and beans. She wants to continue running her store because it allows her to spend more time with her children. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more beans, vegetables, and meats. Someday she would like to have enough of an income in order to be able to buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Bonifacio Higinio

texts.es:
El señor Bonifacio Higinio R. es viudo y tiene bajo a su responsabilidad un hijo adolescente que actual mente esta estudiando. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder pagar gastos escolares de su hijo para que pueda terminar el siclo escolar sin ningún problema y que pronto terminara su carrera profesional. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene como oficial de tráfico escolar en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
texts.en:
Mr. Bonifacio Higinio R. is widowed and is responsible for and adolescent who is carrying out his studies. The loan will be used to pay for educational expenses so his son can finish out the school cycle without a problem and can soon complete a professional degree. He plans to pay for the loan with his income gained as a school crossguard in the city of Neuvo Laredo.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational Expenses

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala eastern region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, who are not in school.  For less than a year, Betty has operated a business selling snacks, such as fish and chips. To help expand her business, Betty is requesting a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy oil for cooking.  Betty hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to add more capital to her business. In the future, Betty hopes to own a big shop.

Note to lenders:
BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva that funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.

The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.

Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more oil for cooking

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina C. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 57 years old and is married with five adult children. Florentina owns and operates a business tending a canteen near the school. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Loida's Group

texts.en: Loida C. is from the village of San Roque. She is 39 years old and is the group leader of this six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Loida C.'s Group. Loida is single. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Loida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Loida is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 12th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 52-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a businesswoman and together they have five children, ages 23, 19, 17, 15 and 13 years old. He lives in a family of ten people. He has a produce business, purchasing cereals like maize, rice and beans for reselling at a profit. He has been at it for the last 20 years. Joseph says the biggest challenge he faces is the fluctuating prices of his produce. Sometimes the prices hit a low, meaning his profit is low for that period. However, he says it is a profitable venture and he would like to develop it further. Joseph intends to use this loan to purchase beans, rice and maize for reselling at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice and maize for reselling at a profit

loans.name: Benegna

texts.en:
Benegna S. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Benegna is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Benegna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Benegna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Benegna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benegna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benegna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mariambubu's Group

texts.en:
Mariambubu M. is the leader of the group. She is 38 and married to a farmer. Together they are raising four children. In order to make money Mariambubu works as a cleaner at school. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a calf in order to increase the number of cattle.
 
Gulzar A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 28 and married. She has four children. Gulzar and her husband are farmers. They make money by selling cattle and milk. With money received from the loan Gulzar wants to purchase a cow.

Nurbek K., 40, is married. He has three children. In order to earn money, Nurbek breeds livestock animals and his wife sells convenience goods in the shop. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase five sheep for breeding. 

Aidai K., 20, is married. She has a newborn child.  Aidai and her husband are farmers. They hope to obtain the loan because they need money to purchase 100 liters of fuel which is needed for cultivating the land.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Donald Fidencio

texts.es:
Donald Fidencio de 33 años de edad es soltero, es pequeño productor de la Comarca Villa Alvarez del municipio de Nueva Guinea, cuenta con el apoyo de su hemano que le ayuda en las labores del campo. 

Donald esta solicitando su 2do crédito con el objetivo de invertido en siembra de pasto mejorado,  que le permitira asegurar la alimentación del ganado en tiempo de verano y así mantener su hato ganadero con buen desarrollo y tener mayor peso del ganado y producción de leche.  

Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar su hato ganadero para que cuando forme su propia familia pueda brindarle buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Donald Fidencio is 33 years old and single.  He is a small producer in the Villa Alvarez region in the town of Nueva Guinea.  He has the support of his brother who helps him with the field work.  

Donald is requesting his second loan so that he can invest in grass seed to improve his pasture.  This will allow him to insure that his cattle are fed in the summer season, that his herd will develop well, gain more weight and produce milk.  

His dream is to be able to increase his herd size so that when he has his own family he can give them a good quality life.

loans.use: To purchase grass seed to improve his pasture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, etc. for resale

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Angela M. is in her early sixties and is married with seven children. For the past ten years, Angela has been running a general store from which she sells basic goods. The business is open between 05:00 am and 08:00 pm daily and earns Angela a low monthly profit. 

This will be Angela's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Angela used her previous loans to increase her stock of flour and other basic goods. These loans have since been successfully repaid. With her third loan, Angela aims to once again increase her stock, as well as pay school fees for her children. Angela's dream is to one day expand her business to a large store. 

Angela will share this loan with her loan group Haki Sawa, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Angela can be seen as the first on the right.

loans.use: School Fees

loans.name: Oung

texts.en: Oung K., age 30, lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a housewife and she always stays at home to do some housework and manage other property in and around her house. She always cooks a nice meal for all members in the family, does some daily duties such as cleaning the house, washing clothes, and caring for her three children. Oung K.’s husband is skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his customers to construct their houses. Presently, he lacks funds to purchase additional equipment for construction to provide his building service. Therefore, Oung K. will use her loan to assist her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction equipment

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzmila; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia es ama de casa, se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y de su casa , por el momento es la única actividad que realiza ya que después desea buscar un empleo el cual le pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y ella pueda sentirse mejor. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su hogar de primera necesidad y para su uso personal.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Luzmila is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She is a housewife who looks after her child and her home.  At the moment, this is the only activity that she carries out since she later wants to look for a job which will enable her to provide her child with a better quality of life and enable herself to feel better.

Luzmila is requesting this loan to buy essentials for her household and for personal use.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy essentials for her household and for personal use

loans.name: Kathem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 35-year-old husband and father of four children.

In 2000, Kathem opened his own audio-systems’ maintenance store. He repairs and sells different audio-system equipment. He is becoming well known in his region and has an excellent reputation.

He applied for a $2,700 loan in 2010 because of his need to repair and renovate his store’s floor and walls. He is aiming to expand his business and make it bigger.

loans.use: To repair and renovate his store’s floor and walls

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, ella tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de seis años el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días ya es en esos días que llegan los pescadores de alta mar y es allí que aprovecha de hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, entre lo que más vende están los perfumes y los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The communal bank Estrella De Belén [Star of Bethlehem] meets bimonthly in the Santa Marianita neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city know for its beautiful beaches visited by national and foreign tourists in every season of the year.  Here, the majority of residents work in the fishing industry.  

Señora María is 25 years old, married and has a six year old son that attends elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 loan cycles and is pleased because the interest rate is much lower than other lending institutions.  

She works at home taking care of her family.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories)  in order to have her own resources.  She works three days a week, selling her products on credit.  She collects payments bimonthly when the fishermen return from the high seas.  This is when she makes most of her sales.  She receives her products at home and her biggest sellers are perfumes and cosmetics.  

She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  Right now she lives with her parents and her dream is to one day have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru is a 32-year-old business man. He is married and has three children, aged 18, 8 and 5. All of his children are school-going children.
 
Umaru started his plastic utensil business in 2000. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Umaru opens his business every day from 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Umaru has a good loan repayment history. 

He needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) to buy more stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 354,000. 

In the future, Umaru plans to build a house and educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic utensils

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 years old, married and a father of four. He has operated a matatu (van) transport business for two years and employs one person. He also does farming to earn extra income. John hopes to own two more vans in five years' time. He joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, to easily access financial resources. He has therefore requested a loan of 20,000 KES to repair his van.

loans.use: To repair his van

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Harriet   has a business of a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Harriet sells her products in the market, by means of retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more braids and cream relaxers.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of braids and cream relaxers. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked and bridal salon. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Francisco Pavel

texts.es: Francisco Pavel tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Con mucho esfuerzo logro obtener este negocio. El inicia esta actividad hace más de 8 años, pues cuando inicio solamente con muy pocos productos pues no tenía el capital suficiente para aumentar su inventarios, pues con el paso del tiempo fue que con la ayuda de los financiamientos le ayudaron a crecer con este tipo de actividad. El se encarga de realizar todas las labores de su hogar. El quiere realizar este financiamiento para la compra  granos básicos, queso, pollo, huevos, gaseosas, jabón y golosinas. Su deseo es hacer su negocio más grande.
texts.en: Francisco Pavel, 57, has a general store that he was able to open with a lot of effort.  He began this business more than 8 years ago but he started with only a few products since he didn’t have enough capital to increase his inventory.  As time went by and with some financing help he was able to grow the business.  He takes care of all of the work in his house.  Francisco will use the loan to buy basic grains, cheese, chicken, eggs, soft drinks, soap and sweets.  His wish is to enlarge the business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cheese, chicken, eggs, soft drinks, soap and sweets

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
María, resiD. en EL Transito departamento D. San Miguel, vive en casa propia y tiene 5 hijos con quienes trabaja en el campo, ella se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una gran experiencia porque desD. niña se dedica a esta actividad, siembra dos manzanas D. terreno D. maíz, chile y pipián, sus hijos le ayudan muchísimo a realizar el trabajo. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y para preparar el terreno donD. hará el cultivo, también comprara unas plantitas D. chile, esta inversión le ayudara para dar inicio a la nueva siembra ya que se acerca el invierno.
Su objetivo es mejorar cada año sus cultivos, tener mejores condiciones económicas con sus hijos y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  She lives in her own home and has five childen with whom she works in the fields.  María is a farmer.  She has a lot of experience because she has been farming since she was a young girl.  She sows two 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land with corn, chili and pipián (a type of squash).  Her children help her a lot in her work.

María is requesting a loan to buy manure and prepare the land where she will grow her crops.  She will also buy some small chili plants.  This investment will help her to start her new crops growing as winter is approaching. 

María's goals are to improve her crops every year, to be in a better financial situation with her children and to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare her land for planting crops

loans.name: Ruth Elisa

texts.es:
Ruth, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la confección y comercialización de hamacas, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, su oficio es confeccionar hamacas, carteras y bordar mantas, el negocio tiene 5 años de existir.
Ella solicita un préstamo para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, con el financiamiento cancelara la introducción del agua potable, esta será una gran ayuda para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Las aspiraciones de Ruth son, mejorar la vivienda, que sus hijos sean aplicados al estudio y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en: Ruth lives in Delicias de Concepción in the department of Morazán.  She makes and sells hammocks.  She is 30 years old, and lives with her husband and two children who are 4 and 11 years old.  She makes hammocks and wallets and embroiders blankets.  The business is 5 years old.  She is asking for a loan to make improvements to her house.  With the money, she will pay off the introduction of potable water.  This will be of great help in improving the quality of life of her and her family.  Ruth's aspiration is to improve her house so that her children can apply themselves to studying and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for the introduction of potable water in her house.

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past 17 years, Stephene has been operating a business selling eggs door-to-door to his neighbours and passersby using his bicycle.  In his business, he faces a major challenge in transporting his goods. He dreams of establishing a retail shop to sell eggs in the future.       

With the loan for Kshs 10,000, Stephene wants to purchase 60 crates of eggs to resell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase 60 crates of eggs to  resell

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab is a 35 year-old woman who lives with her family members in a small house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She does housework in her neighbor’s house, earning approximately US $1 each day. Her husband works in construction. Chab has requested a loan to purchase a second motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and to run a motor taxi part-time. The couple has three single children, all of whom are studying in a local school.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and to run a motor taxi part-time.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de sonido, el socio alquila en diferentes eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños y bautizos, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de alquiler de sonido. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar parlantes y algunos repuestos para los equipos de sonidos. 
                                                  
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Yahuar Maqui" located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

He is 51 years old, lives with his partner and has 3 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his sound system services business.  He works various events such as weddings, birthdays and baptisms. Through this business he is able to provide for his children.  He wants to expand his sound business, so he is requesting a loan to buy speakers and spare parts for his sound system 
                                                  
He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: purchase speakers and spare parts for his sound system.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Marivic has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.
Marivic is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en:
Mukadas is married with three children. She sells women's shoes at the central local market. Mukadas has had a rich experience working in the sphere of sales because she started as a salesperson. She decided to take a chance and launch her own enterprise six years ago and has enjoyed every second of being self-employed. Mukadas is hoping to purchase a vending kiosk to run her business more efficiently and facilitate her sales. Mukadas is very responsible and perseverant. We believe her strategic planning and prudence will help her achieve her business goals as well as her individual goals in life.  
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria del Pilar tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia la  cual está ubicada en el Caserío Las Mónicas  en el distrito de Tambogrande, esta es una zona rural del distrito pero solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

Maria del Pilar se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en el paradero de un caserío cercano a su comunidad, ella atiende todos los días y tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio, por lo que cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente María del  pilar tiene una bodega instalada en su vivienda la misma que es atendida por su hija cuando ella no se  encuentra. 

María del Pilar esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar mas insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, de esta manera María del Pilar podrá preparar comida en una mayor cantidad y abastecer a un mayor numero de clientes. Ella también espera comprar mas mercadería para su bodega, como productos de primera necesidad o de uso domestico, que son los de mayor rotación en su zona   

María del Pilar a demostrado ser una persona muy puntual y responsable, ella es una mujer trabajadora que desea poder ayudar a su esposo y de esta manera logar que su familia alcance una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Pilar, 34, is married and has two children in her care.  She lives in her own house located in Caserío Las Mónicas in Tambogrande District.  This is the rural part of the district so the only utility she has is electricity.

María del Pilar prepares food to sell at the bus stop in a neighboring hamlet.  She works every day and has several years experience in this business so she has an established base of regular local customers.  In addition, María also has a home-based grocery store that her daughter tends to when she’s not home.

María del Pilar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan so that she can buy more ingredients needed to prepare her food so that she can make larger amounts and sell to a larger number of customers.  She also hopes to buy more merchandise for her store like basic need or domestic use items which are the best sellers in her area.

María del Pilar has shown herself to be a very punctual and responsible person.  She is a very hard working woman who wants to help her husband and so that they can lead their family to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her food and to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 36, 39 y 40 años de edad, cada uno tiene su propio hogar, él se dedica a la tapicería  de muebles de madera y de vehículos, lleva 21 años dedicándose al negocio, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am  a 3:00pm.
Actualmente el necesita comprar telas, pinturas, pegamento, para tapizar, por lo que le es necesario un préstamo que le solvente esta compra, con ello estará obteniendo los materiales para poder continuar brindando el servicio.
La aspiración de Sergio, es tener una tapicería con mayor capacidad, con buen servicio y que sea rentable para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is married living with his wife.  He has three children who are 36, 39 and 40 years old; each has their own house.  He upholsters wood furniture and cars.  He’s been in business 21 years and works every day from 7am until 3pm.

At present, he needs to buy fabric, paint and glue to upholster so he needs a loan to pay for this purchase.  With it he will be acquiring the materials needed to continue providing this service.

Sergio’s hope is to have a larger upholstery shop providing good service so that it will be profitable and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint and glue to upholster.

loans.name: Miriam Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos de tela polar; tiene experiencia de 5 años  su puesto de venta se encuentra en una de las calles mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  sale a vender los días de feria que son los miércoles y sábados  los cuales son días en los cuales están habilitados para realizar la comercialización de mercadería,  los días en que no sale a vender trabaja como chofer de su propio vehículo en una línea de taxi trufis,  vive en domicilio familiar de sus papas, tiene tres hijos actualmente se hace cargo de los estudios y manutención de sus hijos; su esposo se encuentra en España trabajando; su trabajo es sacrificado ya que sale a realizar sus actividades en la madrugada; la señora indica que el crédito que se le otorgo es de gran ayuda porque con este dinero aumentara capital de trabajo adquiriendo mercadería y realizando el mantenimiento de su vehículo para que pueda desarrollar su actividad en el transporte.
texts.en: Miriam sells children's and adults' fleece clothing. She has 5 years' experience doing this. Her sales stall is on one of the most busy streets in the city of   Cochabamba. She goes out to sell on market days, which are Wednesdays and Saturdays, the days they are able to go out and sell merchandise. On the days she doesn't sell, she works as a driver in her own vehicle for a taxi service. She lives in her parents' house and has three children. She takes care of her children's studies and support; her husband is working in Spain. Her work is hard since she has to go out at dawn. She indicates that the loan is a big help because this money will increase her working capital, acquiring merchandise and maintaining her vehicle so that she can develop her transportation activity.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui pratique le maraichage sur des terres de plus d'un hectares léguées par ses parents.Il a arrété ses études au lycée et s'est directement engagé dans l'activité agricole qui l'a de tout temps passioné.Il a démarré l'exploitation des terres en 2001 et s'est ensuite marié.Il est aujourd'hui père de deux enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il cultive des choux, des tomates, des piments et des oignons. Son activité lui permet de bien entretenir sa famille. Il sollicite un pret à l'UIMCEC de 400000F pour réaliser un puits firage dans son champs, ou l'eau n'est réllement disponible suffisament que durant l'hivernage. Son ambition est d'élargir et d'équiper son exploitation.
texts.en: Edouard is a young man who runs a market garden on over a hectare of land inherited from his parents. He left high school in order to start farming, an occupation which he has always been passionate about. He started farming the land in 2001, and then got married. Today, he is the father of 2 children, who both go to school. He grows cabbages, tomatoes, peppers and onions. His business allows him to take care of his family properly. He is asking for a 400 000 francs loan from UIMCEC so that he can drill a well in his field, which does not get enough water, except during the winter months. His goal is to equip and grow his business.

loans.use: to fund a well drilling project.

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen is a 47-year-old uneducated lady. She was not able to get an education due to the poor financial condition of her family. She learned how to carry out household responsibilities from her mother and now performs her job as a housewife very well.  
Khalida's husband is involved in a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits by visiting different areas of the city  on his bicycle, and in this way he generates income for the family. 
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy fruits and vegetables to diversify his products so he earns better profits and reaches the maximum number of customers. Khalida is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: 0306029-Quang Trung -Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thuỷ works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell in the future.

Thuỷ is 30 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 0306029 Quang Trung Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. 

She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents (she lives with an old mother).

In 2008, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thuỷ has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes to maintain her business, to remodel her house and to make enough money to provide for her kid.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro de 28 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 3 años Pedro se dedica a la compra y venta de arroz en cáscara y pilado, actividad en la cual no tiene mucha competencia, cuenta con su propia clientela en la misma zona donde vive, pero también le realizan pedidos en Piura, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar las obligaciones de su hogar.

Pedro al observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído conveniente solicitar  un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de arroz en cáscara y pilado para abastecer su negocio y los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, con las ganancias podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro, 28, lives with his family in his own home, which has only electricity, located in the district of Morropón in the department of Piura.  This area is known for agriculture and livestock.

For three years Pedro has been buying and selling rice in the husk and processed.  There isn't much competition in this business.  He has his own customers in the same area where he lives, but he also fulfills orders in Piura.  With his earnings he will be able to pay for his household expenses.

Pedro, observing that his business is growing, has believed it convenient to request a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy wholesale rice in the husk and processed, to supply his business and his customers' orders.  With the profits he will be able to cover his loan and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice in the husk and processed, to supply his business and his customers.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a Palestinian National Authority employee with modest salary. He lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Gaza in Palestine. He wants to change some home furniture and appliances and purchase new ones such as: refrigerator, washing machine, living room seats, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he wants to get a loan from FATEN. When Ibrahem gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new home furniture and appliances that he needs to live in better home conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the FATEN branch.

About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Soltanmurat

texts.en:
Soltanmurat is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is an unemployed woman who stays at home, and his three kids are all college and high school students. He started his transportation business in 1997 with his own van. At first, he was transporting people only within the province. Now he takes people to Russia, and also buys groceries from Russia and sells them. 

Soltanmurat is requesting 2,600,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair his van. With winter approaching, he needs to perform these repairs and save some supplies. He is a strong and diligent man who says "I will do everything I can in order to educate my kids".

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his van

loans.name: Amalia Leticia

texts.es:
Amalia Leticia es soltera, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la artesanía al tejidos de telas típicas, inició este trabajo como operaria para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales consistente en hijos de mish y otra clase de diferente colores, ya que quiere incrementar su producción de telas típicas. y  en el futuro contar con operarios.
texts.en:
Amalia Leticia is 40 years old, single, and completed four years of her primary school education. She makes woven handicrafts out of traditional materials. She started working at an operator for another business and now has two years of experience.

Amalia is requesting a loan to buy materials such as two-ply thread of different types and colors. She wants to increase her production of traditional fabrics. In the future, she wants to hire workers.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving.

loans.name: Cristhian Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Cristhian tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres. Nos cuenta que tiene Despensa en la Ciudad de Villarrica, el cual está en un lugar bastante conocido en el centro y además muy concurrido.
Heredo el negocio de su madre, quien ya tenia una buena cantidad de clientes, pero el lo fue mejorando el negocio y ahora ya es más que exitoso. El joven hoy en día se encarga de la administración, y el local permanece abierto hasta alta horas de la noche.
Acude a Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda, que quiere invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás, con lo cual puede abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a young man of 26. He is single and lives with his parents. He talks about his general store in the city of Villarrica, which is well-known in the city center and also a busy area. 

He inherited this business from his mother, who already had a good number of customers. However, he continued to improve it, and today it is more than successful. Today, this young man is in charge of managing the business, and the store remains open late into the night. 

He came to the Fundación Paraguaya to gain access to a small amount of help, which he would like to invest in buying products of daily use, such as sugar, noodles, rice, yerba maté, and other items, with which he can stock his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, yerba maté and other products.

loans.name: Muyanda Group

texts.en:
Yohana is the facilitator of the Muyanda group. Yohana and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Yohana takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Yohana had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Yohana was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Yohana and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Yohana will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Muyanda group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Walter Otieno

texts.en: Walter is 46 years old, married, and has a twenty-five-year-old son. He describes himself as an aggressive businessman. He has been selling tea leaves to retailers for the last three years.The business location is at a fast growing place. His business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to add to his stock of tea leaves. He will use the loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more tea leaves to sell. In the future, he hopes  to be the best tea supplier in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves and paper for packaging.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco esta ciudad del sureste del Perú ubicada en la vertiente oriental de la Cordillera de los Andes). 

Griselda tiene 35 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo de 13 trece años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo, ella trabaja en una empresa de servicio de encomiendas y su cargo es coordinadora de entrega y recepción de encomiendas, ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche en dos turnos. Ya son 4 años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo. Griselda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para ahorrar y para uso personal, ella específicamente va usar el credito para la educación y alimentación de su hija. Su sueño de Griselda es tener su propio negocio y está pensando abrir una cabina de internet o un multiservicios. 

Griselda es integrante del grupo “Emprendedores” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Griselda was born in the city of Cusco (Cusco is a city in the south-east of Peru, located in the eastern part of the Andes mountain range).

Griselda is 35 years old and is married; from this marriage she has a 13-year-old child.  She combines her household activities with her work; she works for a company that provides parcel service, and her role is coordinator of package delivery and receipt.  She works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night, in two shifts.  She has been doing this work for four years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts into her work.

On this occasion Griselda is requesting a loan for savings and personal use.  More specifically, she will use the loan for the education and food for her child.  Griselda's dream is to have her own business, and she is thinking about opening an internet cabin or a multi-service business.

Griselda is a member of the "Emprendedores" ["Entrepreneurs"] group, which is made up of 12 members who live in the city of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco in Peru.

loans.use: for her child's education and food.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 32 years old, married to Katunge, and has one child. He has been in the farming business for the last seven years and he earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 15,000, which he will use to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

In the future, he hopes to buy a new water pump and a piece of land for large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es: Doña Eadia, de 42 años de edad, habitante de comarca el Triunfo, se desempeña como docente de primaria desde hace 8 años,  solicita su 9no crédito a esta institución para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es acondicionar su cuartito embaldozandolo y repellandolo, y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su marido el cual se desempeña como albañil ambos son unidos y comparten con los deberes del hogar y con los compromisos, en su comunidad es una persona con buenas referencias personales y también labores. Su sueño es gozar de salud, trabajo y que la familia sigan unidos.
texts.en:
Eadia is 42, and lives in the Triunfo region. She has been working as a primary teacher for eight years. 

She is applying to this institution for her ninth loan, to invest in home improvements that involve fixing up a small room, by tiling and plastering it. In this way she will have better living conditions in her home.

She has the support of her husband, who is a construction worker. They are a close couple, and share the household duties as well as their commitments. In her community, she is a person with good personal and work references. 

Her dream is to enjoy good health, and that her family stay close-knit.

loans.use: To fix up a room, by tiling and plastering.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 27-year old married man with two children, living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He provides motorcycle transport services and has been in that business for six years.  He also rears cattle.  His challenge has been high fuel costs and accidents.  His dream is to buy another motorcycle and expand his cattle farm.  Godfrey needs this loan to to buy a cow for milking.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Shatha's Group

texts.en:
Shatha is a member of this group from Iraq Shatha, is a 40 years old divorced woman. After the divorce she had hard time to support herself. Shatha has a beauty salon providing hair styling, cuts and coloring, face massage, make-up and beauty care to support herself. 
When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for divorced women she took a loan to buy air-conditioner and chair. She is aiming to increase business and change her Salon to a beauty center.
The story of Shatha  and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic developments clients .
They preferred to blur their faces for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Shatha's Group's 3,000 loan helped a member to buy air-conditioner and chair.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура очень благодарно за Вашу искреннюю поддержку. Она с Вашей помощи до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свое любимое дело. У Манзуры увеличилось количество клиентов. Она хочет взять кредит и расширить деятельность. За счет кредита она купить ткани для шитья мешков и сумки. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей сохранить деятельность. Мавзуна верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли больше ткани.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Minkend village. He is married. He settled with family and 2 children in Sumgait city. This 42-year-old man, Yahya started his business 10 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 9 sheep. He spent the second loan $900 to buy 13 sheep. Third time he borrowed $1200 and bought 5 calves. It is necessary to note that Yahya is the one of the active clients of Normicro. 
Now he is planning to buy 8 sheep and 5 calves. Yahya applies for a loan amounting 1800$.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep and 2 calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi Nungari Ng’anga intends to build 2 semi-permanent houses and install electricity

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim S. has 5 children. In 1993 he became an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorny-Karabakh. His small business, which includes one cow and some chickens, brings him meager income. To make his life better he has requested a $1,200 loan to broaden his business and purchase 1 cow and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Evelyn Mbilah

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Evelyn is married and a mother of five. Her husband does not make sufficient money to meet the educational and health needs of their children. This need and her desire to see her children educated and independent are her motivations. Her determination coupled with her training in marketing techniques and credit management, as well as experience in making uniforms (a skill she acquired as a young girl) have led her to start a business making uniforms and table place mats.

With a loan of $100 she plans to build her skills in taking credit and repaying timely. She said she will ask for bigger amounts once she is comfortable and sure of her ability to take and repay loans under agreed conditions. The first loan repayment installment shall commence at the end of the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Sewing of uniforms and table mats

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yoeurn started her business weaving silk in 1969, after her neighbor taught her how to weave. However, she stopped weaving during the Khmer Rouge regime from 1975-1979, and she began weaving again in mid 1979. She also rolls cigarettes to sell at home.

Mrs. P. was married in 1972, and has 7 children, 4 sons and 3 daughters. Of the 6 children whom she supports at home, some are students, and some are working. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She also wants to use some of the money to purchase fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
Gladys has dedicated herself to agriculture for the past 22 years. Since she started her home next to her beloved husband, she wished to offer the best to the children to come. Years later, Gladys still works for that reason and because she enjoys cultivating the land. She gets up very early every day to tend to her usual chores in the field, in company of her inseparable partner during sowing season. The harsh cold weather that impacts the sierras of her country has damaged her crops in previous years and the expected income has always been affected. Nonetheless, she wishes to maintain the hopes of increasing her income with this activity, in order to see her six children prosper. For this reason she is thinking of increasing her selection of crops with a greater variety of seeds. Gladys is requesting a loan in order to meet her goals and thanks you for your collaboration. In order to provide the best to her children, she will continue working with great effort and love.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys ya lleva 22 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Desde que formalizó su hogar al lado de su querido esposo, deseó ofrecerle lo mejor a los hijos que vendrían; ahora, pasados los años, Gladys sigue trabajando por esta razón y porque cada día le agrada labrar la tierra. Siempre se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a sus acostumbradas labores en el campo, en compañía de su inseparable socio en épocas de siembra. El fuerte frío que azota la sierra de su país ha perjudicado su cosecha en años anteriores y las ganancias que pensaban obtener siempre se han visto perjudicadas. Sin embargo quiere seguir manteniendo la esperanza de incrementar sus ingresos económicos con esta actividad, para ver a sus seis hijos totalmente superados y es por ello que piensa ampliar sus productos de siembra con mayor variedad de semillas. Gladys solicita un préstamo para cumplir sus anhelos y agradece tu colaboración y, para darle lo mejor a sus hijos, seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y amor.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity and variety of seeds in order to optimize the quality of her crops.

loans.name: Evelina Ma

texts.en: Evelina is a new member at the Fusi Saluafata Centre. With the approval from the Centre Chief and the members, now she can join SPBD. She is in her mid-fifties and a grandmother, but she is very happy with this opportunity because she never had a chance to get a loan from any financial company in Samoa. Her business was started long ago but she needs to upgrade or replace some of her equipment. She is learning how to budget income and expenses for the business. Evelina also gets some assistance from family overseas.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Olinda's Group

texts.en:
Olinda and Margarita have been members of the community bank “Sumaqcha” for four and one years, respectively. In that time they have learned how to continue improving their business, and to save. They have also learned about nutrition and women’s health.

Olinda is 30 and has one son. She has owned a salon and sold cosmetics for the past five years. Previously, she was trained in information technology and previously worked in an office. After her son was born she preferred the flexible schedule of owning her own business.

Margarita is 32 and has 2 young children. She has been renting rooms out in her house for the past three years. In addition, with this loan she will open a small grocery store also located in her house. She says that she and her husband are always thinking of new business ideas and eventually he would like to open a café as well. Since joining the community bank she has been able to buy a television and a refrigerator.

Olinda and Margarita need loans of 450 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in scissors, cosmetics, hair care products and basic grocery items. They dream of owning a home, or a nicer home, and that their children will finish school.

loans.use: Olinda and Margarita need loans of 450 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in scissors, cosmetics, hair care products and basic grocery items.

loans.name: Kadiba South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma N.. She is currently in the business of selling rice at a wholesale level and is requesting a loan to expand business. Fatuma is 36 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children and both of them do not go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Zalika N., and Edith N.. Aidah N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to boost business. Zalika N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Edith N. operates a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock.

loans.use: Purchase more rice for sale

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hạnh, 50 years old, is a cadre of the village’s women association and also a member of the TYM Fund since 1996. In 9 years, she invested all the funds from her loans to her refreshment stand that she had at her house. The income was adequate. In 2005, she changes her business to selling fertilizer and raising cattle. The income increases significantly to 8USD a day. Her 4 children are all grown up and have jobs at the Agriculture Center of Nội Bài. They help their mother to make the payments when she is in need. With a good plan, she is applying for a loan of 1200USD to buy feed and juvenile fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Hạnh, 50 tuổi, là cán bộ Hội phụ nữ xã và là thành viên Quỹ TYM năm 1996. Trong 9 năm vay vốn chị Hạnh đầu tư vào bán hàng giải khát tại nhà, thu nhập cũng tương đối ổn định. Năm 2005 chị chuyển sang kinh doanh phân bón, chăn nuôi bò sinh sản, thả cá. Thu nhập tăng lên rõ rệt, bình quân mỗi ngày 8USD. 4 người con của chị Hạnh đều đã trưởng thành và đi làm công nhân khu công nghiệp Nội Bài nên hỗ trợ mẹ rất nhiều trong việc hoàn trả vốn vay khi có khó khăn. Dự án đang phát triển tốt, vòng vốn này chị Hạnh xin vay 1200USD mua thức ăn chăn nuôi và cá giống.

loans.use: Buy feed and juvenile fish

loans.name: Mariam's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 31 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are ages 14, 12 and 9. Mariam owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Samila, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.en: D. Mehrubon is 40 years old. She has two children. She is a widow. That is why she is the main bread-winner in the family. Mehrubon has been running her business for almost ten years. She sells candies and sweets in the local market . Her sons help her with the business. She works very hard to give her dearest sons a good education and to make them happy. Mehrubon is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 4 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her.

loans.use: To purchase candies to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia started her business to help with her family's household costs. Her husband's salary as a laborer in the fields was not enough to cover their expenses nor support their six children. She began her business by selling a small piece of land she'd inheritied and investing the money in a small clothing stand. Little by little she has grown the business and helped improve the quality of life for her family.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and increase her sales.

Leticia inició el negocio para complementar el gasto familiar ya que con el sueldo de su esposo quien se dedica a labores del campo no les alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar ademas de la manutencion de su 6 hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio con el dinero de un terreno que le heredaron y que vendio, puso un pequeño puesto de ropa , mismo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco y es lo que le ha permitido darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi lograr impulsar sus ventas .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO HELP SUPPORT HER FAMILY

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. José is 60 years old. He is the father of 3 children that have their own families and makes enough to support Mrs. Estela, he wife. José is the owner of a motorcar and he works providing transport to passenger as he has for quite some time, and he works hard to give his wife the things she needs to live securely and happily. Previously José raised chickens but he gave up that work due to health reasons, and now he would like to sell groceries and staple products. José is a dedicated and enterprising father and he would like to continue his family's financial growth but he needs a loan to complete his objectives such as fixing his motorcar. With your help, Mr. José will realize his goals in no time at all.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José tiene 60 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, los mismos que ya tienen su propia familia, su esposa la señora Estela lo apoya bastante. José es propietario de un motocarro y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde ya tiempo atrás, él trabaja duro por brindarle a su esposa lo necesario y ambos vivan felices y tranquilos.Anteriormente José se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, pero lo dejó por motivos de salud, y ahora quiere vender abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. José es un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo, sin embargo, requiere de un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo, como también arreglar su motocarro. Con tu ayuda el señor José logrará su meta en el tiempo menos esperado.

loans.use: To repair his motorcar and to start a small store

loans.name: Firudun

texts.en: 5 years ago, Firudun started this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1968. He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the foodstuffs to expand his wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: This is the fifth time of Mrs. Mork C. L. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She lives in Trapaing Pouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she sells rice and farms. Her husband, Mr. Muth Art is a fisherman and pig breeder. His fishing business is facing a small problem, because his boat is too old. So, Mrs. Mork C. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Mork C. L. is 34 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Mrs. Mork C. L. had previously obtained a loan to buy a pump for watering her plantation, which she fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Marisa Judith

texts.es: Marisa  Judith C. A. es una mujer que tiene un hijo por el cual la motiva tener deseo de superarse ella se dedica a poner uñas de acrílico de todas formas y colores.
